loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El sr. Jose R. G. utilisara su credito para poner techo en su negocio ya que el trabaja por las mañanas en presidencia municipal y por las tardes se dedica a su negocio que es de bulcanizadora y por las tardes el sol esta muy fuerte y su negocio le da el sol de frente por lo cual el pondra techo de lamina para protejerse de los rayos de el sol y dela lluvia y asi sus clientes estaran mas comodos ya que el se tarda de 20 a 30 minutos en reparar una llanta y su herramienta estara mas protejida por que cuando llueve no se le mojaria  y no correria ningun riesgo en la herramienta electrica.
texts.en: Sr. Jose R. G. will use this loan to install a roof over his business.  He works at a municipal job in the mornings and then in the afternoons manages his business providing vulcanization services.  The afternoon sun is very strong, so installing a laminate roof will protect him from the rays of the sun as well as the rain.  His customers will also be more comfortable since it can take anywhere between 20 to 30 minutes to repair a tire.  His equipment will also be protected since he cannot run the risk of operating power tools in the rain.

loans.use: Install a roof over his tire repair shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wendy Estefania

texts.es:
Wendy de 23 años, trabaja con su esposo en una vulcanizadora "lugar donde se reparan las llantas de carro, bicicletas etc), vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Comenzó a reparar llantas y aprender del negocio desde que su esposo se decidió a tener una vulcanizadora ya que toda su familia se dedicaba a esta actividad. Ellos trabajan desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Cada día se levantan para dejar a sus hijos a la escuela y después se dirigen a la vulcanizadora.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales y herramientas para el negocio. En el futuro quiere establecer otro negocio y tener una economía estable.
texts.en:
Wendy, age 23, works with her husband in a vulcanization shop where they repair tires for cars, bicycles, and other vehicles. She lives in Fortín de Guayaquil, a periurban area with dirt roads and hills.

Wendy began repairing tires and learned the business after her husband decided to open a repair shop. Her entire family engages in this business. They work every day from 7am to 9pm. After they wake up each day, Wendy takes her children to school before heading to the repair shop.

This loan will be used to buy materials and equipment for her business. In the future, Wendy wants to open another business and have stable finances.

loans.use: Purchase equipment & materials

loans.name: Alejandro Marcelino

texts.es:
El Señor C. H. Alejandro Marcelino es casado. 
Brinda servicios de albañilería hace 10 años. Cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro al que se dedica.
Por parte de los vecinos cuentas con buenas referencias personales. 
Es una persona muy responsable y honrado.
Requiere del préstamo para solventar gastos personales.
texts.en:
Sr. Alejandro Marcelino C. H. is married and has been providing masonry services for ten years. He has plenty of experience in this line of work.

His neighbors have provided good personal references and consider him to be responsible and honest. Alejandro needs this loan to pay for personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: S. Léa

texts.fr: D. S. Léa est née le 15 Juillet 1985 et vit depuis cinq ans environs à Agbodjèdo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léa est mariée à AMOUSSOU Georges et est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. En plus de son enfant, Léa a deux autres enfants à sa charge. Léa a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Léa gère un cafétéria, où elle vend en plus de son activité, des boissons et des divers (conserves de sardine, savons, etc.). Léa achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Léa désire augmenter le volume de son activité et accroître sa clientèle ; mais elle manque de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre d’augmenter ses stocks de produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième crédit. Plus tard, Léa envisage construire sa propre maison et avoir sa propre boutique.
texts.en:
Lea S. D. was born on the 15 of July, 1985 and has lived for the past 5 years in  Aghodiedo a neighbourhood of Cotonou,  the economic capital of Benin. Lea is married to George Amoussou and is the mother of one child who attends school. Bisides her own chiild, Lea cares for two other children. Lea stopped attending school after the secondary level. To meet her daily needs, and in addition to her other activities, Lea manages a cafeteria where she sells drinks and miscellaneous items including sardines, preserves, soaps, etc. She buys her products in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin.

Lea would like to increase her business volume and make new clients, but she lacks the financial means to allow her to increase her inventory in order to meet her client's needs. For this reason she has requested  this second loan from ALIDe.  In the future, Lea would like to build her own house and have a proper boutique.

loans.use: To buy drinks, jars of preserves, milk and soaps

loans.name: Claudio Xavier

texts.es:
Claudio de 33 años, tiene una papelería, vive con su esposa e hija en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil),

Hace tres años el tiene una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, la ha surtido mediante ha pasado el tiempo y ha obtenido mas clientela. Vende cuadernos, hojas, plumas, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Cuando le sale a comprar la papelería su esposa se queda en el local atendiéndolo. Una de las complicaciones al tener su negocio es su casa es que es un poco complicado llegar al su casa debido al sector donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, bloques para readecuar su casa y darle mas espacio al negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener una papelería bien surtida.
texts.en:
Claudio, age 33, manages a stationery shop. He lives with his wife and daughter in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil that has a deteriorating ecosystem.

Three years ago, Claudio opened a small stationery shop in the front part of his house. As time passed, he was able to gain more customers. He sells notebooks, sheets of paper, pens, beverages, and other products. Claudio works every day between the hours of 8am and 8pm. When he leaves to go buy inventory, his wife stays behind and manages the shop. One of the complications of having his business in his house is that is a bit difficult to reach his house based on the area where he lives.

This loan will be used to buy cement and blocks so that he can remodel his house and provide more space for his business. In the future, Claudio hopes to finish the construction of his house and have a well-stocked stationery shop.

loans.use: Purchase cement & blocks so that he can provide more space for his business

loans.name: A. Nadège

texts.fr: T. A. Nadège est née le 17 Septembre 1981. Mariée à AGOSSOU Fabrice et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés, Nadège vit ensemble avec sa famille. Nadège a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et mène comme activité la vente de bijoux et de tissus par le système de distribution ; ce qui l’aide à nourrir sa famille et à se prendre en charge. Nadège achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Nadège sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième concours financier. Le premier crédit dont Nadège avait bénéficié auprès de ALIDé a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: A. Nadège T. was born on September 17, 1981. Married to Fabrice Agossou and is the mother of two children who go to school, Nadège lives together with her family. Nadège stopped her studies a the secondary level. She makes a living by selling jewelry and fabrics through a distribution network, which helps support her family and provide for her own needs. She stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. In order to expander her business and better respond to the growing customer demand, she is seeking a second loan from ALIDé.  Her first loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics and jewelry

loans.name: Maythe Guillermina

texts.es: La señora se dedica a la venta D. ropa y venta D. productos D. belleza Avon desD. hace cuatro años aproximadamente. Vive en casa alquilada conjuntamente con sus menores hijos y su esposo el cual trabaja D. vigilante en una empresa agroexportadora,ambos se ayudan en los gastos familiares. La solicitante requiere del crédito para comprar mercaderia D. sus productos D. belleza Avon y ropa para la temporada D. verano, se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Sra. Maythe has been selling clothing and Avon beauty products for approximately four years. She lives in a rented house with her young children and husband, who works as a security guard for an agricultural export business. They both support one another with the family expenses.

Maythe needs a loan to buy merchandise, including Avon beauty products and summer clothing. This loan is being granted because she presents good personal and work references.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire summer clothing & beauty products

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced and lives in Kherson, southern Ukraine, with her daughter and a disabled son. She sells women’s outer clothing in one of the local markets called Dneprovskyi. The location of her vending kiosk is very favorable as it’s in a busy place.

Valentina has been in this trade for 15 years and has proven to be an honest and communicative businesswoman. Presently, she has about 40,000 Grivnas worth of inventory. Her net income is about 5,000 Grivnas per month.

Valentina would like to borrow 14,700 Grivnas to increase the variety of inventory in her kiosk and to keep her business running successfully this fall season. She believes that the loan will assist her in her entrepreneurial endeavors and help her to succeed.

loans.use: To increase the variety of inventory

loans.name: Damienne

texts.fr: D. Damienne est née le 17 Janvier 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Damienne est mariée à ASSOGBA Joseph, un  militaire de profession. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Damienne vit avec ses enfants à Cotonou depuis trois ans et plus précisément à Sègbèya l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, où elle mène son activité de vente de tissus, de bijoux et de chaussures de façon secondaire. Damienne exerce cette activité depuis sept ans et fait son approvisionnement à Dantokpa le marché international du Bénin. Damienne vend ses articles par le système de distribution. C’est pour rehausser le niveau de son activité et répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’évoluer que Damienne  sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé. Damienne avait bénéficié antérieurement de l’appui financier de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement du crédit.
texts.en: Damienne D. was born on January 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Damienne is born to Joseph Assogba, who is in the military. The couple has two children, both of whom go to school. Damienne has been living with her children in Cotonou, more precisely in the Ségbéya district, for three years. There she sells fabrics and jewelry, and, as a secondary business activity, also shoes. She has been in this business for seven years. She stocks up at the international market of Benin. She sells her products through a distribution network. In order to expand her business and better meet the ever growing customer demand, Damienne is seeking financing from ALIDé. Damienne obtained financing from ALIDé in the past and repaid her loan well.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics and jewelry

loans.name: Aimée Isabelle

texts.fr: N. Aimée Isabelle est née le 20 Février 1974. Isabelle est mariée à HOUENOU Armand, un militaire. La famille vit dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji . Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Isabelle vend depuis environs quatre ans,  divers produits vivriers (pâtes alimentaires, riz, couscous, lait, sucre, etc.), mais également de l’huile d’arachide, allumettes, papier de toilette, insecticide, etc. à son domicile. Isabelle s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Isabelle sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d’augmenter ses stocks de produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Aimée Isabelle N. was born on February 20, 1974. Isabelle is married to Armand Houenou, who is in the military. The family lives in the community of Sèmè-Podji . The spouses jointly take care of various household expenses. For about four years, Isabelle has been selling various groceries (pasta, rice, couscous, milk, sugar etc) as well as peanut oil, matches, toilet paper, insecticides, etc., out of her home. Isabelle stocks up in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. This is the first time that Isabelle is seeking a loan from ALIDé, with the goal of increasing her merchandise stock and better satisfying her customers’ needs.

loans.use: Purchasing groceries (rice, pasta, beans, couscous, etc.)

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is married with two children. She runs a small men's clothing store in the local marketplace in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. She has run this business for 14 years and currently has an inventory worth 15,000 UAH. Her monthly profit amounts to 3,000 UAH.
Anzhela is seeking a 10,000 UAH loan to restock her seasonal inventory. A better selection of merchandise will help her increase her sales and, as a result, her income as well. She is a skilled and experienced market vendor who has built up a loyal customer base.

loans.use: To restock her seasonal inventory

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora L. Chavala quiere aprovechar la temporada para producir la mejor cosecha de frijoles en el año, tanto para consumo como para la venta.
Ella tiene 52 años, y toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura en su comunidad Santa Fe de Alajuela, conocida especialmente con su cercanía con la frontera norte del país.
Doña Flora necesita un préstamo de ₡603 000 (seiscientos tres mil colones) para la compra de insumos y para la preparación de suelo de su propiedad. Con esto tendrá la mejor cosecha y muy buenos ingresos para comprar los regalos de navidad para sus 4 hijos. 
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Flora L. Chavala wants to take advantage of this season for producing the best crop of beans this year for both personal consumption and for sale.  She is 52 years old and has spent her entire life farming in the community of Santa Fe de Alajuela, which is known especially for its close proximity to the northern border of the country.

Doña Flora needs a loan of 603,000 CRC in order to buy supplies and prepare the soil on her property.  She hopes this will provide her with the best crop and better income from which she can buy Christmas presents for her four children.

Flora is a member of the Santa Fe Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing her farmland

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: O. Béatrice est née le 13 Février 1961 et habite Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis une douzaine d’année. C’est une veuve qui est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et dont deux ne sont plus à sa charge. Béatrice vit donc seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les différentes charges du foyer. Il y a près de treize ans que Béatrice mène comme activité la vente des céréales et des produits vivriers (maïs, haricot, riz, etc.) ainsi que des condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, épices, etc.) à son domicile. Béatrice s’approvisionne au marché de Houègbo, dans le département de l’Atlantique.  C’est la première fois que Béatrice sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire à travers ses produits vendus.
texts.en: Beatrice O. was born on February 13, 1961. She has been living in Agbalilamè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, for about a dozen years. She is a widow and the mother of five children, all of whom study and two of whom are no longer in her care. Béatrice lives with her children and provides for the household by herself. Almost 13 years ago she first started selling cereals and groceries (corn, beans, rice etc) as well as sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, pimentos, spices etc) out of her house. Beatrice stocks up at the Houègbo market, in the Atlantic Department. This is the firs time that Beatrice is seeking a loan for ALIDé, with the goal of strengthening her business and increasing the revenues brought in from her sales.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming supplies, seeds, and equipment

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Gisèle est une femme de 40 ans qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu  le commerce de détail de sacs plastiques, de sucres et de produits génériques. Elle s’approvisionne à lomé et a une expérience de 5 ans dans la gestion de ce commerce. Elle voudrait augmenter son stock pour répondre convenablement à la demande de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui est son premier pour acheter 5 sacs de sucres, 200 plastiques moyen, 3 cartons de produits génériques et divers.
texts.en: Gisèle is a 40-year old woman who makes a living by retailing plastic bags, sugar and  basic needs products. She stocks up in Lomé and has five years of experience in this business. She would like to increase her stock in order to meet the customer demand properly. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase five bags of sugar, 200 medium-size plastic bags, three boxes of  basic needs products and other miscellaneous items.

loans.use: Purchasing bags of sugar, plastic bags, etc

loans.name: Dolores Epifania

texts.es:
Dolores tiene un taller de confección, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Ella trabajaba en un fabrica de ropa y hay fue donde aprendió ha hacer ropa al por mayor pero como quería independizarse y tener su propio negocio compro maquinas de coser y materiales para elaborar ropa. Poco a poco ella a creado ropa y ha incrementado su clientela, trabaja todos los días en su taller con una vecina. Ella hace blusas, pantalones por pedidos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y botones para confeccionar mas ropa, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener mas grande su taller.
texts.en:
Dolores has a sewing workshop and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil, a periurban area located in the mountains with dirt roads and houses.

She worked at a clothing factory where she learned how to make clothes in large quantities. Dolores wanted to become independent and start her own business, so she bought sewing machines and materials for making clothes. Little by little, she began creating her own designs and increased her customer base. Dolores works every day in her workshop with a neighbor. She produces blouses and trousers upon request.

This loan will be used to buy fabric and buttons for producing more clothes. In the future, Dolores wants to finish the construction of her house and have a larger workshop.

loans.use: Purchase fabric & buttons

loans.name: Chérifa

texts.fr: Chérifa est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et est mère de 4 enfants, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de  sandales. Elle a débuté dans ce commerce il y a plus de 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local de nukafu. Actuellement elle veut gonfler son  stock de marchandises et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 70 chaussures et divers.
texts.en:
Chérifa is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. 

She earns a living selling sandals. She started in this business over 10 years ago. She gets her stocks at the local market of Nukafu. 

She is seeking a loan from WAGES to increase her stocks of merchandise. She will use the loan to buy 70 pairs of shoes and miscellaneous items.

loans.use: Buying shoes

loans.name: Vannesa Lissette

texts.es:
Vannessa de 28 años, vende manualidades hechas con fomix y bocaditos de dulces, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Comenzó hacer manualidades con fomix para tener dinero ya que esta separada de su esposo y tiene una hija de 6 años que todavía estudia. Ella a buscado lo mecanismo de tener dinero por eso también se ha puesto a vender bocaditos para fiestas. Trabaja todo el día haciendo manualidades y bocaditos. Para seguir con sus dos negocio y tener dinero para mantener a su hija ella quiere comprar con el préstamo azúcar, harina y fomix. 

En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio de bocaditos y manualidades en un local.
texts.en:
Vannessa, age 28, sells foam handicrafts and sweet snacks. She lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants.

Vannessa began making crafts out of foam in order to earn money. She is separated from her husband and has a six year old daughter who is in school. Looking for ways to generate income, Vannessa also set up stand selling party snacks. She works every day making crafts and producing snacks. In order to continue her two businesses and have the money to support her daughter, she will use this loan to buy sugar, flour, and craft foam.

In the future, Vannessa wants to expand her snack business and have a crafts store.

loans.use: Purchase craft foam, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Ablawa Agathe

texts.fr: D. Ablawa Agathe est née le 05 Octobre 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KOUMAGNON Simon,  Agathe est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Agathe vit depuis une quinzaine d’année avec sa famille à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Agathe assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Agathe n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une douzaine d’année, et pour faire face à ses besoins, Agathe mène comme activité la vente de céréales et des produits vivriers à son domicile. Agathe achète ses produits au marché de Houègbo, dans le département de l’Atlantique. La clientèle de Agathe se fait de plus en plus grande et Agathe n’arrive plus à couvrir toutes leurs demandes, compte tenu de ses moyens financiers. C’est donc pour renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle que Agathe sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Ablawa Agathe D. was born on October 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Maried to Simon Koumagnon, Agathe is the mother of four children, all of whom go to school. Since about 15 years ago, Agathe has been living with her family in Sèkandji, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. Agathe provides for family needs alongside her husband, thanks to the income from her business activity. Agathe did not go to school. For about a dozen years,  Agathe has been making a living by selling cereals and groceries out of her home. She stocks up at the Houègbo market, in the Atlantic Department. Agathe has more and more customers and no longer manages to meet all her customers’ needs, given her financial resources. Thus, in order to strengthen her business and better respond to customer demand, Agathe is seeking her first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals and groceries

loans.name: 5 De Febrero Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “ 5 DE FEBRERO”, se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, está integrado por 13 clientas, en él se encuentra la señora YADIRA H.  M. de 30 de años de edad, nos platica que estudio una carrera comercial como técnico auxiliar contable, su esposo se llama German de Jesus es Albañil desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, ingreso que les ayudaba a mantener a sus pequeños hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, hasta que la señora decidió empezar a trabajar, actualmente tiene un negocio de alfarería, con el crédito quiere comprar materia prima para invertir en su negocio de venta de alfarería, negocio que por tradición ha sido el sustento de muchos de sus familiares, su intención es obtener una mayor ganancia, la clienta nos comenta que antes realizaba diferentes actividades como lo es la venta de juguetes y bisutería. La ilusión que siempre ha tenido la señora Yadira es que sus pequeños hijos puedan tener acceso a la educación universitaria, así mismo ella desea continuar estudiando y ser una mejor mujer día con día.
texts.en:
The February 5th Group is located in the State of México and consists of thirteen members. One of them is Sra. Yadira H. M., age 30. She indicates that she studied for a business degree in order to become an assistant accountant. Her husband, German de Jesus, has worked as a mason for approximately five years. His income helped support their young children, ages 8 and 3, until she decided to start working.

Yadira currently has a pottery business and will use her loan to buy materials so that she can continue selling her wares. This type of business is a family tradition among many of her relatives as a means of supporting themselves. She intends to generate more income. Yadira says that prior this business, she engaged in different activities such as selling toys and trinkets. Her vision has always been to provide her young children with the opportunity to access a university education. She also wants to continue her studies and become a better woman with each passing day.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire materials for a pottery business

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr: il y a 10 ans Tchilalo s’est engagé dans le commerce de tubercules d’ignames qu'elle stocke dans des sachets. L’igname est une tubercule très consommée dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer le fufu. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de bassar ainsi ses marges sur la vente de céréales sont importantes. Elle veut acheter  10 tas de tubercules d’ignames pour agrandir  son stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit.
texts.en:
Ten years ago Tchilalo began the retail commerce of yams that she stores in bags. Yams are widely used in Togolese cooking for the preparation of fufu.

She gets her supplies from Bassar, a town in the interior of the country, which gives her large profit margins when selling cereals. She wants to buy 10 bags of yams to increase her stock. This is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES.

loans.use: buy yams

loans.name: Ekawa

texts.fr: En 2004, D. a ouvert sa boutique dans laquelle elle vend des produits de beauté. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Sa clientèle est en majorité féminine. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock avec divers produits de beauté. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2004 D. opened a shop where she sells beauty products. She gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé. Her customers are for the most part women.

She is requesting a loan from WAGES to bolster her stock supply with various beauty products. She is married and the mother of three children.

loans.use: buy beauty products

loans.name: Paz

texts.es: Paz B. C. de 59 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, ella es una persona muy trabajador quien vive junto a su pequeña nieta de 9 años de edad, la cual esta a cargo de la señora Paz. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar y su familia, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder algunas ventas, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio. Paz es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar de ella y su hogar, ya que para ella es muy importante poder aportar a su casa y de esta forma poder vivir de una manera tranquila en la cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para su nieta y para ella.
texts.en: Paz B. C. is 59 years old.  She lives in Usulután department.  She is a very hard-working person who lives together with her 9 year-old granddaughter who is in her care.  She has a store where she sells perishable goods.  The store is located in her home and her business provides her home and her family with everything they need.  Paz is requesting a loan as it will give her the money she needs to stock her business with everything she needs to provide her customers with a better service.  She often has to lose sales when she doesn't have in stock the products which her customers are asking for.  These are circumstances which she would like to be able to alter and improve in order to succeed in her business.  Paz is a very visionary woman who always wants to succeed and grow day by day for her own wellbeing and that of her household.  It is very important to her that she be able to provide for her household and live comfortably with everything she needs for her granddaughter and herself.

loans.use: Purchase of essential goods for her household

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice, oil

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene A. L. de 48 años de edad, madre soltera de dos jóvenes de 15 y 17 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, ella ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora la cual siempre ha luchado muy duro por sacar adelante a sus dos hijos. Marlene posee un comedor en el cual se encarga de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa platillos típicos tales como: tamales, pupusas y yuca frita, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Mejicanos, lugar en el cual habita junto a su familia. El mayor deseo de Marlene es el de poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio ya que es gracias ha este como ha podido contar con todo lo necesario para su hogar. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar: verduras, frutas, granos básicos, jugos, café y todo lo necesario para contar con más materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos, y así de esta forma aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marlene A. L. is 48 years old and a single mother of two teenagers, ages 15 and 17, who are in school. She is an enterprising woman who has always fought very hard so that her two children can get ahead. Marlene manages a diner where she serves breakfast and lunch. She prepares traditional dishes such as tamales, pupusas, and fried cassava. Her business is located in the Mejicanos Market, a place near where she lives with her family.

Marlene’s greatest wish is to improve the conditions of her business, which has helped her provide everything she needs for her home. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she will have the necessary funds to buy vegetables, fruits, basic grains, juices, coffee, and other essential supplies for preparing her dishes. This will enable her to increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Yurima Patricia

texts.es:
Yurima Patricia O. A. es una joven mujer que vive en el barrio Villa San Carlos en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge  dedicado a la compra y venta de madera  y  con sus tres hijos en las edades de 4, 8 y 12 años.  
En el año 2006 Yurima y su esposo iniciaron un negocio de tienda para aumentar sus ingreso familiares , pero Yurima empezó a darle un cambio gradual al esquema de su negocio y fue poco a poco cambiando su actividad por la venta y oferta de productos de mayor rentabilidad, como papelería,  bebidas frías, cervezas y gaseosas , a las que adicionó otros servicios como el de internet y también de fotocopiaje  e impresión,  haciendo su actividad mas coherente con lo que ella le gusta y adicionó también que con ello puede atender a sus hijos  menores de edad.   Finalmente el  gran sueño de Yurima es convertir su negocio en una inmensa papelería con   oferta multifuncional de servicios avanzados de comunicaciones, donde también ofrezca  meriendas, dulces y mecatos para que sus clientes estén cómodos y se deleiten con el servicio. En la actualidad está muy contenta con lo que tiene, su papelería le genera una  utilidad bruta  de un 25%, los refrescos y bebidas  entre el  49%  y 50% y últimamente adicionó un computador y una impresora con las que espera, que le ofrezcan estos dos servicios, un margen de contribución de un 90%.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el anterior logró aumentar sus ingresos, porque contó con un nuevo capital de trabajo para responder a sus clientes. Con su credikiva comprará cervezas, refrescos y confitería alistándose para la temporada del final de año que se avecina. Su sueño y gran felicidad  es estudiar belleza y que sus hijos logren tener una profesión que les permita ser exitosos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Yurima Patricia O. A. is a young woman living in the Villa San Carlos neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla with her spouse, who is a lumber merchant, and their three children who are 4, 8 and 12 years old.

In 2006 Yurima and her husband opened a grocery store to increase family income.  However, Yurima gradually modified its nature stocking more profitable items like paper goods, cold beverages, beer and soft drinks as well as services like Internet access, photocopying and printing thereby making her business more in tune with her likes while at the same time making it possible for her to care for her minor children.

Yurima’s ultimate dream is to turn her business into a huge stationery store offering a multitude of advanced communication services as well as meals, candy and snacks so that her customers will be more comfortable and enjoy the services.

She is currently quite happy with what she has.  Her stationery store generates a gross profit of 25%, the beverages and soft drinks around 49%-50% and she recently added a computer and printer that she expects will generate 90% profits.

This is her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Her previous loan made it possible for her to increase income because she had new working capital with which to react to customer needs.

She will use this Kiva loan to buy beer, beverages and snacks to prepare for the approaching end of year season.

Her dream and great happiness is to study to be a Beautician and that her children attain professions that will permit them to be successful in the future.

loans.use: She will buy beer, soft drinks and snacks to stock up for the end of year season.

loans.name: Nolan

texts.es: El señor Nolan es Taxista, vive en el barrio San Antonio, Es Conductor de su propio Vehículo, El Cual sale a  trabajar desde muy Temprano, frecuenta mas por las Zona de los barrios alejados, Tiene una Hijita de tan solo 4 añitos, Su esposa es profesora en un colegio muy alejado de la zona y también el lugar donde el vive,  son personas responsables con el única preocupación de su hijita que lo dejan al cuidado de su familia del señor Nolan. Por que tienen el concepto de que deben trabajar los dos para bienestar y futuro  de su pequeña hijita. Es por eso que se animaron aun crédito para mejorar su Herramienta de trabajo para no tropezar con problemas posteriores, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Nolan is a taxi driver. He lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio and operates his own vehicle. Nolan leaves for work very early since he frequently travels to the more remote neighborhoods in the district. He has a four year old daughter and his wife is a teacher at a high school located far away from their home. The people who live in his area are responsible individuals. His only worry is when he has to leave his daughter in the care of his relatives since both he and his wife must work to provide for her future and well-being.

Nolan is encouraged by receiving this loan because he will be able to repair his vehicle in order to avoid further problems. He is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Pay for engine repairs & body work to his vehicle

loans.name: Chiquillas De San Gabriel Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Chiquillas D. San Gabriel, porque se ubica en la comunidad D. San Gabriel las P., Morelos México. Esta comunidad se distingue por su exuberante naturaleza, una ex hacienda y un balneario que lo hacen ser un atractivo turístico, este grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.La Sra. Gabriela B., es la tesorera del grupo tiene 39 años, estudio hasta el 2º D. año D. primaria, es comerciante, tiene un total D. 5 hijos: 4 mujeres y un varón, ella se dedica a la venta D. perfumes y cobertores, negocio que inicio hace 10 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar cobertores y venderlos  porque  se aproxima la temporada D. invierno, al momento D. solicitar el préstamo se siente muy contenta porque será su primer crédito,  las ganancias que obtenga  las invertirá en  una  mejor  educación para sus hijos , ya que tres D. ellos aún van a la escuela.
texts.en:
This group is called “Chiquillas D. San Gabriel” (Youngsters from San Gabriel) because the members are from the community of San Gabriel Las P. in the State of Morelos, Mexico. This community is distinguished by its exuberant nature, an old hacienda, and a resort that make it a tourist attraction.

The group consists of ten members. Sra. Gabriela B. is the group treasurer. She is 39 years old and has a second graD. education. Gabriela is a businesswoman who has five children, four daughters and a son. She sells perfumes and blankets. Gabriela has been in business for ten years and is requesting a loan to buy blankets to sell for the upcoming winter season. Upon submitting her request, she felt very happy because this will be her first loan. The earnings she generates will be invested in a better education for her children since three of them are still in school.

loans.use: Purchase blankets to sell for the winter season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy skirts, blouses, and shoes for women and be able to respond to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase corn & firewood

loans.name: Ekouéssan

texts.fr: ekouéssan est un homme marié et père de 2 enfants, il a appris la médecine, après sa formation il a ouvert son propre cabinet depuis 2000. il emploie de deux infirmières dans son cabinet. Actuellement  il souhaite réaménager ses locaux pour mieux installer ses patients. il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter divers matériaux pour l’aménagement des locaux de sa clinique.
texts.en:
Ekouessan is a married man, father of two children. He studied to become a doctor, and after completing his studies opened his own practice in 2000, where he employs two nurses.

At this time he wishes to remodel his premises to provide a more hospitable environment for his patients. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various materials for the remodelling of the premises of his clinic.

loans.use: remodel the premises of his clinic

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio V. S. de 43 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador, el cual siempre ha velado por el bienestar de su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Manuel posee un pick up, en el cual se dedica  a hacer viajes a diferentes partes del departamento de Ahuachapán, mismo lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia. Él transporta frutas, muebles, personas y todo lo que se le solicita, la zona en la cual él se colocada a diario es muy buena ya que es cerca de un centro comercial. Manuel solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo de poder brindarle un hogar más seguro a su familia, ya que él lo solicita para contar con el dinero necesario para hacer un muro en su casa de habitación y así mismo para reparar el techo de su hogar.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio V. S., age 43, is a hardworking gentleman who is always looking out for the welfare of his family, which consists of his wife and three children who are of school age. He owns a pickup truck that he uses for making trips to different parts of the Department of Ahuachapán, the same area where he lives with his family. Manuel transports fruit, furniture, people, and everything else upon request.

The area where he travels on a daily basis is in a nice location near a commercial center. Manuel is requesting a loan because he greatly desires to make his home more secure for his family. The money will be used to build a wall outside of his home and repair the roof of his house.

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a security wall & repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Salvador Osvaldo

texts.es: Salvador Osvaldo M. M. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador en donde vive junto a su hija de 15 años de edad, por quien trabaja arduamente para darle todo lo mejor. Él posee una venta de tortas en el parque Hula Hula en el centro de San Salvador, uno de los lugares más famosos de la capital en el cual se venden tortas, este es un sitio que cuenta con gran afluencia de personas, lo que es de mucho beneficio para él. Desde hace 30 años que Salvador se dedica a la venta de comida rápida por lo que es muy conocido en el lugar. Salvador solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortas como: pan, lechuga, aderezos, carne, jamón, así mismo desea poder comprar diferentes tipos de bebidas frías y caliente. Su negocio esta muy bien establecido, es por esto que Salvador desea mejorarlo para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Salvador Osvaldo M. M. is 50 years old.  He lives in San Salvador department with his 15 year-old daughter.  He works hard to give his daughter the best.  He owns a sandwich stall in Hula Hula park in the center of San Salvador which is one of the most famous places in the capital.  It is a place that attracts a lot of people which is good for him.  Salvador has been selling fast food for the past 30 years so he is very well known in the area.  Salvador is requesting a loan from Integral which he hopes to use to buy all the ingredients he needs to make his sandwiches such as bread, lettuce, seasonings, meat and ham.  He would also like to be able to purchase different types of hot and cold drinks.  His business is very well established.  This is why Salvador would like to improve it, in order to make more profits.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make sandwiches to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Folivi

texts.fr: folivi est un homme très dynamique, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. il vit avec sa  famille dans le quartier d'anfamé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux de sa famille, il a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle il fait des photocopies. beaucoup d'écoliers et d'enseignent des écoles de son quartier sont ses clients, même le personnel de certaines petites entreprises à proximité de son lieu d'activité. la demande de sa clientèle est de plus en plus élevée. il sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une nouvelle photocopie.
texts.en:
Folivi is a very dynamic man, married with two children. He lives with his family in the neighborhood of Anfamé, a suburb of the city of Lomé. 

In order to support himself and provide for his family, he opened a shop offering photocopy services. His client base includes lots of students and teachers from the local schools as well as staff members from small businesses near his shop. 

With customer demand increasing steadily, he is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy a new copier.

loans.use: To buy a new copy machine

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: La actividad del Sr. Miguel es la venta de ropa nueva, la cual realiza en la tienda que posee en su misma casa, el vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa e hijos, además de realizar esta actividad el también se desempeña como profesor de computación en un colegio de la zona, ayudando también de esta manera en el aprendizaje de la informática ya que se volvió en una de las materias que mas gusta a los niños por lo novedoso que es la computación,  generando de esta manera el ingresos para el y su familia, en esta oportunidad solicita crédito para el aumento de capital de trabajo compra de mercadería, ropa de temporada  para las fiestas de fin de año, ya que mucha gente realiza sus compras navideñas desde estas fechas, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Miguel sells new clothing.  He makes his sales from a store which is located in his house.  He lives in his parents' home with his wife and children.  As well as selling clothes, he also works as a computer teacher in a local school.  This way he also helps with IT learning.  It has become a favorite subject amongst the children as computing is a new thing for them.  In this way he earns income for himself and his family.  He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital in order to purchase merchandise such as seasonal clothing for end of year parties since many people make their Christmas purchases from around this time.  He is very grateful to the organization for the support they have given him.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Atoussé

texts.fr: atoussé est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'attiégou à Lomé. elle a une ancienneté de 4 ans dans son commerce. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes et elle s'approvisionne au marché local d'adawlato. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour s'approvisionner avec 12 cartons de produits génériques. avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en: Atousse is a 43-year old woman, married and the mother of four. She lives with her family in the Attiégou district in Lomé. She has four years of experience in her business. Her customer base is very diverse, and she stocks up at the local market of Adawlato. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 12 boxes of basic needs products. She uses the revenues from her business to contribute to the family budget.

loans.use: Purchasing basic needs products

loans.name: Lay Kelly

texts.es:
Lay P. de 22 años es una joven comerciante de productos de belleza y mercancía variada a través de  catálogos de productos de una importante empresa a la que está vinculada en su calidad de comerciante; Lay  es muy organizada y quiere crecer como persona y mejorar sus condiciones de negocio día a día, por eso  en la actualidad solicita un credikiva para  invertirlo en perfumería  masculina, femenina, utensilios para el hogar y ropa interior que tiene encargado por clientes reales y potenciales, con los que aspira a aumentar sus utilidades en un 25% sobre este nuevo capital de trabajo,  financiado a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo .
Cuando Lay aun tenia 17 años,   inició su negocio  por alternativa propia, esto ocurrió en  el año 2005, cuando buscaba la  forma de apoyar a sus padres y ser autosuficiente;  con sus ingresos  ha podido adelantar algunos cursos de capacitación que le ha ayudado mucho.
  Ingresó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, a través de un primer crédito hace un año,  y con su financiamiento ha logrado responder oportunamente a sus clientes y ganarle dinero a un nuevo capital, con el que antes no contaba; también con esta organización ha logrado capacitarse y ahora es mas austera en el gasto, así como disciplinada en el control de su inversión y de su cartera.
En el futuro sueña con tener una empresa dedicada al comercio con sus propios catálogos, su mayor desafío ocurrió cuando empezó otorgándole crédito de sus productos a clientes que sin ninguna consideración se fueron y no le pagaron, de esta experiencia le resultó importante porque ahora revisa bien a quien ofrecerle sus productos a crédito.
texts.en:
Lay P., who is 22 years old, is a young dealer of beauty products and various merchandise through the product catalogs of an important business to which she is tied in her capacity as a dealer. Lay is very organized and wants to grow as a person and improve her business conditions day by day. For this reason she is now soliciting a Kiva loan to invest in perfume for men and women, utensils for the home, and underwear that has been ordered by actual and potential customers. With these products she aspires to increase her profits by 25% through this new working capital financed through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.

When Lay was still 17 years old, she began her business by her own choice. This was in the year 2005, when she was looking for a way to support her parents and be self-sufficient. With her income, she has been able to advance through some training courses that have helped her a lot.

She came in to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation through her first loan a year ago, and with her financing she has succeeded in responding to her customers in a timely manner and earning money for new capital, which she did not have before. With this organization (the Foundation), she has also succeeded in getting training, and now she is more austere in her spending as well as disciplined in the control of her investments and her assets.

In the future she dreams of having a business dedicated to sales through her own catalogs. Her greatest challenge occurred when she began to grant credit on her products to customers who, without any consideration, left and did not pay her. This experience turned out to be important for her because now she reviews carefully to whom she offers her products on credit.

loans.use: Invest in perfume for men and women, household utensils, and underwear ordered by actual and potential customers.

loans.name: Raul Erwin

texts.es: El Sr. Raúl, tiene como actividad la actividad de distribución de productos lácticos como ser yogurt leche fluida natural y saborizada y otros derivados de la leche, el motivo por el cual solicito crédito es el de aumentar su capacidad de operaciones comprando variedda de productos lacteos y asi de esta manera mejorar el servicio que presta. El Sr.  Raúl, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, ella también ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar,  ya que ella cuenta con una tienda, es una familia muy unida y conocida en la zona donde ellos realizan sus actividades, están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo  brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Raúl has a business distributing dairy products such as yogurt, natural milk fluids, flavored milk, and other milk derivatives. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can increase his operational capacity. Raúl plans to buy a variety of dairy products so that he can improve the service he provides. He lives with his wife and two children. His wife has a store and helps cover the household expenses. They are a very close family who are known in the area where they conduct their activities.

Raúl is extremely grateful to Emprender for the support provided.

loans.use: Purchase dairy products

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.en:
Ana is a 54-year-old mother of two who lives with her husband, mother and children in San Jose, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Ana describes her as a strong, hard-working woman with a healthy appetite for learning and big plans for the future. 

Ana runs two businesses. Over the past 4 years, she has gained experience selling various items such as jewellery, clothing, cosmetics and shoes from her home, where she has opened a bazaar (seen in the picture). Her customers arrive daily to peruse the various products she has available for sale. This business arrangement allows Ana to take care of domestic responsibilities when business is slow, including taking care of her mother and children. 

Her other business is selling catalog items such as cooking utensils, appliances and clothing. For this activity, Ana travels from door to door in her community, offering catalog products to customers. She has been running her business in this way over the past four years, and she has one employee.  In a good month Ana earns 700,000 colones, in a bad month, only 300,000. 

Ana has a large space in her home to display a varied range of products. She says competition is basically nonexistent in the area in which she lives. The majority of her clients are workers at a nearby plastic manufacturing plant; others are family members and acquaintances in the community.  Sometimes, her children help her with her business so that Ana can take care of her mother.

 Ana plans to use this loan to invest in both of her productive activities. She hopes to invest in the purchase of various merchandise items such as clothing, jewellery, cosmetics and cooking utensils. 

In general, Ana wakes up early in order to carry out her domestic responsibilities such as preparing breakfast, cleaning the house and assisting her mother.  When she is not doing housework, she is dedicated to making sales, whether in the bazaar or on the street. Ana´s goal is to expand her business and provide a prosperous lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise (clothing, jewellery, cosmetics)

loans.name: Sara Soraya

texts.es:
Sara de 35 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (rodeada de un estero). 

Hace años se dedica a la costura y confección pero su especialidad son trajes formales y ternos. Trabaja en conjunto de su hija y mama, según como sea el tamaño de la persona cobrar el trabajo. Tiene un aproximado de 300 trajes mensual que entrega a diferentes clientes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y accesorios para el taller de confección y costura.  

En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tener un espacio mas grande para el taller de costura y confección.
texts.en:
Sara, age 35, has a sewing and tailoring shop. She lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil, which is surrounded by a marsh.

Sara has been sewing and producing clothes for several years, with her specialty being formal gowns and suits. She works with her daughter and mother. The clothes she produces are designed according to the size of the person requesting the work. Sara makes approximately 300 deliveries each month to different customers. This loan will be used to buy fabrics and accessories for her business.

In the future, Sara wants to build a better house and have a larger space for her workshop.

loans.use: Purchase fabric & accessories

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es:
Gladys Maria C. Y. tiene 44 años. Es casado vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos.

Gladys  pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueno es arreglar la casa.
Le gusta festejar las fiestas del carnaval que se celebra en el mes de febrero
texts.en:
Gladys Maria Carvaja Y. is 44 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. She has seven children.

Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Gladys is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. She purchases her supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in her community. Gladys is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of her family. Her dream is to remodel her house.

Gladys enjoys the Carnival festivities that are celebrated in the month of February.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel C. I. tiene 31 años. Es soltero vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. No  Tiene  hijos.

Segundo pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es que la economía aumente.
Le gusta hacer deporte.

Segundo Manuel C. I. 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. He does not have children.

Segundo is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Segundo is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. He purchases his supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in his community. Segundo is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of his family. His dream is to grow financially.

Segundo enjoys playing sports.

He likes to participate in sports and go for walks with his family.

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es:
María de 35 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura, en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado).  

Desde joven trabajaba vendiendo cosméticos pero como no era un trabajo fijo decidió retirarse y comenzar el taller de confección que siempre quiso. Compro algunos materiales que le faltaban y con un maquina que tenia comenzó a trabajar en sus primeros pedidos de ropa. En la actualidad tiene personas que le ayudan en la confección de ropa, trabajando desde muy temprano haciendo blusas, pantalones, trajes. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, accesorios para su negocio. En el futuro quiere construir en la parte de atrás de su casa un taller porque ahora no esta bien segura ya que no tiene cerramiento en su casa.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and has a dressmaking and sewing workshop in Perimetral de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area surrounded by a salt marsh).

Since she was a young girl she has been selling cosmetics but as it wasn't a steady job she decided to stop and set up a dressmaking workshop which is something she always wanted.  She bought some materials which she needed and with a machine she had she began to work on her first clothing orders.  She currently has people who help her in the dressmaking business, working from very early in the morning making blouses, pants and suits.

With her loan María would like to purchase material and accessories for her business.  In the future, she would like to build a workshop out the back of her house because she is not very safe right now as she doesn't have an enclosure around her house.

loans.use: Material, accessories

Le gusta pasear en la moto.
texts.en:
Adrian Benigno A. G. is 22 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the San Miguel canton of the Bolivar province.  He has one child.

Adrian is a member of the Ventanilla La Florida located a half hour away from San Miguel, it is a group dedicated to agriculture as a means of obatining income for their families.  This group has 14 members.

Adrian is in farming.  He grows corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.  He purchases supplies in San Miguel and sells his products at the market in San Miguel and at his farm.

He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for the planting of corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.  With the help of the loan, he will be better able to financially support his family.  His dreams are to build a house and provide for his son's education.

He likes to ride his motorcycle.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for planting corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.

loans.name: La Mansión Azul Group

texts.es: Esta  foto fue tomada negocio de la señora Juanita R., la cual es integrante del grupo  “LA MANSION AZUL” que está ubicado en Puebla,México. En la foto se ve claramente el pequeño rastro donde sacrifica el ganado caprino que ocupa para la elaboración de barbacoa, en la cual desea invertir con este crédito porque le deja buenas ganancias, lleva 15 años dedicándose a este oficio. Ella comenta que va invertir en el ganado y en los condimentos, porque una de sus metas en la vida es consolidar bien su negocio. La señora Juanita  tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, estudio una C. técnica y le da trabajo a otras personas. En este momento se siente muy contenta porque sus compañeras y ella serán apoyadas con el crédito. El grupo está conformado por diez personas.
texts.en: This photo was taken at the business of Ms. Juanita R., a member of "La Mansión Azul" ["The Blue Mansion"] Group, which is located in Puebla, Mexico.  In the photo, you can clearly see the small table where she slaughters the goats that she keeps for preparing barbecue.  This brings in good profits and she has been doing it for 15 years.  She says that she will use this loan to buy livestock and seasonings, because one of her goals in life is to strengthen her business.  Ms. Juanita is 37 years old, married, has three children, studied for a technical field, and now provides work for other people.  At the moment, she is feeling very content because she and her fellow group members will be supported by this loan.  Their group has ten members.

loans.use: to buy livestock for preparing barbecue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase seafood for resale.

loans.name: Patricia Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Patricia Días es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive por el sector de Totoracoha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, cuenta con varios lugares turísticos los que se encuentran a poca distancia de la ciudad, tiene mucha variedad en su gastronomía. Cuenca es especial por su gente la que lleva su cultura y tradición.

Doña Patricia tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y su esposo es mecánico industrial, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando.
 
La Señora. Patricia tiene una tienda en su casa la cual la tiene hace 7 años, atiende todos los días sin descansar uno solo y sin un horario fijo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 8 años y está muy contenta por reunirse con sus amigas cada quince días.Este credito lo va ha invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda como: arroz, azucar, aceite, golosinas etc.

Su sueño es ver  que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ms. Patricia Días is a member of the María Reina de la Paz ["Queen Mary of Peace"] Communal Bank.  She lives in the Totoracoha area of Cuenca, a city known for the beauty of its historic center.  Cuenca has several tourist attractions that can be found a short distance from the city, as well as a great variety of gastronomy.  Cuenca is special because of its people, who carry on its culture and tradition.

Ms. Patricia is 42 years old, married, and her husband is an industrial engineer.  They have had three children together, who are currently in school.  Ms. Patricia has a store in her house, which she has run for seven years.  She tends her store every day, without resting for even one day.  She does not have a fixed schedule.  She has been a member of the communal bank for eight years and is very happy with it because it means that she meets with her friends every 15 days.  She will use this loan to purchase products for her store, such as: rice, sugar, oil, candy, etc.  Her dream is to see her children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, candy, etc.

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Luz, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene 42 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive junto a su madre y hermanos, ella es soltera y su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene para solventar sus necesidades.
Su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa, peluches, sandalias  y recuerdos, lo atiende de 8:00 am hasta las 5:00pm, este negocio fue un esfuerzo emprendedor que ella inicio desde hace 4 años y que poco a poco lo ha ido aumentando. Actualmente quiere comprar mercadería alusiva a la época de navidad y también una vitrina para exhibir los artículos, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a salir de esta situación, lo que ella pretende es proporcionar a todos los clientes una variedad de artículos y prendas de vestir para este periodo y así darle al negocio una mejor atracción.
Crecer como comerciante es su principal objetivo pero para obtenerlo debe realizar inversiones que estabilicen sus ventas, progresando no solo como persona sino como microempresaria y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luz lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazán department.  She is 42 years old, and she sells clothes.  She lives with her mother and her siblings.  She is single.

Her business is the only source of income that she has to pay for her necessities.  Her business consists of selling clothes, stuffed animals, sandals, and souvenirs.  She works at her business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  Her business was an enterprising effort that she started four years ago.  Little by little she has been increasing it.

She currently wants to buy merchandise for the Christmas season.  She also wants to buy a showcase to display the items she sells.  However, she does not have the money to do so.  That is why she is requesting a loan that will help her overcome this situation.  She intends to provide her customers with a variety of goods and articles of clothing for this period of time.  That way she will make her business more appealing.

Her main objective is to grow as a businesswoman.  In order to do so she needs to make investments that will stabilize her sales.  She is making progress, not only as a person, but also as a small businesswoman.  She is improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a showcase to display her goods

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana María is a member of the Communal Bank "Miraflores", located in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of Ilave, and the department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married and has seven children. She has a primary school education.
Ana has worked with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for six years. The first loan she took was for 500 PEN, and she used it to increase the capital in her business selling fuel. She is now asking for a new loan of 1,000 PEN, which will allow her to increase her business capital. Her dream is to be able to grow her business.
Ana's favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the savings and the money she is able to earn from them.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, tiene una panadería, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, junto a su familia su esposa, sus dos hijos, la primera de 5 años y la ultima de 8 meses aproximadamente y que dependen económicamente de él, la panadería la tiene ubicada en su casa de residencia y realiza las ventas tanto en su casa como a domicilio. Su producción es en diferentes clases de pan, tiene un empleado que le ayuda a la preparación y  ya tiene 2 años de atenderla trabajando  mañana y tarde, no tiene dificultades  en sus ventas ya que está en una zona accesible.
Él quiere comprar latas para hornear el pan y mejorar el local por lo que solicita un  préstamo que le ayude a realizar esta inversión ya que quiere mejorar su producción aumentando la cantidad de pan que prepara a diario, con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos para el hogar.
La aspiración de él es expandirse más con la panadería, atender a más clientes de la zona, darse a conocer y contar con la preferencia de varias personas, que sus ingresos sean mayores y la estabilidad económica en su hogar sea cada vez mejor.
texts.en:
Julio has a bakery.  He lives in Puerto el Triunfo in Usulután together with his family his wife and his two children.  His eldest child is 5 and his youngest is 8 months.  They depend on him financially.  His bakery is in his own house and he sells his products both from his house and as deliveries.  He produces different types of bread.  He has one employee who helps him to make the bread and he has been serving in the bakery for 2 years, morning and afternoon.  He has no problems with sales as he is in an accessible area.

Julio would like to buy bread pans and also improve his premises which is why he is requesting a loan which will help him to achieve this.  He would like to improve his production, increasing the quantity of bread which he makes each day with the goal of improving his sales and his household income.

Julio's aspiration is to expand his bakery, serve more clients in the area, become known by more people and become the favorite bakery of more people.  He would like to increase his income and improve the financial stability of his household.

loans.use: To purchase baking tins for making bread and to improve the bakery premises

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.es:
Henry se dedica a la venta de varios productos, tiene 37 años de edad, está casado pero aun no tiene hijos, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután,  él vende varios artículos como bocinas para escuchar música, CD, DVD,  pero por el momento quiere también vender ropa ya que lleva 2 años como comerciante. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para realizar la inversión de Ropa, esta nueva actividad la llevaría a cabo a través del préstamo porque no cuenta con los fondos para realizarla. 
Él pretende aumentar sus ventas al diversificar el negocio, y atraer a más clientes, logrando así mayores ingresos para su hogar, además el quiere ser buen cliente pagando puntualmente.
texts.en: Henry is a 37-year-old salesman who sells various products. He’s married and doesn’t yet have any children. He lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulutan. Henry sells music speakers for CD and DVD, but he also wants to start selling clothing, now that he’s been in business for 2 years. He’s currently asking for a loan so that he can invest in clothing, as he doesn’t have any personal funds to invest. He hopes that by diversifying his business, he’ll be able to attract more clients and increase sales; and thus, increase his household income, which will enable him to be a good client and pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pablo P. es un señor ya grande de edad pero a pesar de esto el sigue trabajado para ofrecer a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida. La casa que el tiene la construyo con ahorros propios, solo que ahora el solicita un crédito para remodelar el baño de su casa para que se vea mas presentable.
texts.en: Despite being an older gentleman, Sr. Pablo P. continues to work in order to provide his wife with a better quality of life.   His house was built using his own savings, but now he is requesting a loan to use for remodeling the bathroom so that it will look more presentable.

loans.use: Remodel his bathroom

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra L. y su esposo son unas personas muy trabajadoras que adquirieron su vivienda de interés social a la cual desean poner el parte de enfrente piso firme, por que en temporada de lluvia y cuando hay aire  entra mucha suciedad. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Alejandra L. and her husband are hardworking people who acquired their home through a government subsidy program. They intend to install a solid floor in the front part of their house as protection from the rainy season and the dirty air.

In order to complete this project, Alejandra is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials and pay for labor.

loans.use: Purchase materials & pay for labor to have a floor installed

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: El señor Faustino López Sánchez es pensionado y aparte de este ingreso el tiene como profesión ser músico; en cual trabaja en un grupo de mariachis llamado “Las Águilas”  desde hace 30 años llevando serenatas a todo tipo de evento. La casa que el tiene necesita varios arreglos por lo que el pide el apoyo para reparar el piso del portal para dar mejor presencia.
texts.en:
Sr. Faustino López Sánchez is retired, except for the income he receives as a musician. He has been part of the mariachi band called “Las Águilas” (The Eagles) for 30 years, performing serenades for all types of events.

His house is in need of various repairs, so he is requesting assistance to fix the floor of the entryway to improve its appearance.

loans.use: Repair the floor of his entryway

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora María Del Socorro desea construir un baño en la parte de abajo de su casa por que el que tiene esta en la planta alta y cuando van sus visitas tienen que subir, los cual esto si es incomodo para ella. Ella cuenta que en el lugar donde están las escaleras hay un espacio al cual quiere aprovechar para hacer su proyecto y le saldría más económico ya que no tiene que construir.
texts.en: Sra. María del Socorro wants to install a bathroom in the lower part of her house.  The existing bathroom is in on the upper floor, so it is inconvenient for anyone on the lower floor who has to use it.  She has a place set aside near the staircase.  By taking advantage of this space, the cost of the project will be cheaper since there is less that has to be built.

loans.use: Install a bathroom in her house

loans.name: Doris Amanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Doris Amay es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas, vive en el centro del cantón Gualaceo, cantón conocido como El Jardín del Azuay ubicado a 35 Km. Al este de Cuenca, es un pueblo próspero, asentado en uno de los más bellos valles de la provincia y del país. Es tierra de gran fertilidad, espléndido paisaje y agradable clima por lo que constituye uno de los centros turísticos de gran orden.

La Señora. Doris tiene 27 años,  vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuela del cantón. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar como cocinero. No tiene casa propia, vive en casa de su mamá pero independiente.

Doña Doris por el momento se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos, debido a que se cambio de domicilio tuvo que  dejar su negocio que es un restaurant,  pero con su primer crédito va a retomar el negocio.
 
El dinero lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para iniciar su restaurante. Su meta es tener su restaurante en funcionamiento.
texts.en:
Doris Amay is a member of the Gualaceñitas loan group. She lives in the centre of Gualaceo county, known as "The Garden of Azuay", about 35 kilometers to the east of Cuenca. It's a prosperous town nested in one of the most beautiful valleys in the province and in the country. It is a very fertile land and it offers beautiful scenery and a pleasant climate, which make it an important tourist destination. 

Doris is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and 2 children aged 7 and 4, who attend a school in the county. Her husband works as a cook. She doesn't own a home, but rather lives at her mother's, although independently. 

Doris has been a a housewife looking after the children since she lost her restaurant business when she moved house, but with this first loan she plans to be back in business. The money will be invested in the purchase of products to start a restaurant. Her goal is to see her restaurant in operation.

loans.use: Buy general supplies.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio R. F.  es una persona trabajadora que quiere ir mejorando su calidad de vida; es por ello que ha ido construyendo su vivienda poco a poco para ofrecer a su familia comodidad y un buen patrimonio para el futuro. El señor quiere terminar un baño que empezó hace tiempo y por otras cosas que se le han presentado no ha podido terminarlo; por eso es que pide el apoyo para terminar su proyecto ya que necesita pintar el baño y comprar accesorios.
texts.en:
José Antonio R. F. is a hardworking individual who wants to improve his quality of life. For this reason, he has gradually built a home to provide his family comfort and a valuable asset for their future inheritance.

José wants to finish a bathroom he started some time ago and other projects that have not been completed. For this reason, he is requesting assistance so that he can buy paint and accessories needed to complete this project.

loans.use: Purchase paint & accessories needed to complete a bathroom

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto C. se dedica a la renta de video juegos desde hace 10 años donde los distribuye en varias tiendas de abarrotes donde recurre mas niños para que puedan jugar en este aparato. Roberto desea que se le apoye para poder adquirir  maquinaria para seguir generando más ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto C. has been renting out video games for ten years. He distributes them to different stores that have a number of children who come play on the units.

Roberto wants to acquire additional machines so that he can continue generating more income for his family.

loans.use: Purchase video game machines

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es: Gricelda Ríos E. desde hace 10 años es vendedora ambulante lo cual ella ofrece herramienta de segunda mano a un bajo precio al que en este momento quiere comprar mercancía para incrementar sus ventas. La señora Gricelda es madre soltera de 2 pequeños por quienes tiene que trabajar para ofrecerles una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en: For 10 years, Gricelda Ríos E. has been an itinerant seller offering second hand hardware at a low price.  Currently, she wants to purchase merchandise in order to increase her sales.
