Señora Gricelda is a single mother with two small children.  She has to work in order to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her business.

loans.name: Parque Del Niño (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Parque Del Niño en la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital manabita, conocida desde hace muchos años como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Parque Del Niño. Este es un grupo de señoras que se conocen muy bien ya que este es su quinto ciclo juntas. Ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios).

Aquí conversamos con la señora Julissa, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos  de 17 – 16 – 14 y 9 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su marido es chofer de una volqueta. 

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal y Lebel (productos de belleza y perfumería). Además vende prendas interiores de la marca Leonisa. Trabaja todos los días desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00, ya que en las mañanas se dedica a atender su  hogar y a sus hijos. La ropa intima es también de catalogo y recibe este producto en una distribuidora en el centro de la ciudad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes que le realizan sus pedidos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar más mercadería para aumentar sus ventas. En especial los productos de oferta y las prendas íntimas que tienen mucha acogida entre sus clientas. Este es su quinto crédito y le ha gustado por la facilidad para obtener los créditos. Su sueño es tener una boutique o un bazar bien surtido.
texts.en:
The Parque del Niño loan group meets every fortnight in the area known as Parque del Niño in the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Manabi province, which has been known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarindos. The all-female group members know each other very well after five cycles together. They work in different fields (trade, sales, production and services). 

We speak to Julissa, 37, who is married with four children aged 17, 16, 14 and 9. The eldest ones go to secondary school and the youngest girl goes to primary school. Her husband is a truck driver.

She works in trading, selling Yanbal and Lebel beauty products and perfumes. She also sells Leonisa underwear. She works every day from 3pm to 7pm because in the morning she looks after the house and her children. She sells the underwear via catalogue and receives the goods from a distributor in the city centre. She sells on credit and is paid weekly. She says she has a large customer base that places orders with her. 

She is going to use the loan to buy more goods so as to increase sales. Products on special offer and underwear are especially well received by her customers. This is her first loan and she likes the ease of obtaining credit. Her dream is to own a well-stocked shop or store.

loans.use: Buy underwear and cosmetics.

loans.name: Pilo

texts.es: El señor Pilo G.  cuenta con su negocio de comida denominado “Tortas Max” en que ofrece los siguientes platillos: hamburguesas, tortas y gorditas de diferentes guisos, los cuales ofrece a un bajo precio de acuerdo a la economía de sus clientes. Con esta actividad  tiene dos años la cual es su  fuente ingreso extra ya que el trabaja en un centro comercial de guardia y su esposa operadora en una maquiladora. Esta familia desea prosperar pero sobre todo ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Señor Pilo G. has a food business called “Torta Max” that offers the following dishes:  hamburgers, cakes and gorditas (biscuits stuffed with different stews).  He offers these at low prices to accommodate his customers’ income.  

He has had this business for two years.  It is a source of extra income since he works in a shopping center as a security guard, and his wife is employed in a manquiladora (foreign-owned assembly plant).  This family wants to prosper but, above all, offer their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To stock his business

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa.
El señor Raúl Álvarez  y su esposa tienen un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años, donde ofrece variedad de estilos y colores a sus clientes. En este momento ellos desean invertir en el negocio para con esos ingresos ponerle techo a uno de los cuartos que están construyendo y ya empezar habitarlos.
texts.en: Raúl Álvarez and his wife have had a business selling used clothing for 4 years. They offer a variety of styles and colors to their customers.  At this time, they want to invest in the business so that they can put a ceiling on one of their rooms that they are building in order to start living in them.  The person shown in the picture is Raúl's wife.

loans.use: To stock their business of used clothing.

loans.name: Hector Gerardo

texts.es: El señor Héctor Gerardo G. desde hace 1 año se dedica a ofrecer servicio a los automovilistas para la reparación de frenos, su taller solo esta especializado para hacer este tipo de arreglos negocio llamado “Centro de servicios King Frenos”. Héctor desea invertir en este negocio ya que su fuente de ingresos del cual mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: One year ago Héctor Gerardo G. began earning a living by offering brake repair services to automobile drivers. His shop specializes in this type of work. The business is named "King Brakes Service Center". Héctor wishes to invest in this business since it is his source of income with which he supports his family.

loans.use: To invest in the business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan P. González cuenta con una carpintería donde realiza trabajos como lo son closets, cocinas integrales, bases para camas, comedores, sillas depende de lo que el cliente requiera de acuerdo a la medida deseada, el cual desea invertir mas en este negocio.
El señor es una persona muy trabajadora que le gusta su oficio como carpintero ya que de esta manera; es como  gana más dinero para mantener los gastos de su familia. El tiene a su cargo su madre que ya es grande de edad y pensionada, de esta manera ellos se ayudan para cubrir los gastos.
texts.en:
Juan P. G. has a woodworking shop where he has jobs working on: closets, integrated kitchens, baseboards for beds, living room sets, and chairs; it all depends on the size and needs the client desires, which is why he would like to invest more in the business.
He is a very hard working person who loves his profession as a carpenter since this is how he makes money to sustain his household expenses.
He cares for his elderly mother who lives on a pension and this way they both help each other out with expenses.

loans.use: Stock the business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen Sánchez L. y su esposo tienen un local donde se hace reparación de llantas desde hace 3 años al que desean darle una buena inversión para así generar más ingresos a su familia. El negocio ofrece el servicio de colocación de llantas, aire, parchar etc. La señora es madre de 3 pequeños a quienes quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y un buen patrimonio.
texts.en: María Del Carmen Sánchez L. and her husband have had a tire repair shop for three years and would like to make a good investment in it so as to generate more income for their family. The business offers services including tire mounting, air, patches, etc. She is mother to three young children to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life and a good inheritance.

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: Deniza

texts.es: Deniza G. López es vendedora ambulante y tiene un negocio de la venta de ropa usada desde hace 20 años el cual se ubica en lugar muy concurrido, donde se observa prosperidad. Ella es madre de solo tiene a su cargo 1 hijos al que desea ofrecerle una mejora calidad  de vida. En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo para surtir su negocio de ropa para temporada de frio.
texts.en: Deniza G. López is a street vendor and has had a business selling used clothing for 20 years.  Her business is located in a busy and properous place.  She is the mother of 1 child and wants to offer them a better quality of life.  Now she is requesting a loan to stock her clothing buiness for the cold season.

loans.use: To invest in her used clothing business.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es:
Máyela R.  C. es una mujer emprendedora, siempre ha tenido su propio negocio de venta por catalogo pero ahora quiere tener su propio bazar.
Ella es de San Cristóbal de San Jose, una pequeña comunidad a 1 hora de San Jose conocida especialmente por la belleza panorámica y la calidad de sus habitantes.
En este momento Doña Máyela necesita un préstamo de ₡603 000 (Seiscientos Tres mil colones) para la compra de zapatos, cosméticos bisutería, y  artículos de librería  que pondrá vender desde su local. Esto será un paso adelante en su vida como microempresaria.
Ella es socia de  la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica, y además una de las ECCs mas ejemplares de Costa Rica
texts.en:
Máyela R. C. is an enterprising woman who has always had her own business selling by catalog but now she wants to have her own variety shop. She is from San Cristóbal de San José, a small community one hour from San José known especially for its panoramic beauty and the quality of its inhabitants. 

At this time Doña Máyela needs a loan of ₡603,000 (six hundred and three thousand colons) for purchasing shoes, cosmetics, costume jewelry and stationery supplies which she will be able to sell from her store. This will be a step forward in her life as the owner of a micro-enterprise. 

She is a member of the communal bank "San Cristóbal Norte" (SACRIN), one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica and furthermore one of the most exemplary communal banks of Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy shoes, cosmetics and costume jewelry

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es: La señora Luz Idalia C. R. y su esposo preparan pasteles de todo tipo de evento como lo es fiestas infantiles, día de las madres, despedidas de soltera, bodas, quince años y otros eventos desde hace 15 años. El negocio es denominado Panadería Amistad al que desean que incrementen más su ventas para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida para esto desea un préstamo para surtirlo.
texts.en: Mrs Luz Idalia C. R. and her husband bake cakes for all sorts of occasions such as children's birthdays, mother's day, bachelorette parties, weddings, girls' 15th birthday celebrations and other events.  They have been in this business for 15 years.  Their business is called “Panadería Amistad' ('Friendship Bakery').  They would like to increase their sales in order to offer their family a better standard of living.  For this reason she is requesting a loan to stock her business.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan Ernesto Mejía A. y su esposa cuentan con la venta de hamburguesas con papas a un bajo precio desde hace 1 año aparte de esta actividad distribuyen queso asadero y chorizo a su conocidos.
Ernesto desea invertir en producto para negocio de hamburguesas por que es el que le esta generando mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan Ernesto Mejía A. and his wife have been selling hamburgers and fries at a low price for 1 year.  In addition to this activity, they distribute cheese (queso asadero-mild, chewy cheese) and sausage to their acquaintances.

Ernesto wants to invest in products for his hamburger business to generate more profits.

loans.use: To stock his hamburger business.

loans.name: Luz Victoria

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 47 años que reside junto a su esposo y a sus menores hijos en el caserío Humedades del distrito de Salas, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de miel de abeja, polen y algarrobina desde hace ocho años. Estos productos los adquiere de los productores de la zona y los ofrece a la venta al público en general. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino. Los ingresos que ella percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares.

Luz desea contar con un capital fijo que le permita adquirir mas productos para venderlos y de ese modo mantener su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de contar conun futuro estable y próspero, por ello se esfuerza siempre por salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is a 47-year-old mother who lives together with her husband and young children in the hamlet Humedades in the district of Salas, an agricultural region that belongs to the province of Lambayeque, situated an hour and ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been sellling bee honey, pollen, and algarrobina (syrup from the Black Carob tree) for the past eight years. She buys these products from the producers in the region and offers them for sale to the general public. Additionally, she raises and sells sheep. She uses the income that she receives from these activities to help her husband pay the family expenses.

Luz wishes to count on fixed capital that will allow her to buy more products to sell, and in this manner maintain her business. For this reason she has requested a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa with which she thinks she will achieve her objective. Her greatest wish is to offer her children the opportunity to count on a stable and prosperous future, and for that reason she always makes an effort to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: To buy bee honey and algarrobina (Black Carob tree syrup) to make and sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en caserío Quemazón del distrito de Mórrope, una zona rural que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral como patos, pavos, gallinas, palomas, entre otras. Ella cría los animales en algunos corrales situados en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad de encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Agustina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y de alimento balanceado con los cuales espera aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayor número de ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Con este dinero Agustina planea seguir creciendo como empresaria y seguir ayudando a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economñia. En la zona ella es una mujer bastante respetada y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 39 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the village of Quemazón in the district of Mórrope, a rural area which is in Lambayeque province, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Agustina has been raising and selling poultry such as ducks, turkeys, hens and doves for more than five years.  She raises the animals in pens on her property.  When the animals have reached a good level of growth she offers them for sale to her neighbors and the traders who visit the area where she lives.  With the profits she makes from this activity, she helps her husband with the family's finances.

Agustina would like to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and nutrionally-balanced feed with which she hopes to increase her sales and make more profit.  For this reason she has requested her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 nuevos soles.

With this money, Agustina plans to continue growing as a businesswoman and continue helping her family with the household finances.  In her area she is a respected woman and her neighbors and acquaintances think very highly of her.

loans.use: Purchase of animals and nutritionally-balanced feed to expand her business of raising and selling poultry

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el sector Huaca Partida, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, zona ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente de ovejas, el cría las ovejas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estas ya han alcanzado el tamaño y peso adecuado las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona en dode vive. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero agrícola y brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte) el vehículo es de su madre y el trabaja allí en sus tiempos libres.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento con los cuales pueda ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ganancias. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

El es un joven bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the sector Huaca Partida, a rural region of the Pítipo district, located in the province of Ferreñafe, which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For one year he has been raising and selling small animals, especially sheep. He raises the sheep in the backyard of his home and when they have reached the correct size and weight, he offers them for sale to dealers who always frequent the region where he lives. Additionally, he works as an agricultural worker and offers cargo and passenger transport services in a moto-taxi (motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle that carries an attached cabin to offer transport services). The vehicle is his mother's, and he works there in his free time.

José wishes to grow his business with the purchase of more animals and feed to receive greater profits. For this reason he has recognized the need to request a loan of 1500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to help him reach his goal.

He is a young and responsible man, with a huge desire to get ahead. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessperson, in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family. Previously, he has had loans with Edpyme Alternative and he has demonstrated that he is a punctual and responsible customer when it comes to making payments.

loans.use: To buy small animals and feed to sell and increase his business

loans.name: Dexy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dexy tiene 30 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a sus dos hijos en casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito pesquero de San José, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir en su domicilio. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y conocidos del distrito donde reside. El negocio le brinda los ingresos suficientes para hacerse cargo del mantenimiento de sus hijos y de apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Dexy desea adquirir más material y mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda que suele incrementarse por presentarse la temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer luchadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Dexy is 30 years old, separated, and lives with her two sons in her parents' home, which is located in the fishing district of San José, an area that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located at more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been working for three years making and selling clothes at home.  Her main customers are her neighbors and acquaintances in the district where she lives.  The business provides enough income to provide for her children and support her parents in their daily expenses.

Dexy wants to acquire more material and goods to meet demand that tends to increase in the Christmas season.  She has therefore seen fit to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa, for a loan of 1500 soles to achieve her goal.

She is a very responsible woman who is devoted to her family.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur to be able to raise her children.  People who know Dexy regard her as a fighter and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Julia Lucila

texts.es:
Julia tiene 43 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a su hija en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos con mayor población de la región y el distrito con mayores indicadores de pobreza ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en una zona aledaña al Mercado Modelo (el principal mercado de la ciudad de Chiclayo) llamada Galerías Rosadas, ella vende ropa tanto nueva como usada y trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta muy avanzada la tarde. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso que sostiene a su familia, por lo que ella trata de dar todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante, gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido apoyar a su hija en sus estudios de enfermería, lo que la llena de orgullo.

 Julia es una mujer que ya ha trabajado con préstamos financiados por el fondo Kiva, esta es su tercera vez y ella nos comenta que con los préstamos que se le otorgaron anteriormente ella pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio durante las diversas temporadas de venta. En esta oportunidad ella desea implementar el negocio con nuevas prendas, sobretodo de la temporada de verano, ya que el calor ya se está haciendo sentir en la zona y ella desea tener la mercadería suficiente para responder a la demanda una vez cambiada la estación. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella se encuentra bastante contenta y agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través del programa Kiva, durante el tiempo que viene trabajando ella ha demotrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Julia is 43 years old, separated, and lives with her daughter in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, one of the most populous districts of the region and the region with the highest poverty indicators, located within 5 minutes of the city of Chiclayo.
For 10 years she has had a business selling clothes in a store next to the Mercado Modelo (the main market in the city of Chiclayo), called Galerías Rosadas. She sells both new and used clothes and works from very early in the morning until very late in the evening. Her business is the only source of income that supports her family, so she tries to give her all to make the business successful. Thanks to this business, she has been able to support her daughter in her nursing studies, and this fills her with pride.
Julia is a woman who has already had loans financed by Kiva. This is her third loan and she told us that the loans she had previously enabled her to buy goods for her business during the different sales season. For this opportunity, she wants to get new clothes for the business, particularly summer season clothes because the heat is already starting to be felt in the area and she wants to have enough stock to respond to demand once the season changes. For this reason she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of $375.
She is happy and grateful to the people who collaborate with her through the Kiva program. During the time that she has been working with the organization she has shown herself to be punctual and responsible about making her repayments.

loans.use: To buy clothes to grow her business selling in the market.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una madre D. familia D. 39 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Poste Blanco del distrito D. Paiján, el lugar pertenece a L. provincia D. Ascope y se encuentra ubicado en L. región L. Libertad, a más D. dos horas y media D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. L. región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a L. comercialización D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, elL. ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. consumo diario brindándoles un trato amable, por lo que siempre cuenta con una clienteL. estable. El negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. L. economía D. su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. más mercadería D. modo que pueda satisfacer L. demanda D. sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para ayudar a su familia a mejorar su calidad D. vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer amable y servicial.
texts.en:
María is a 39 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Poste Blanco neighborhood of Paiján district in the province of Ascope, in the region of L. Libertad, more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

María sells groceries in a store located in her own home.  She offers her customers a range of basic products with a friendly service which means that she always has a stable customer base.  The business has allowed her to help her husband contribute to the family's finances.

María would like to expand her business with the purchase of more goods so that she can satisfy her customers' demands.  For this reason she has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

María's biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to help her family to improve their standard of living.  The people who know her consider her to be a friendly and helpful woman.

loans.use: Purchase of basic products and groceries to expand her small grocery store

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Evelia  es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo ya a sus tres hijos el en caserío La Mónicas – Palo Parado del distrito de Tambrogrande, una zona agrícola ubicada en la región  Piura, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. Ella cría gallinas y pavos en su domicilio alimentándolas de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a sus vecinos o a los negociantes de la zona. Adicionalmente apoya a su esposo con el mantenimiento de su cultivo de mango y limón. Juntos ellos tratan siempre de sacar adelante a su familia.

Evelia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas aves y alimento balanceado para aumentar sus ventas y pecibir mayores ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Evelia is a 26 year old mother who lives with her husband and their 3 kids in a hamlet called La Mónicas – Palo Parado in the Tambrogrande district, an agricultural area in the Piura region, which is more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque. 
She works raising and selling poultry. She raises chickens and turkeys at her home, and feeds them grain and natural pastes. When they reach a good size, she offers them for sale to her neighbors or to businesses in the area. She also helps her husband look after his mango and lemon crops. Together, they always try to move their family forward in life.
Evelia wants to grow her business by buying more birds and chicken feed in order to increase her sales and make greater profits. For this reason she decided to approach Edpyme Alternativa for the first time and is requesting a loan of $200. 
She is a responsible and hardworking woman. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to offer her family a better quality of life. The people who know her consider her to be a responsible and reliable woman.

loans.use: To buy poultry and chicken feed to grow her business raising and selling chickens.

loans.name: Amanjol

texts.en:
Amanjol M. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and child in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.
Amanjol is a very busy man, owning not just one business, but two. He operates a shoe repair business in the local market during the day and he drives a taxi at night. Amanjol began his shoe repair business in 2000 with the help of his mother, and since 2009 he has been operating the business alone. He is a very gentle and hardworking man and says, "I would eventually like to change my workplace for the future so that I can grow my earnings and expand my customer base." Amanjol is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies (such as rubber, glue, leather and nails) that he needs for his shoe repair business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies (such as rubber, glue, leather and nails)

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him A. S. is a single mother of three children, two of whom are married and live away from home while the other is employed as a garment worker overseas. Her husband died of senility many years ago.
Him A. S. buys fish in bulk from a place that is full of fishermen. She then hurries to bring the fish to the busy market, where she sells them retail. Him A. S. is a hardworking woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of increasing customer demand, she is applying for a loan to purchase more fish.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Batmunh D. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic home tent) in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His oldest daughter attends university while his younger two sons attend a local secondary school.
Batmunh owns his own iron/metal work business producing metal items such as stoves, stove pipes, smokestacks etc. according to his customer's order. He began his business in 1994 and has gained much experience as an ironsmith. After Batmunh produces the items, his wife sells them at the local market. He hopes to continue running this business as a stable operation. His earnings have enabled him not only to provide for his family but also pay his daughter's tuition fees. His business is the only source of family income.
Batmunh is a modest and hardworking man. He is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase raw materials for making metal household items.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making metal household items

loans.name: Kulash

texts.en:
Kulash J. is a 38-year-old single mother with three children. She lives with her children in ger, a traditional Mongolian home tent, in Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. All her children attend a local school.
Kulash started her own business in 2000 by operating a small grocery shop next to her home. Since 2009, she has been operating a clothing retail business in a rented stall at a local clothing market. She sells a variety of different clothing items and accessories and her wide product selection attracts many young customers. She imports products worth between 300,000 and 400,000 MNT once a month, both from Erlian and Taikeshken, two border cities of China. Her daily average sales are between 60,000 and 100,000 MNT and monthly net profit is around 300,000 to 400,000 MNT.
Kulash is a very honest woman. About the future, she says, "I would like to raise my children to become good people with a good education." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import more clothing items from China for her business.

loans.use: To import more clothing items

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es: El señor Gualberto C. López tiene 45 años casados con la Señora Mauricia Ledezma García más de  18 años, tienen 3 hijos menores dependientes que estudian en nivel primaria, en la escuela rural de la comunidad, actividad principal es la agricultura produce papa, arveja, cebolla, haba y maíz en su terreno de 1.5 hectáreas en la comunidad de Ucuchi, es una familia humilde de pocos recursos pero muy trabajadores, están a 26 km de la ciudad de Cbba para ellos  acudir a los bancos para un préstamo de dinero es muy difícil.  Se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. Donde Don Gualberto C. López necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgánico, semilla de papa para la siembra de este año, don Gualberto nos comenta que la producción agrícola en este año ha sido poco por factores climáticos como la sequia, si este año no siembra no tendría alimentación ni dinero tampoco ahorro para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Gualberto is 45 years old, has been married to Mauricia for more than 18 years, and has 3 children who are minors and who are at the community primary school. His main business activity is agriculture, and he grows potatoes, oats, onions, beans, and corn on his 1.5 hectares of land in the community of Ucuchi. His is a humble family of few financial resources, but they are very hardworking. They live 26 km from the city of Cochabamba. For them, going to a bank to get a loan is very difficult. He took the initiative to go to this rural area. Gualberto needed money to buy organic fertilizer and seed potatoes for this year's sowing. Gualberto told us that the agricultural production this year has been low because of climatic factors such as drought. If he doesn't sow crops this year he will not have food or money saved-up to look after his family.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and seeds. Operating capital.

loans.name: Sarhad

texts.en:
Sarhad B. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. His oldest two sons are both university students and his youngest two daughters attend a local high school while his wife is retired.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.

Sarhad has been operating a coal selling business in his town since 2001. Even though he is an old man, he operates two businesses in order to educate his children with the proceeds. In 2009, he started collecting livestock to sell.

Sarhad needs more funds to prepare meat in bulk for winter, therefore he is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase better work tools

loans.name: Suleimen

texts.en:
Suleimen H. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and five children in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling) in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. His four children, ranging in age from 7 to 15 years old, all attend local school while his wife, who is disabled, stays at home with their youngest child.

Suleimen operates a transportation service business between Bayan-Ulgiy and the neighbouring province of Hovd. He has been engaged in this business since 2006 and has gained much experience as a driver. He has been so successful in his business that he was able to buy a new mini bus for himself. Moreover, his earnings have enabled him to rebuild his house.  He plans on expanding his transportation business in order to further improve his family’s quality of life and to stabilize his earnings.

Suleimen is a very gentle, optimistic and open minded man and is requesting a 330,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary parts in order to repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase necessary parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: working capital to buy merchandise (cosmetics)

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
This is 45 year old Rita B..  She is married and has 3 children aged 26, 22 and 17.  In 1998 she established her tailoring business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supoorts her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.  In the future, Rita plans to raise the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailors stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local microfinance institution partner Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunities to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Agusta

texts.es:
La señora Agusta S. Y. se dedica a la venta de refrescos en la provincia Carrasco del departamento de Cochabamba, tiene 3 hijos a los cuales los cuida y se encarga de hacerlos estudiar.

La señora Agusta tiene su puesto de venta en la carretera donde pasan  muchos camiones quienes son su mayor clientela, debido al clima caluroso que se vive entropico su negocio es seguro, vendo a toda horas incluso hasta altas horas de la noche. 

La sseñora Agusta quiere que sus hijos estudien una carrera tecnica en la ciudad de Cochabamba y para ello necesita ahorrar pero con  lo poco que gana no puede ahorrar apenas le alcanza para comer, razon por la que quiere incrementar sus capital comprar una pequeña heladera para poder vender mas y asi despues de cancelar todo el credito podra ahorrar y lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Agusta S. Y. sells soft drinks in the Carrasco province of the department of Cochabamba.  She has 3 children in her care, and she is in charge of their education.

Agusta has a sales post on the street where many trucks pass.  These are her main customers.  Due to the very hot climate where she lives, this business is secure.  She sells at all hours, including the very late hours of the night.

Agusta wants her children to get technical degrees in the city of Cochabamba, and to do this she needs to save, but with the little she earns, she scarcely saves enough to pay for food.  For this reason she wants to increase her capital to buy a small refrigerator so that she could sell more and, after paying off the loan, could save and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Ratna Shova

texts.en:
Mrs. Ratna Shova B. lives in a single-family home with her husband, two daughters and one son in Tangal, Lalitpur district, Nepal. Her older daughter works in a private office and her younger daughter is studying at university. Her son left school and now makes religious statues.
Tangal has one of the busiest bazaars in the Lalitpur district. Mrs. Maharjan and her husband, Mr. Gyan Bhakta, opened their tailoring shop 12 years ago. They make different types of custom-fitted ladies' dresses, including kurta-salwar, blouses, and trousers. Tailoring is the traditional work of their family and they were trained by their fathers. Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of 30,000 NPR to buy cloth, cutting tools, and other supplies for her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy cloth, cutting tools and other supplies

loans.name: Phei Ro Group Loan

texts.en:
Eleven women in Krasaing Chrum Tabong village in Kampong Thom Province have formed a group loan. The eleven members of this lending group are part of AMK’s Loan Workout Program. All clients have outstanding loans that are delinquent and they are currently unable to pay back the full amount of their existing loan.

Their business ventures, which they funded using their existing loan, have failed, putting them in a very unfortunate position. In addition, less work at garment factories and sickness in their families have drastically reduced other sources of income for each family. All eleven clients will use their loan to start a new business making ties and pillow cases.

As part of AMK’s workout program, each client is given a workout loan that will be used to purchase sewing machines, an electricity line and additional sewing equipment. AMK has hired a tailor to train the group to make ties and pillow cases. The material will be provided by AMK to ensure that quality material is used and so that the clients do not have to purchase it themselves.

AMK has partnered with Ahkun.org to sell their ties and pillow cases online. Fifty percent of all profits will go to this group and the other borrowers in their village who are unable to repay their loan.

This program is in contrast to the traditional ways that microfinance institutions deal with delinquent clients.  These traditional ways are:
• By rescheduling the loan and pushing off the problem to another day
• Repossessing items that the clients own, including their house or land.

Because of AMK’s strong social mission, AMK has created this program to provide an alternative solution to one of microfinance’s dark sides. We hope that Kiva Lenders will support us in this initiative.

loans.use: To start a new business making ties and pillow cases.

loans.name: Rukumani

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Rukumani T.. She is married and has two children aged 14 and 3.
In 2008, Rukumani established a business making metal utensils. She works in this business five hours a day, seven days a week in order to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid a loan from Kiva partner, Patan Business and Professional Women, and used her most recent loan to purchase raw materials such as bronze, wax, iron etc. for her work. In the future, Rukumani plans to improve her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.

About Nepal's artisans
Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.
About Patan Business and Professional Women
This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. It operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates and join our lending team.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 36, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. is a tailor and sells beverages, earning an income of 9 USD per day. S. has to spend 70 USD on food and 30 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase more beverages and groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy stock such as beverages and groceries

loans.name: To

texts.en: Mr. To V., 35, is a fisherman and single father living in Kompon Tom Province. He was married years ago but divorced. Mr. V. typically spends eight hours a day fishing in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches about 15 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers, who are retail sellers in the market. Currently, Mr. V. is living with his four children, all of whom are single. Three of his children are students and one is a local fish seller. Mr. V. will use his loan to purchase fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. is a housewife and her husband is employed at a mirror shop, earning an income of 7.6 USD per day. S. has to spend 50 USD on food and 20 USD on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. is not available.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem M., 50, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. M. and her husband are fish sellers, earning an income of 2 USD each per day. M. has to spend 70 USD on food and 10 USD on other necessary expenses every month. 

M. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer to improve her family farming. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

M.'s husband appears in the photograph because M. is not available.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn S., 36, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells groceries, earning an income of 14 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of 4 USD per day. S. spends 80 USD on food and 50 USD on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 2 each per day. S. has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to use for the next growing season. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Borrower Tungalag is 26 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on her father’s plot of land. Her husband operates a retail business by construction. 

Tungalag operates a construction materials trade business in a rented stall at the largest market in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business in 2006 with capital of 500.000 MNT. After several years of operation, she has gained a lot of experience. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and is planning to build a new house in the future. Tungalag is an open-minded person who has very good communication skills. She is requesting 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies for her construction materials trade business

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her construction materials trade business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok L., 54, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. L. is a vegetable seller, earning an income of USD 13 per day. L. has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month.  

L. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Larch

texts.en:
Larch I., 50, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. I. is a grocery seller and a Christian missionary, earning an income of USD 17 per day. I. has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  

I. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store.  In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Mourm

texts.en:
Mourm S., 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. produces traditional baskets to sell, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day. 

S. has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  She is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg is 26 years old, and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her eldest son attends a secondary school and her parents are caring for her youngest daughter. 

Since 2006, Batchimeg and her husband have been operating a carpentry business out of their home. They manufacture wood furniture products including chairs, wardrobes, tables and sofas. Batchimeg started in this business with her parents in 2000, and she has gained valuable experience and has a loyal customer base. She and her husband have been planning to expand their production line to increase their sales. Batchimeg and her husband are requesting a loan to purchase a car /pickup, so they can deliver their products to the market and other customer locations.

loans.use: Loan to puchase a car for her business

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en:
Kuch C., 50, is widowed and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. C. sells chickens, earning an income of USD 3.30 per day. Her three children are employed at factories, earning an income of USD 3 each per day. C. has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 75 on other necessary expenses every month.  

C. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more chickens to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more chickens to resell

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth Y., 48, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Y. sells rice, earning an income of USD 3.30 per day. Her husband raises pigs, earning an income of USD 5.30 per day. Y. has to spend USD 35 on food and USD 110 on other necessary expenses every month.  

Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more rice to stock for sale when the price is good. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more rice to stock for sale

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Tes V., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. V. weaves Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of USD 8.60 per day. Her husband sells cows, earning an income of USD 5 per day. 

V. has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 85 on other necessary expenses every month. V. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more silk products to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more silk products to sell

loans.name: Unathan

texts.en:
Unathan O. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son is a university student and other children attend a local school. His wife is disabled. 

Unathan operates a milk and mare's milk trading business in his town. He started his business in 1998 with only one milch cow and 3 calves. Today, he has 5 cows and 5 mares at his home that produce the milk he sells. On average, his cows and mares can produce about 15 liters of milk and 10 liters of fermented milk in one day respectively. 

Over the many years of successful operation, his business has reached to a sustainable level and he has used his earnings to purchase a new car for himself. He has gained a many permanent and loyal customers and partners. Unathan is a gentle and open-minded man. He says, " I plan to buy a mare from the Gobi provinces." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase hay to feed his cattle as well as buy one more mare.

loans.use: To purchase hay to feed his cattle and buy one more mare

loans.name: Yolka

texts.en:
Yolka S. is 44 years old and lives with her family in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province of Mongolia. They have been living at their current address for the past 10 years. Her daughter, age 22, works as a part-time teacher in the university and her son attends university. 

Yolka operates a grocery business in the local vegetable market in their town with help of her husband. She began her vegetable trading business in 2004 and has become very well established in the many years since. Her husband is responsible for planting a variety of vegetables in spring and summertime and harvesting in fall. Her earnings are the main source for her family's income and have enabled her to provide for her entire family and pay her son's tuition fee as well. 

Yolka is a very modest person who dreams of having her own greenhouse in the future, after her son has completed his university studies. She is requesting a 850,000 MNT loan in order to purchase  and preserve carrots in her cellar.

loans.use: To purchase  and preserve carrots

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem K., 38, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. K. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 1.60 per day. Her husband sells soy milk, earning an income of USD 8.30 per day. K. has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 100 on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport soy milk to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Tourn

texts.en: Tourn K., 49, is married. She resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. K. weaves Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day. K. has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 65 on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Mork

texts.en: Mork T., 47, is married. She resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. T. weaves Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day. T. has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 60 on other necessary expenses every month. T. is requesting a loan to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Chang

texts.en: Chang K., 36, is married and resides with her husband in TaK. Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. K. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 1.5 each per day. K. has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 5 on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase hair dressing equipment to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy hair dressing equipment

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo K., 68, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. K. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of 1 USD each per day. Keo spends 40 USD on food and 10 USD on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase raw silk to produce silk products to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

K.'s daughter appears in the photograph because K. is not available.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products for resale

loans.name: Hoeurng

texts.en:
Hoeurng C., 30, is a married mother. Hoeurng currently works as a masseuse on staff with a proper monthly salary in Siem Reap Province. She is married to Mr. Chan Thoun, 40, who shares responsibility for the family by working as a policeman. They are good parents to four children, who are students at the public school. 

Hoeurng C. is concerned that she faces difficulties in travelling to her workplace because her motor is broken from overuse. Hoeurng’s personal savings are not enough to buy a replacement. Hoeurng has therefore requested a loan of $300 to buy a used motorcycle to replace her broken one.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en:
Sergelen is 44 years old, and he lives with his wife and 2 sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His eldest son Tserenpuntsag, is 9 and attends a local secondary school. His youngest son Tuvshinbayar, is 2 years old and stays at home with his mum. 

Mr. Sergelen's wife Tuul operates sewing business at home while Sergelen operates a taxi business in the city. Sergelen is hard working person and is known for his friendly character. He likes his business and enjoys transporting people.  His dream is to have their own family house and to give a proper education for their kids. He has gained a lot of experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many customers. The loan he is requesting will be used to improve his living condition and to buy some furniture.

loans.use: to improve family's living condition and to buy some furniture

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng P., 50, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. P. is a construction worker, earning an income of 2 USD per day. His wife sells snacks, earning an income of 1 USD per day. P. spends 50 USD on food and 75 USD on other necessary expenses every month. 

P. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase a motorbike to start another business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. 

P.'s wife appears in the photograph because P. is not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ashran's Group

texts.en:
Ashran, 55, is a widow living in Depalpur, a small city in Pakistan. She has lived with her parents since the death of her husband. She has no children. Her brother owns a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops. He also operates a fertilizer and seed selling business which he has been doing for over 10 years. He contributes to his family financially from his earnings.

Ashran operates a dairy business from her home. She keeps a buffalo and sells its milk to her neighboring clients in order to contribute financially to her family. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother. Her brother will invest the loan money in his fertilizer and seed selling business by buying these items in bulk. Ashran is very dedicated to her brother and wishes for him that he grows his business and becomes successful in his future. This is her first loan from Asasah.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for resale.

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Om S., 28, owns a grocery shop where she sells many items including cooking ingredients, sweets and soft drinks. Om retails her inventory to passer-bys and her neighbors. She has been running her grocery business for over three years and earns an average of $4 a day. To ensure financial stability for the entire family, her husband is a local porter. The couple currently have no children. Om hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a $300 loan to be used to accumulate a larger number of grocery items for resale. This will allow her to increase her income to ensure her family attains a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is a resident of Depalpur, a small city in Pakistan. She is a 50-year-old housewife who stays at her home doing her household responsibilities. She lives in an area named 38 D where she owns a three room brick house. She has given birth to three sons and two daughters. 

Her eldest son runs a barber shop in the market. The next oldest attends the 5th grade class. She is unable to provide educational facilities to her remaining children due to her poor financial situation. 

Her husband operates a dairy business. For that purpose he has kept some buffalos at home. Khursheed also provides help to her husband in his business by taking care of his buffalos. She gives them food and water on time and keeps their place clean so they never catch by any diseases.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s dairy business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him to increase the productivity of milk and fulfill his customers' high demand on time.  He has been doing this business for over 10 years and Khursheed is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to increase his income by expanding his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her duties responsibly and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Zulaikhan's Group

texts.en:
Zulaikhan is a resident of Depalpur, an ancient city of Pakistan. She lives there in an area named 38 D with her family. 
 
Her husband, M. Y., is a salesman by profession and sells bakery products. He is the only breadwinner of the family. He sells different products such as bread, cakes and biscuits to different bakeries and stores to good profit. He has been doing this business for over 10 years. 

She is the mother of two daughters and a son. All of them are getting their education from a local school. Zulaikhan is an uneducated lady but she is aware of the importance of education that’s why she wants for her children to complete their education and become successful in life.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy bakery products like bread, cakes and biscuits in bulk quantity and increase his sales. She is hopeful that this investment will bring positive outcomes for her husband’s business and their living standard will become better.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy bakery products for selling

loans.name: Rafiqaan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqaan belongs to the city of Depalpur, which is in Pakistan. She has been living with her family in a two room brick house for many years. 

Her husband has been involved in medicine selling business for over 10 years and runs a medical store in the community. She is the mother of six children but only three of them are able to get education and the others are free and don’t do anything.  

Rafiqaan herself is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very active and supportive lady and always ready to help her family in difficult times. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. Her husband will invest the loan in purchasing of medicines to sell through his store. She is confident that taking a loan and investing it in her husband’s business will be a profitable step for her family and is hopeful that her family will enjoy the better standard of living soon. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds the book (called the Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Rafiqaan.

loans.use: To buy medicines for medical store

loans.name: Noor Elahi's Group

texts.en:
Noor Elahi lives in a small city located in Pakistan called Depalpur. She is a 52-year-old lady who has been living in this city since 2000. She is married to 56-year-old A. M. who is an animal seller by profession. He buys animals from the animal markets at cheap rates, raises them up and sells them to the butchers. His clientele base is butchers. They approach him because he raises the animals without any artificial treatment and has the good animal breed knowledge.  

Noor Elahi has two sons. Both are teenages and illiterate. Due to financial constraints, Noor couldn’t provide them with education facilities.  

She is a caring lady who stays at home and carries out her responsibilities of a housewife. She is still very active at this age and always ready to support her family in every way. She helps her husband in his business by taking care of his animals. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animals (goats and cows) and give expansion to his business by increasing his sales.   

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats & cows) for animal sales business

loans.name: Kon's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four people. Its leader, Mrs. Kon S., age 26, is a mother blessed with three children who are teenagers and still live in home. Mrs. Kon S. currently generates an income of approximately $2 per day by working in the construction field. Mrs. Kon S. is married to Mr. Ban, 28, who is a worker who works in garment factory. Because her income is just enough for family’s daily expenses, her house is frequently cracking and leaking during the heavy rainy season. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan of $200 to repair her old house.

The other three borrowers who have jointly taking this loan as following:
Mrs. L. requests a loan in order to repair her old house that is broken down.
Mrs. B. is asking for a loan to buy more grocery inventory in her stock in order to sell. 
Mrs. Y. would like to take her loan to purchase a few grocery items.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda Q. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Imelda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a junk shop business. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

 In 2009, Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Imelda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
J. Shavkat is 33 years old, divorced and has one child. He runs a business raising and selling cattle, and has 17 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Shavkat has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now, Shavkat wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, which is why he applied for a loan of $1100. Shavkat thanks all the lenders for their support.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a skilled seamstress. She lives and works in Dushanbe, manufacturing clothing and offering tailoring services. She is married, and her husband is very supportive of her business endeavors, which are her greatest hobby as well. All her products are very well sewn and relatively affordable, which is why Munira's goods are always in high demand. She has been in this business for 16 years and has learned some valuable lessons about overcoming challenges and hard times. Munira's business has another big advantage, as it provides jobs to other people, helping fight the unemployment rates which have always been a problem in Tajikistan. This time Munira is seeking a loan of 6,000 Somoni to purchase an embroidery machine and accessories to improve the quality of items she offers for sale and to facilitate some working procedures for her employees. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and accessories

loans.name: Mwachiru

texts.en:
Mwachiru is a married man with eight children, five of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

He operates a "posho" mill (maize grinding machine) business, neighbours and passersby being his potential customers. Mwachiru faces a challenge of seasonality. He hopes to purchase another posho mill (maize grinding machine) and start a "boda boda" (motorcycle transport) business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase four cows  at Kshs 10,000 each and start a livestock business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase four cows at Kshs 10,000 each to start a livestock business

loans.name: Chitsala

texts.en:
Chitsala is a married man with four children, two of whom attend school. He owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children.

For over six years, he has operated a retail shop, selling sugar, maize flour and washing soaps to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, farmers harvest their crops and they have enough food, hence few people buy goods from the retail shop while during the hot season, farmers have no food and they purchase from the retail shop. Chitsala hopes to become a big wholesaler in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase two sacks of sugar and five bundles of wheat flour.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of sugar and five bundles of wheat flour

loans.name: Meliora

texts.en:
Meliora A. is from the town of Veruela. She is 31 years old. Meliora is married and has a 13-year-old child. To make a living, Meliora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Meliora also makes food that she sells around their neighborhood. She makes "puto" (rice cake) and other kinds of delicacies.

Meliora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meliora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Meliora is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
