Matano's major challenge in the future is seasonality, as sometimes it is difficult to get the used metal that is a raw material needed to make jikos. 

Matano is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase metals that are used in making jikos. He hopes to open a big workshop in the future and decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase metal to make ceramic cook stoves (jikos)

loans.name: Hérémakono Group

texts.fr:
Hérémakono est un regroupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées dans des familles polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 20 ans, 1enfant et résident toutes dans le centre de Fakola l’une des Sous préfecture de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et font toutes le commerce de céréales, de farines de blé sauf Adiarha Koné, un des membres du groupe excelle  dans la vente des ignames.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur premier   prêt solidaire. 
Adiarha  Koné compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des ignames à Guèya en Côte d’Ivoire l’un des  pays  frontaliers de la République du Mali où le prix est très bas. Adiarha  effectue sa vente au domicile et au marché les jours de la  foire, à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes qui achètent au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Heremakono is a group of four women all married into polygamous families. They are on average 20 years old with one child, and all reside in the centre of Fakola, one of the sub-prefectures of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They became acquainted as neighbours and all are retailers of grain cereals  and wheat flour excepting Adiarha Kone, who excels in the retail sales of yams.

Wanting to bolster their stock supply and diversify the items for sale, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso where they are beginning a first group loan cycle.

Adiarha Kone intends to use her loan to buy yams from Gueya in Ivory Coast (one of the countries bordering the Republic of Mali) where prices are very low. Adiarha sells door-to-door and at the market on fair days, to mostly women customers who pay cash and sometimes on credit.

She hopes to attain average monthly earnings of 21,000 FCFA which will serve to reimburse the loan and take care of small family needs.

loans.use: Buy yams

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 20 years old. Mary Grace is single and has a 2-year-old baby. To make a living, Mary Grace operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Mary Grace also opened a sari-sari store where she sells products like soy sauce, sugar and other items.

Mary Grace joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Yeredon sont toutes mariées dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 28 ans, 4 enfants et résidant toutes dans le quartier N’gola  de Fakola l’une des Sous préfecture de Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et font toutes la restauration excepté Chata Koné, la présidente du groupe qui excelle dans la vente de pâtes d’arachides.  Elles achète les grains d’arachides et la transforme en pâtes.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les articles à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les  prêts précédents. 
Chata Koné compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 150kg  de grains d’arachides auprès des grossistes au marché de Fakola. Chata effectue sa vente  à domicile et au marché de Fakola, à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes qui achètent au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Chata,  à l’instar des autres membres du groupe espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et prendre en charge les petits besoins de la famille en condiments.
texts.en:
The five women of the Yeredon group are all married into polygamous families, are on average 28 years old with four children, and all reside in the N’gola borough of Fakola, one of the sub-prefectures of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted as neighbours and all deal with food preparation excepting Chata Kone the group’s president, who excels in retailing peanut paste. She buys peanuts and processes them to make peanut paste.

Wanting to bolster their stock supply and diversify the items for sale, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso where they are beginning their third group loan, having fully reimbursed the preceding ones.

Chata Kone intends to use her loan to buy 150 kilos of peanuts from wholesalers at the Fakola market. Chata sells door-to-door and at the Fakola market, to mostly women customers who pay cash and sometimes on credit.

Like other group members Chata hopes to attain average monthly earnings of 20,000 FCFA which will serve to reimburse the loan and take care of the family’s food condiments needs.

loans.use: Buy peanuts

loans.name: Nathanael

texts.en:
Nathanael was born in 1965. He is married without a child. Nathanael's wife does not work and he has to work hard in order to provide all the necessities for his family. Nathanael is a taxi driver. He employs four people as helpers in his transportation business. He has 15 years of experience. The hours of his business are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening, every day except Saturday.

Nathanael wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy some equipment for his car. With this loan, Nathanael will be able to give good service to his passengers.

loans.use: To buy some equipment for his car

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María F. es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 19 años y  está cursando el 1° año de la carrera de Ciencias Contables en la Universidad Nacional de Asunción Filial Caaguazú.
Su padre presta servicios de seguridad privada en la ciudad.
María actualmente trabaja como Secretaria Administrativa de un Estudio Contable, donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencias al mismo y al tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.
Ella tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y abrir su propio estudio contable, para crecer profesionalmente y ser util a la sociedad, lo cual implica mucho esfuerzo, ella está conciente y convencida a enfrentar dicho desafio.
La clienta solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad,  ya que lleva 1 carrera que tiene mucho costo.
 María F. agradece este préstamo ya que servirá de mucha ayuda para su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Maria F. is from the city of Caaguazu, she is 19 years old, and is currently studying her 1st year of accounting at the National University of Asuncion Filial Caaguazu.  Her father offers private security services in the city.  Maria actually works as an administrative secretary at an accounting office where she is gaining experience and obtaining income for her studies at the same time.
She wishes to finish her studies and open her own accounting office in order to grow professionally and be useful to society, which implies a lot of effort; she is conscious of it and convinced she will face the challenge.

She is enrolled in a costly career and solicits the loan to pay for the monthly fees.  Maria F. is thankful for the loan since it will help her studies greatly and at the same time establish credit worthiness which will be important to solidify her future projects.

loans.use: 3 months of school payments

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam Djiré est une femme mariée de 46ans qui vit  dans une famille nucléaire avec ses neufs  enfants et son époux    dans le quartier Est  de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du Mali. 
Pour augmenter son capital elle décide d’aller au prêt  individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro
Yiriwaso. Elle est à son deuxième  cycle, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier. 
Elle s’approvisionne au marché de  Kolondièba les jours de foire et dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs.
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir 900  kilogrammes d’arachides, 2000  kilogrammes de maïs qu’il stockera pour revendre à la période de cours élevé.
 Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  25.000  F CFA  qui sera utilisé pour  prendra en charge les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariam Djire is a 46-year-old married woman, living in a nuclear family with her nine children and her husband in the Eastern borough of Kolondieba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.

To increase her capital she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso individual loan program for stocking and retailing grain cereals. She is beginning her second loan cycle, having correctly reimbursed the first one.

She gets her supplies from Kolondieba on market fair days and from producing farmers in neighbouring villages.

With this loan she hopes to acquire 900 kilos of peanuts and 2000 kilos of corn she will stockpile for retail sales when prices are high. She hopes to attain average monthly benefits of 25,000 F CFA which will be used to cover the children’s school costs.

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Mohamed J.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the S.L.M.C Primary School, in Waterloo, a small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded in 1996 by the community people to educate the children of the community. Currently, the school is staffed with twelve teachers and has an enrollment of 463 pupils.   

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 7,400,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone can not do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials; some buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while others will invest the loan in business. 

Mohamed J. B. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone, Mohamed is today residing in Waterloo together with his wife and eight children. His wife is a teacher, too, and his children are in secondary schools and colleges. Mr. B., who has served in the teaching profession for thirty-four years, will use his share of this loan to buy iron corrugated zinc sheets in order to complete the house-building project he has started.

loans.use: Buys iron corrugated zinc sheets in order to complete the house-building project he has started

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro se dedica al servicio de transporte en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, el señor nos cuenta que tuvo que viajar desde La Paz su ciudad natal en busca de mejores oportunidades el y su familia tuvieron que acostumbrarse al nuevo cL. al nuevo ambiente, y con mucho sacrificio se establecieron, ahora el señor Ramiro trabaja como trasnportista de un radio taxi pero a veces su vehiculo sufre desperfectos razon por la cual solicito un credito para que le permita comprar los repuestos necesarios para reparar su vehiculo y tenerlo en mejores condiciones asi podra generar mas ingresos y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El señor Ramiro comenta que despues de terminar este credito solicitara un nuevo credito para empezar con la construccion de su casita.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramiro provides transportation services in the city of Santa Cruz. He says that he moved away from La Paz, the city of his birth, in search of better opportunities for himself and his family. Ramiro had to get accustomed to a new climate and a new environment, but after much sacrifice he was able to get settled.

He currently works as a radio taxi driver, but sometimes his vehicle malfunctions. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy the necessary parts to repair his vehicle. By keeping it in better condition, Ramiro will be able to generate more income and provide his family with a better quality of life. After he finishes repaying this loan, Ramiro says he will request another loan so that he can begin the construction of his house.

loans.use: Purchase parts to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Durga Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Durga Laxmi T.. She is married and has one child, aged 7. In 2008, she established her furniture making business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy wood and timbers for her work. Durga Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family for the future. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es:
María Alejandra es una joven de 29 años que tiene un hijo en la edad de 2 años y es por él, que dirige todos sus esfuerzos a su trabajo como comerciante, porque sueña con darle mejores condiciones de vida y especialmente estudios de calidad; lo que se convierte en su más grande desafío personal.  María Alejandra es la ´propietaria de “Distribuidora de calzado Yireth” negocio que inició sus operaciones en el año 2008, después de haber dejado su empleo  en una importante empresa;  desde ese momento se inició en la comercialización de calzado femenino y masculino,  y no ha parado  su actividad, la cual  inicia desde la 9: 00 a.m. hasta las  9:00 p.m.;   sus clientes son los peatones,  referidos por sus clientes rentables y vecinos del sector donde está ubicada en la ciudadela 20 de Julio, barrió al sur de Barranquilla, específicamente en el centro comercial metropolitano, sector de transito de gran afluencia de personas. 
María Alejandra se está preparando para final de año, que es un momento de gran repunte en sus ventas, porque los miembros de cada familia reciben en esta época bonificaciones, primas, aguinaldos y lo invierten en vestirse elegantemente y  María Alejandra  quiere seguir suministrando el calzado de esta época para sus clientes. 
Con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espera comprar calzado femenino en dos referencias los cuales le producen un margen de contribución de 28 y 26,67% respectivamente, calzado para hombre en dos referencias mas,  que y un margen de contribución de 13 y 14,29% y también comprará bolsos femeninos que le proporcionará un margen de  un 33,3%.  Con la disciplina de trabajo y con inyecciones de capital de trabajo continuas, María Alejandra podrá convertir su sueño a largo plazo, de tener una  empresa, en  su  realidad futura.
texts.en: María Alejandra is 29 years old with a 2-year-old son. It is for him that she directs all her efforts to her job as a saleswoman, as she dreams of giving him better living conditions and especially a quality education--this is her biggest personal challenge. María Alejandra is the owner of Yireth Shoe Distributor, a business which she started in 2008 after leaving her job in an important company. That's when she started selling women's and men's shoes, and she hasn't stopped. She works from 9am to 9pm. Her customers are pedestrians, referred by profitable customers and neighbors in the area, the July 20 Citadel south of Barranquilla, specifically in the metropolitan shopping center where a large number of people travel. María Alejandra is preparing for the end of the year, which is a time of upturn in her sales as members of each family receive bonuses and premiums and invest them in dressing elegantly, and María Alejandra wants to continue providing shoes to her clients during this time. With her Kiva credit, which is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she hopes to buy two types of women's shoes which produce a profit margin of 28% and 26.67%, respectively; two types of men's shoes which produce a profit margin of 13% and 14.29%; and also women's purses which will give her a 33.3% profit margin. With working discipline and continuing injections of capital, María Alejandra will be able to turn her long-term goal--having her own company--into her real future.

loans.use: Women's and men's shoes and purses

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna N. is a resident of Tangal, Lalitpur, and lives with her husband and two sons. The Tangal area is a very busy shopping area of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses, especially famous for brass, copper, bronze pots and utensils of different varieties. Mrs. N. is a shopkeeper in Tangal, and sells pots and utensils. Her two sons are studying in university. Mrs. N., along with her husband, Om Bahadur N., opened their shop 8 years ago. They equally contribute their efforts in their shop because they have no other source of income. Their children also help them.

Mrs. N. is asking for her seventh loan to expand her shop by buying items like plates, steel glasses, and hotpots to meet the increasing demands of customers. They want to strengthen the economic condition of their family by increasing their income.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her shop

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 47-year-old man who owns a frozen-food store in Amman, Jordan. He is a father of five.

In spite of being handicapped, Adnan has built a successful business to support his family. Twelve years ago, Adnan started his business by opening a small shop selling frozen food. With strong determination, he has filled all of his once-empty shelves.  Now, Adnan owns two shops and is looking into buying a chicken farm. 

Adnan took his first loan of 2000 Jordanian Dinars from Tamweelcom to buy two new freezers to meet clients' demand and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy two new freezers

loans.name: Tiberius

texts.en: Tiberius is a married man who rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. He has operated his vegetable business for over six years, selling green vegetables wholesale to vegetable-stall operators. Tiberius faces the challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to purchase a pick-up truck to transport and distribute his vegetables. With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase vegetables wholesale and resell them to retailers.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables wholesale to resell to retailers.

loans.name: Joko C. R.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the Russell Technical Secondary School, in Waterloo, a small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded in 2006 by Joko C.R. V., to cater for under-privileged youths in the community. Currently, the school is staffed with twenty-three teachers and has an enrollment of 545 pupils.   

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 7,400,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone can not do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials; some buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while others will invest the loan in business. 

Joko C.R. V. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in a village called Rotifunk, Joko is today residing in Waterloo together with his wife and five children. His wife is a businesswoman and three of his children are attending primary and secondary schools. Mr. V., who has served in the teaching profession for thirty years, would like to use his share of this loan to buy house-building materials in order to complete his house-building project.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials

loans.name: Maribel  Magaly

texts.es:
Maribel  Magaly G. A. tiene 27 años. Es soltera vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1  hijo.

Maribel  Magaly pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Maribel  Magaly se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita  el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es hacer una casa y dar el estudio al hijo.

Le gusta ver televisión y salir de paseo con la familia
texts.en:
Maribel Magaly G. A. is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. She has one child.

Maribel Magaly is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Maribel Magaly is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. She purchases her supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in her community. Maribel Magaly is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of her family. Her dreams include building a house and providing her child with an education.

Maribel Magaly enjoys watching television and spending time with her family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan J. is in the business of selling tea and charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more inventory.  Susan is 35 years old and married with a husband is is a "boda boda" man -- offering bicycle transportation. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children

loans.use: Stock more inventory to sell

loans.name: 6 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. 6 DE OCTUBRE inicia su primer ciclo  en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Esta asociación está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta: la señora Nilda,  la tesorera  la señora Rita y la secretaria de actas la señora Carla.

La señorita  presidenta Nilda es una mujer joven de 22 años de edad, soltera,  las señoras consideraron que era la persona adecuada para el cargo.  Desde hace tres años trabaja en la venta de cosméticos a través de catálogos, las ventas son realizadas todos los días en diferentes horarios de manera ambulante, actualmente recibe apoyo de su hermana.
Cuando se le consulta sobre el servicio que le gusta más en Pro Mujer, ella comenta que el servicio de Salud, porque la atención es satisfactoria.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como: venta de comida rápida (amburguesas, salchipapas), venta de productos para el hogar (higiénicos, sardinas), venta de lentes, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras.
texts.en:
The October 6th Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. The group is composed of eight members, seven women and one man. The Board of Directors consists of the following members: Srta. Nilda (President), Sra. Rita (Treasurer), and Sra. Carla (Secretary of Records).

Srta. Nilda is a young woman who is 22 years of age and serves as President. The other women considered her to be the right person for the job. Nilda has been selling cosmetics through catalogs for three years. She generates sales every day by working various schedules as a street vendor and currently receives the support of her sister. When asked about which service provided by Pro Mujer that she enjoys the most, Nilda said that she likes the health services because the care is excellent.

With respect to the remaining members of the Communal Bank, they engage in the following businesses in order to get ahead: selling fast food (hamburgers, sausages and potatoes), selling household products (toiletries, sardines), selling eyeglasses, selling cosmetics, and selling vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics through catalog order

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace S. is in the business of baking Sudanese bread and making tea to sell, and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and sugar. She is 32 years old and married to an army man. She has four children, two of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour, and sugar to make tea to sell

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en:
Aneta A. is currently in the business of making tea and baking bread such as tamia (patties shaped from chickpeas, onion, bread, garlic and flour), legemat (fried bread balls) etc. She is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and bags of sugar for her business.
Aneta is 27 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children, three of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a small.

loans.use: To stock more baking flour and bags of sugar

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan M. is currently in the business of designing and selling bedsheets. She is requesting a loan to design, stock and sell more bedsheets.
Juan is 36 years old and married to a driver. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To design, stock and sell more bedsheets

loans.name: Lida Johanna

texts.es:
Lida Johanna M. S. tiene 21 años. Es soltera vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. No Tiene  hijos.

Lida pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Lida se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita  el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es hacer una casa.
Le gusta estudiar ingles
texts.en:
Lida Johanna M. S. is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. She does not have children.

Lida is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Lida is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. She purchases her supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in her community. Lida is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of her family. Her dream is to build a house

Lida enjoys studying English.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and beer at home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and crates of beer to sell.
Rose is 28 years old and a widow. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal and crates of beer to sell

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento LA FAMILIA, es uno D. los bancos más antiguos D. la Institución, viene trabajando con nosotros hace 3 años atrás. La mayoría D. sus integrantes se dedica al comercio y el  Sr. REYNALDO es el Presidente del banco y es taxista propietario y con el préstamo realizara el mantenimiento D. su movilidad para así poder trabajando sin problema, Sra. ANGELICA es la tesorera del banco y ella se constituye en jefe D. hogar ya que hace varios años es viuda y esta a cargo D. sus 2 hijas, trabaja como regente en un colegio y también se dedica al comercio repartiendo víveres por su zona, con el préstamo aumentara su mercadería y sus ingresos, comprando abarrotes al por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos, tiene pensado ahorrar para los estudios D. sus hijas. La Sra. MERCEDES es la secretaria del banco y tiene una familia D. 2 miembros se dedica a la costura, con el préstamo comprara telas D. diferentes calidades y tipos para poder diversificar sus modelos y sus productos, con sus ahorros tiene pensado comprar una maquina recta, todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras, están muy agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Familia” (The Family) is one of the oldest groups that have partnered with Emprender. They have been working with the organization for three years.

Sr. Reynaldo is the Communal Bank President and works as an independent taxi driver. His loan will be used to maintain his vehicle so that it continues operating without problems.

Sra. Angelica is the Communal Bank Treasurer and head of her household since she has been widowed for several years. She takes care of her two daughters. Angelica works as a school administrator and also sells food in her area. Her loan will increase her inventory and improve her earnings. She plans to buy groceries in bulk since she has many orders. Angelica also has plans to save for her daughters’ education.

Sra. Mercedes is the Communal Bank Secretary and has a family that consists of two members. She is a seamstress and will use her loan to buy fabrics of different quality and styles so that she can diversify her designs and her products. With her savings, she plans to buy a straight-line sewing machine.

All of the members are responsible individuals and hard workers. They are extremely grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Patricia Lorena

texts.es:
Patricia Lorena S. G. tiene 22 años. Vive en Union Libre  vive con los hijos y el compañero, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Patricia Lorena pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

Patricia Lorena se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita  el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es hacer una casa, seguir en la agricultura.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Patricia Lorena S. G. is 22 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives with her companion and her children in the canton of San Miguel in Bolívar Province. She has two children.

Patricia Lorena is a member of the Communal Bank “La Florida”, which is located a half hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The group engages in agriculture as the main source of income for their families. This Communal Bank has 14 members.

Patricia Lorena is a farmer who grows corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. She purchases her supplies in San Miguel and sells at the San Miguel Market and in her community. Patricia Lorena is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes. The support of this loan will help meet the needs of her family. Her dreams include building a house and continuing with her farming activities.

Patricia Lorena enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing corn, wheat, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: T. Solange est née le 12 Avril 1964 et vit depuis dix (10) ans à Kpakpakanmè avec sa petite famille, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Solange est analphabète et est mariée à GOUHOGNANHOUA Emmanuel, un boucher. Le couple a quatre (04) enfants, tous scolarisés. Solange assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Solange exerce comme activité la vente de produits vivriers et de céréales (maïs, haricot, riz, etc.) depuis sept(07) ans à son domicile. Solange s’approvisionne à Houêgbo et à Bohicon, dans le département de l’Atlantique et du Zou. C’est pour la première fois que Solange sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Solange T. was born 12 April 1964 and for the past ten years has been living with her little family in the Kpakpakanmè borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is illiterate and is married to Emmanuel Gouhognanhoua, a butcher. The couple has four children, all attending (or having attended) school.

Solange shares with her husband the management of various family expenses. For the past seven years her business activity has been to sell fresh produce and grain cereals (corn, beans, rice, etc.) from her home. She gets her supplies from Houegbo and Bohicon, in the Atlantic and Zou departments.

This is the first time Solange has requested a loan from ALIDé, to satisfy customer demand and strengthen her business activity.

loans.use: Buy grain cereals and fresh produce

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is her children's school fees.
Neema makes natural juice, which she sells from home. Her major customers are neighbors and passersby. Neema faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. During cold weather, the demand for soft drinks/juices is low compared to during the hot summer season. Neema also owns rental houses. She hopes to build five more rental houses.
With this 40,000 KES loan, Neema wants to purchase passion fruits, sugar and flavorings. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase passion fruits, sugar and flavorings

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 42 year old Laxmi K..  She is married and has 2 children ages 20 and 18.  In 2009 she established her poultry business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chicks.  In the future, Laxmi plans to raise the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local microfinance institution partner Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buy small chickens for her business

loans.name: Elly

texts.en: Elly is 41 years old and still single. He is well known for his business selling meat. He has been in this business for a long time. His butcher shop is open from 7 am to 9 pm every day. After so long in the business, Elly’s customers are so many that he can’t satisfy their demands. Therefore, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, he will purchase additional cows for slaughter to meet the demands of his customers. In addition, he will hopefully earn more profit which will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional cows for slaughtering

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda M. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables known as korofo, okra and dodo and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell.  

Linda is 41 years old and is married.  Her husband is a builder. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is an experienced man who is well known for his business selling a variety of drinks. This is his 20th successful year in the business which is open from 7 am until late in the evening.

Although Jean Claude has long been in this business, his capital is still too low to expand meaningfully. To address this, he needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, he will purchase additional drinks for sale, which will hopefully increase his revenue. He will keep reinvesting this revenue for better financial stability in his future.

loans.use: To buy additional drinks for sale

loans.name: Para

texts.en:
Para K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children in Koteshwor. Her husband's name is Lalit K. and he works in a private office. They have one son and one daughter. Both of them are studying in secondary school.

Para opened her bag shop five years ago to help her husband in fulfilling the household expenses. She sells different types of bags like school and ladies bags in her shop. She buys these bags from the wholesale market. Now she is requesting a  RS 10,000 loan to expand her shop. She wants to buy different varieties of bags.

Para wants to use her income for her children’s education and she also wants to upgrade the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buys bags for her business

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 33 years old and married with three children who are 3, 5 and 8 years old. Rachel owns a shop where she sells a variety of goods including cosmetics, water and some other goods as shown. Rachel has had this shop for a few years. Her shop is open from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Rachel needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing a variety of foodstuffs in high demand by a large number of her customers. These foodstuffs will include rice, sugar, beans, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, etc. With these additional foodstuffs, Rachel will hopefully earn more profit, which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to continue taking care of her future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of foodstuffs including rice, sugar, beans, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy S. is currently in the business of selling maize grain at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more maize grain to sell.
Lucy is 39 years old and married to a builder. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her goods.

loans.use: To stock more maize grain to sell

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis es de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones, tiene 24 años de edad, está estudiando en la Universidad Católica Nuestra Señora de la Asunción en San Ignacio, es un joven luchador y con su espíritu emprendedor ya se encuentra en el 2do. Año de la carrera de ciencias económicas con especialidad en  Administración de empresas y también Ingeniería en Informática que ya está por terminar, a pesar de todos los obstáculos que debió superar continúa con sus estudios. Actualmente se desempeña como cajero en el Banco Continental de la ciudad de San Ignacio.
Solicita el préstamo para los gastos manutención como, pasajes, libros, exámenes que tienen  el estudio.
Derlis agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Derlis is from the city of San Ignacio Misiones. He is a 24 year old student attending Our Lady of the Assumption Catholic University in San Ignacio. Derlis is a determined young man with an enterprising spirit. He is already in his second year of study toward a degree in Economics with a specialization in Business Administration. He has already completed studies in Systems Engineering. Despite all the obstacles he has had to face, Derlis is able to continue with his studies. He currently works as a cashier at Banco Continental in the city of San Ignacio.

Derlis is requesting a loan to cover expenses such as travel, books, and exams required for his studies. He is grateful for this loan because it will help him with his education and build up credit references, which will be of great importance in pursuing other projects.

loans.use: Pay for educational expenses such as travel, books, and exams

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase of an additional cow for the farm.

loans.name: C4569 Twizerane Group

texts.en:
Monique is 30 years old and she is married with three children who are 4, 7 and 9 years old.  Monique is the leader of a group “Twizerane” who  are commonly known in the business of selling charcoal.  This group has been in this business for a long time and they work from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Monique and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Monique and her team will expand their business through purchasing additional sacks of charcoal for sale and in addition to this; they will create another source of income selling a variety of foodstuffs.  If successful, each member of this group will continue building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: additional sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. AZUCENAS inicia su tercer ciclo  en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Esta asociación está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta: la señora Alicia,  la tesorera  la señora Martha y la secretaria de actas la señora Claudia.

La señora  secretaria Claudia es una mujer joven de 26 años de edad, está desde la fundación del grupo, las señoras la eligieron para este cargo considerando sus habilidades para manejar el cuaderno de actas.

Desde hace seis años trabaja en la venta de dulces, inicialmente el negocio era de su mamá, sin embargo, ahora ella se hizo cargo del mismo.  Su solicitud de Bs. 2000.- será invertido en la compra de mercadería, es decir variedad de dulces.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como: tejidos de chompa, venta de medicinas naturales, venta de productos de uso personal y domésticos (chiflería: venta de papel higiénico, peines, pilas, agujas, cepillos de dientes, pasta dental, etc), pastelería, proveedor de “aceros arequipa”, venta de dulces, venta de joyas, venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Azucenas” (Lilies) is starting its third loan cycle as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. This Communal Bank consists of eight members, seven women and one man. The following members make up the Board of Directors: Sra. Alicia (President), Sra. Martha (Treasurer), and Sra. Claudia (Secretary of Records).

Sra. Claudia is a young woman who is 26 years of age and serves as the group secretary. She is also the founder of the group. The other women elected her to her position because they considered her ability to handle the record books. Claudia began selling sweets six years ago. This business originally belonged to her mother, but now she is the person in charge. Her loan request of 2000 BOB will be invested in the purchase of merchandise, specifically various types of candy.

With respect to the other members of the Communal Bank, they engage in the following types of business: weaving blankets, selling natural medicines, selling toiletries and household products (toilet paper, combs, batteries, needles, toothbrushes, toothpaste, and other items), making pastries, distributing steel products, selling candy, selling jewelry, and selling cosmetics.

loans.use: Purchase candy to sell

loans.name: Augustine Omolayo

texts.fr: I. Augustine Omolayo est née le 01 Septembre 1966 à Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Augustine a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire et depuis environs treize (13) ans Augustine s’est installée à Kpakpakanmè, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Augustine est mariée à KINTOTOUNHOUAN Emmanuel et est mère de cinq (05) enfants. Augustine supporte ensemble avec son mari les charges familiales. Augustine mène comme activité, la vente de produits vivriers et de céréales (maïs, etc.). Augustine fait l’achat de ses produits vivriers et céréales à Houêgbo dans le département de l’Atlantique. Augustine avait déjà bénéficié déjà d’un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. C’est pour l’évolution de son activité et le renforcement de son fonds de roulement que Augustine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Augustine Omolayo I. was born 1 September 1966 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She attended school up to secondary level and thirteen years ago settled in the Kpakpakanmè borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.

Augustine is married to Emmanuel Kintotounhouan and is the mother of five children. She shares the management of family expenses with her husband by retailing fresh produce and grain cereals (corn, etc.) as a business activity. She buys her fresh produce and cereals in Houegbo in the department of the Atlantic.

Augustine had already been granted a first loan from ALIDé, which was fully reimbursed. She is now requesting a second loan to help develop her activity and strengthen her working capital.

loans.use: Buy grain cereal

loans.name: Bwenda Katukore Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
It is now 6 years down the road since A. Donesia of Bwenda Katukore group, Ibanda, started up her farming project and specialized in making banana sales in Bwenda, Ibanda, western Uganda. With this as her main source of livelihood, she has painstakingly managed to make ends meet albeit with some  seasonal income fluctuations and poor road systems to access bigger markets. 

With a strong work ethic and ready market, the 42 year old married and cheerful mother of 6 children has kept her business on a steady growth. In a month, she makes 160,000 Ugandan shillings. Her business is gaining ground over these years and has meant that her family has benefited. Her business plan of action for the future is to be able to sell more bananas to an increasingly expanding market as she envisages purchasing manure for her plantation for better production.

loans.use: purchasing manure for her banana plantation

loans.name: Leocadie

texts.en:
Leocadie is 38 years old and she is married with 3 children who are 5, 8 and 10 years old.  Leocadie owns a shop where she sells hardware items as her picture above indicates.  Leocadie has been in this business for about 4 years and her shop is open from7 am to 7 pm every day.

Leocadie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  This loan will allow her to expand her business through purchasing a variety of hardware items which in turn will increase her sales as well as profits.  If successful, she will keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability and in addition to that, she will continue improving the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: a variety of hardware items

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent and electricity bills.
Jane operates two businesses: a boda boda (motorcycle taxi) business and a business making natural juices. She has worked in these businesses for over a year. Jane faces the major challenge of traffic regulations on motorcycle business operators. She hopes to construct her own house for her family and later build her own rental houses.
With this 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a new engine for her boda boda and purchase fruits and flavoring for making natural juices. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, because it has a good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for her boda boda and  fruits and flavoring for making natural juices

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K.  is a hard working business man. The 52 year old married father of 4 children, who are still attending school, sweats his guts out selling bananas from his plantation in a small rural area of Kigarama, Ibanda. He has been doing this business for the last 12 years which he started with advice and support from his parents. He gets many customers who buy his produce for food consumption like; restaurant owners in the area. 

He is able to make an average profit of 364,800 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is a fair earning by any standards He requires a loan that will help him buy more farm supplies like; mulches and manure for his banana plantation.  He will then be able to meet his customer demand and also get more revenue as he looks forward to his family's welfare and education for all his children.

loans.use: To buy mulch for his banana plantation

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.fr: P. Clotilde est née le 20 Février 1975 et vit depuis environs quinze (15) ans à PK16, sur la route de Porto- Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Mariée à AGBOTON Alain, un soudeur, Clotilde est mère de quatre (04) enfants  tous scolarisés. Clotilde a un niveau d’étude du cours primaire. Clotilde assure ensemble avec son mari les charges familiales. Clotilde vend depuis deux (02) ans à son domicile du riz, des produits divers (biscuits, conserves, lait, mayonnaise, pâtes alimentaires, savons, etc.). De façon secondaire, Clotilde vend du charbon de bois à son domicile. Clotilde s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. Afin d’améliorer le niveau de son activité et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, Clotilde sollicite auprès de ALIDé un deuxième crédit. Le premier crédit que Clotilde avait eu auprès de ALIDé a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Clotilde P. was born 20 February 1975 and has been living for the past 15 years in PK16, on the road to Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She is married to Alain Agboton, a welder, and is the mother of four children, all attending school. Clotilde was educated at primary school level.

Clotilde shares family expenses with her husband. For the past two years she has been retailing rice and various products from her home (cookies, canned goods, milk, mayonnaise, pasta, soap, etc.). As a second line of business, she sells charcoal from her home.

Clotilde gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She is requesting a second loan from ALIDé to raise the level of her business activity and increase her stock supply. The first loan granted from ALIDé was fully reimbursed.

loans.use: Buy various products (canned goods, milk, pasta, rice, cookies, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira B., una mujer viuda y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 28 a 32 años, es una gran comerciante que siempre aspira a fortalecer su negocio mediante su trabajo disciplinado y su capacidad de comercializar lo que ofrece. Cuando se sintió sola sin su esposo compró mercancía muy económica que vendió con gran éxito y luego una gran amiga le recomendó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para que incrementara su capital de trabajo y por eso está solicitando un credikiva para comprar mercancías como jeans, sabanas toallas, blusas que han solicitado sus clientes en la ciudad de Cartagena y también como un plan futuro,  planea  extenderse a otras poblaciones  muy cercanas en el departamento de Bolívar, para ampliar su mercado, aprovechando que tiene familiares y  amigos que la van a apoyar.
Elvira vive muy contenta con su negocio, porque lo has visto crecer poco a poco y ahora tiene lo que su cliente requiere, por eso ha los sus alrededores del barrio la central, que es un lugar muy popular y fue fundado hace 50 años y los vecinos se conocen mutuamente.
Su mayor desafío se presentó  al iniciar,  por el poco capital de trabajo con el que contaba en ese momento y lo cual la obligaba a esperar que sus clientes antiguos  le pagaran para lograr responder a los nuevos;  pero eso es cosa del pasado y ella dice que ahora cuenta con la Fundación que la apoya con sus créditos y que esto le representa un capital al cual le gana dinero y luego lo devuelve y le sirve de mucho.
texts.en: Elvira B. a widow and mother of three children between the ages of 28 and 32, is a great saleswoman who always aspires strengthen her business through her disciplined work and her ability to sell her goods. When she felt alone without her husband, she bought inexpensive merchandise which she sold with great success, and her best friend recommended Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to her to augment her working capital. She is now seeking Kiva credit to purchase merchandise like jeans, sheets, towels, and blouses that her clients in the city of Cartagena have ordered. Also, in the future she plans to extend to other populations very close in the department of Bolívar to expand her market, taking advantage of the fact that she has relatives and friends that will help her. Elvira is very happy with her business because she has watched it grow little by little and now she has what her clients need, and she has the areas surrounding the city center, which is a very popular area founded 50 years ago where the neighbors know each other. She faced her biggest challenges in the beginning: with little working capital, she had to hope that her older clients would pay her so she would be able to serve the newer ones. But this is now a thing of the past and she says that now that she has the support of the foundation and its capital which earns her money, is returned, and serves her well.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise like jeans, sheets, towels, and blouses for her clients in Cartagena

loans.name: Express Group

texts.en:
Happy A., in her late twenties, is married with two daughters. For the past two years, she has sold cosmetics (lotions) and charcoal. She works from 4pm to 5pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $53.

This will be Happy's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to increase her business and pay school fees for her children, and has paid those loans back successfully. She hopes to use the current loan to increase her cosmetics and charcoal inventory.  She dreams of one day looking for land on which to build a house.

Happy will share this loan with her loan group, Express, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Happy is second from the right, in the front row wearing pink.

loans.use: To increase cosmetics and charcoal inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: L. Victoire est née le 23 Décembre 1970 et vit depuis environs quatorze (14) ans à PK16 sur la route de Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Victoire a un niveau d’étude du cours primaire et est mariée à AGBOTON Achille, un vitrier. Le couple a trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Victoire vend depuis deux (02) ans à son domicile les mèches et les produits de cheveux qu’elle achète à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Victoire sollicite ce deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour compléter sa marchandise et augmenter le niveau de son stock. Le premier crédit que Victoire avait eu auprès d’ALIDé a été  bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Victoire L. was born 23 December 1970 and has been living for approximately 14 years in PK16, on the road to Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. Victoire has a primary school education level and is married to Achille Agboton, a glazier. The couple has three children, all attending (or having attended) school.

The couple shares the management of various family expenses. For the past two years Victoire has been selling hair extensions and hair care products  from her home. She gets her supplies from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.

She is requesting a second loan from ALIDé to stock up on merchandise. The first loan granted from ALIDé was fully reimbursed.

loans.use: Buy hair extensions and hair care products

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Getruda J. is married, in her mid twenties, and has a 5 year old son. For the past year Getruda has been buying clothes and then walking door to door to sell them. She does this between 10 am and 5 pm and it earns her a low monthly profit.

This will be Getruda's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Getruda aims to use this loan to pay initial rent on a property which she aims to use to open up a clothing shop. Getruda is really looking forward to having her own shop and not having to go door to door anymore. Getruda's dream is to be able to take her son to a good school.

Getruda will share this loan with her loan group Loyola, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the photo, Getruda can be seen second from right in a black blouse.

loans.use: Pay rent for  shop space.

loans.name: Marcos Guillermo

texts.es:
Marcos de 31 años, es chofer de un bus, vive con su esposa e hijos en PrimaV. de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

El alquilaba un taxi para recorrer las calles de Guayaquil y tener dinero para mantener a su familia, poco a poco fueron creciendo los gastos de su familia así que decidió invertir todos sus ahorros en una bus. En la actualidad tiene su bus inscrito en una cooperativa de transporte trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta que acaba su turno. 

Para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, arena y bloques para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere hacer la loza de su casa.
texts.en:
Marcos, age 31, works as a bus driver and lives with his wife and children in PrimaV. de Duran, a periurban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem.

Marcos rented a taxi for driving through the streets of Guayaquil so that he could earn money to support his family. As his family expenses grew over time, he decided to invest all of his savings in a bus. At the moment, his bus is registered with a transportation cooperative. He works every day from the early morning hours until his shift ends.

Marcos wants to provide his children a good life, so he will use this loan to buy cement, sand, and blocks for building a better house. In the future, he wants to have the foundation of his house completed.

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, and blocks for his house

loans.name: Jeiko Pora Rekavo Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo donde todas ellas tienen reuniones y actividades constantes, donde todo lo deciden en grupo y han crecido durante los años de que lleva trabajando el comité. Desean seguir alcanzando nuevos beneficios dentro del programa y se encuentran muy animadas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Amalia quien se dedica a venta de productos de consumo del hogar, y está muy satisfecha porque le va muy bien con su negocio, comenta que mediante el grupo pudo conocer mucha cosas y pude capacitarse y mejorar especialmente en la administración de su despensa. 
Ella desea seguir surtiendo su negocio con mercaderías ya que su familia se alimenta con las mercaderías del negocio y por ello debe  comprar especialmente las mercaderías que se vende diariamente como fideos, arroz, harina, y otros.
texts.en:
All of the members of this group are engaged in constant activities and attend the meetings in which they decide everything as a group. Over the years of working together, they have grown as a committee. They desire to achieve new benefits under the program and are very excited about the possibilities.

One of the members is Sra. Amalia, who sells consumer household products. She is very pleased because she has done well in her business. Amalia says that through her group, she has learned many things from the training classes, especially how to manage her business. She wants to continue stocking her store with merchandise in order to feed her family. Amalia specifically wants to buy products that she sells on a daily basis such as noodles, rice, flour, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase flour, noodles, oil, cleaning products, and other items

loans.name: Migombani Group

texts.en:
Peter L. is in his late fifties and is married with five children. He has been selling leftover construction supplies since 2007 and he is proud of his business. The business is open between 9 am and 6 pm and earns Peter a good monthly profit. 

This will be Peter's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his two previous loans to increase his supply of materials, loans which he has successfully repaid. Peter aims to use his third loan to once again increase his stock, which he hopes will lead to further expansion. 

Peter will share this loan with his loan group Migombani, which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Peter can be seen 4th from left in the back row.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Caroline operates a second-hand clothing business, selling from door to door to neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are her neighbors. Caroline faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With this 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. Caroline decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, because of its good reputation in the community. In the future, she hopes to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Minazini Group

texts.en:
Mariam R. is in her early twenties and is married with one son. She has been running a small grocery store since 2007, from which she sells various products such as soda, juice, mobile phone vouchers etc. The shop is open between 6 am and 9 pm and earns Mariam a low monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Mariam used her first loan to increase her stock of goods, a loan which she has now successfully repaid. With her second loan, Mariam aims to once again increase her business by expanding her stock, and introducing some new products. 

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group Minazin, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Mariam can be seen sitting second from right in the front row.

loans.use: Top increase Stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase thread to make clothing

loans.name: Sourou Adeline

texts.fr: L. Sourou Adeline est née le 20 Octobre 1977. Adeline est mariée à LANKPOEDJA Clément. Le couple a deux (02) enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Gankpodo, l’un des quartiers de Cotonou depuis deux ans. Les charges familiales sont sous la responsabilité de son mari ; mais Adeline vient en aide à son mari grâce au revenu de son activité. Adeline exerce comme activité depuis deux (2) ans la vente de layettes à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. Adeline fait ses achats à Lomé, capitale politique du Togo. C’est le renforcement de son activité, l'agrandissement de son stock de produits et la vente des éléments constituants le trousseau d’un bébé qui a poussé Adeline à solliciter un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Adeline n’a pas enregistré de difficultés au cours de l’exercice de son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. L. Sourou Adeline was born on October 20, 1977.  She is married to Mr. LANKPOEDJA Clément.  The couple have two children, who are both in school.  The family has been living in Gankpodo, a district in Cotonou, for two years.  Family expenses are all her husband's responsibility;  but Adeline helps him out, thanks to the revenue from her business.  For two years, she has had a business selling baby clothing at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She makes her purchases in Lomé, the capital of Togo. 

Bolstering her business, expanding her stock of merchandise, and selling the items that compose a set of baby accessories are what drives Adeline to request a loan from ALIDé.  She has not noted any problems in operating her business.

loans.use: Buying children's clothing and baby accessories

loans.name: Nury Charito

texts.es:
Nury de 30 años, es vendedora informal de ropa, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Empezó su negocio hace unos dos años aproximadamente, inicio la venta de la ropa a sus amigas y a las personas que trabajaban en la escuela de sus hijos. Poco a poco a incrementado su mercadería recorriendo las calles de Paraíso, vendiéndola los fines de semana y haciendo las cobranzas a sus clientes de lunes a viernes. Vende ropa para niños, sabanas, pantalones etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa, sabanas, toallas para tener mas variedad al vender la ropa. En el futuro quiere incrementar su mercadería y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Nury, who is 30 years old, is an informal vendor of clothing.  She lives in the Paraiso neighborhood of Guayaquil (an area in the outskirts of the city that has dirt roads and homes built on the hillsides.)

She started her business about 2 years ago, selling clothing to her friends and to people who worked in her children's school.  Gradually, she increased her merchandise.  She goes around the streets of Paraiso selling her clothing on the weekends, and collecting payments from her customers during the week.  She sells children's clothing, bed sheets, pants, etc.

With the loan she wants to buy clothing, bed sheets, and towels to have more variety in the items she sells.  In the future, she wants to increase her merchandise and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing and bed sheets

loans.name: Usalama Group

texts.en:
Kizito Mahunidi is in his mid-thirties and is single. He has been running a sewing business since 2000. He specializes in sewing garments into traditional Tanzanian clothing. The shop is open from 7:00 am to 8:30 pm and earns Kizito a good monthly profit.

This will be Kizito's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Kizito used his first loan to increase supplies of material such as thread and garments, a loan which he has successfully repaid. Kizito will use his second loan to once again increase stocks as he is meeting an increasing demand for his products. Kizito's dream is to one day open a big shop from which he can both produce and sell his products.

Kizito will share this loan with his loan group Usalama, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Kizito is the first on the left wearing a white shirt with a blue mark.

loans.use: Increase her stock of garments.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago the Patron Saint", located in the district of Santiago D. Pupuja, the province of Azángaro, and the department of Puno. She is 55 years old, and married with five children (two of whom are independent). She studied as far as the fifth year of her primary education. 

María has worked with Manuela Ramos for six months. Her first loan was for the amount of 500 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital for her business selling animals, potatoes, "chuño" (dehydrated potatoes), and cheese. 

She is now asking for a loan of 500 PEN, money that she will use to invest in her business selling various items. 

Her dream is to have a dairy cow. Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the savings program.

loans.use: Invest in her business selling animals, potatoes, "chuño" (dehydrated potatoes), and cheese

loans.name: Pino Suarez Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Pino Suarez” ya que así se llama la calle en donde está ubicado, en el Estado de Hidalgo, México.Rosa Hernández es integrante del grupo, ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 14 años, el cual es su dependiente económico. Rosa no cuenta con estudios, pero se dedica a la venta de dulces y enchiladas desde hace 21 años afuera de su casa, solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, ella se siente muy contenta al solicitar su crédito pues podrá invertir para estas fechas y acreditar más su negocio para el día de muertos, ya que de acuerdo a la tradición los dulces y enchiladas son típicos de la región.
Observaciones: La señora Araceli A. G. se movio al momento en que se tomo la foto y sólo se le ven los ojos y cabello.
texts.en:
This group is called "Pino Suarez", because that is the name of the street in which it is located, in the Mexican state of Hidalgo. Rosa Hernández is a member of this group. She is married and has a 14-year-old son, who is her dependent. Rosa has no education, but she has worked selling sweets and enchiladas outside her home for 21 years. She seeks this loan to buy inputs for her business. She is very happy to get this loan because she will be able to invest and establish more business for the Day of the Dead, as sweets and enchiladas are traditional for this region. 

(Note: Araceli A. G. moved while the picture was taken and you can only see her eyes and hair.)

loans.use: Invest in business and make seasonal purchases

loans.name: Trabajdoras Del Barrio San Juan Group

texts.es:
El Comité Trabajadoras del Barrio San Juan, se dedican al comercio, venta de pollos caseros , venta de productos de belleza, confitería, etc. ; gracias a los crédito han podido aumentar sus ingresos económicos dentro de su propia casa ya que la mayoría de ellas tienen hijos en edad escolar.    Desean seguir trabajando en comité y crecer cada día más unidas y en forma responsable para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ana quien se dedica a la venta de pescado, comenta que esta actividad es rentable por época, ya que la gente no consume pescado muy frecuentemente en la zona pero el ingreso que obtiene de este trabajo le ayuda para los pago de consumo por luz, agua y otros gastos. 
Así ella ayuda a su familia, ya que su objetivo que salir delante de la mejor forma posible. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de un conservadora ya que se acerca la época de la fiesta, momento en el suben las ventas y no cuenta con esta herramienta para mantener suficiente pescado para vender.
texts.en:
The Worker's Comittee of the San Juan neighborhood specializes in commerce: the sale of domesticated hens, sale of beauty products, candies, etc.. Thanks to the loans they have been able to increase their household incomes; most of them still have school-aged children.  They wish to continue working as a committee and to grow united each day in a responsible manner in order to improve their quality of life and that of their families.  One of the members is Ana who sells fish, she states that this brings seasonal profits since the people don't consume fish frequently in the area but her profits help pay the electric, water, and other expenses.

This is how she helps her family since her objective is to get ahead in the best method possible.  She is requesting the loan to purchase preservatives because party season is approaching and during that time her sales increase and she currently does not count on the tools to keep sufficient amount of fish stocked to sell.

loans.use: Purchase preservatives

loans.name: Mabibo Freedom Group

texts.en:
Said M. is in his early thirties and is married with one son. Over the past 5 years he has been running a tailoring business to support himself and his family. The shop is open between 8:00 am and 6:00 pm and earns Said a low monthly profit. 

This will be Said's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Said's aim is to use the loan to increase his stock in garments in order to ensure a smooth production product, so that customers products are ready on time. Said's dream is to one day open a workplace where he can teach tailoring to other people.

Said will share this loan with his loan group Mabibu Freedom, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Said can be seen second from left in the back row.

loans.use: Increase Stock

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: G. Charlotte est née en 1974. Charlotte, analphabète, est mariée à BONOU Ado Pierre. Le couple a trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis quatre 04) ans à Gankpodo, l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, le capitale économique du Bénin. Charlotte vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Charlotte prépare et vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, riz) à Agbodjêdo depuis onze (11) ans ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Charlotte achète les produits entrant dans la préparation de sa nourriture à Dantokpa , marché international du Bénin. C’est dans le cadre de l’évolution de son activité et de l’augmentation de stock de sacs de maïs, de riz que Charlotte sollicite ce troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs reçus auprès de ALIDé par Charlotte ont été bien remboursés. Charlotte enregistre parfois quelques difficultés lors de l’exercice de son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. G. Charlotte was born in 1974.  She is illiterate and is married to Mr. BONOU Ado Pierre.  The couple have three children, who are all in school.  The family has been living in Gankpodo, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Charlotte helps out her husband by covering along with him the different family expenses.  She has been making and selling food (cornmeal mash, rice) in Agbodjêdo for eleven years.  This enables her to support herself.  She buys the ingredients for making her food at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  

With regard to improving her business and increasing her inventory of corn and rice, she is requesting this third loan from ALIDé.  The previous loans Charlotte received from ALIDé have all been repaid.  She notes a few difficulties in operating her business.

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice and corn

loans.name: Kitumbo Group

texts.en:
Rehema Y. is in her late twenties. She is married and has two children. Since 2005, she has run a small restaurant. She works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $33.

This will be Rehema's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her last loan to repaint her place of business, and she has paid back her previous loans successfully. She intends to use the new loan to purchase more food for her restaurant.  

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group called Kitumbo, which totals seventeen members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

In the photo, Rehema is wearing pink, and is first on the left side of the front row.

loans.use: To purchase more food inventory.

loans.name: Caminando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO  inicia su onceavo ciclo  en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, de esta asociación podríamos decir que cuenta con socias antigua, sin embargo también tiene socias nuevas.  Esta asociación está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva está integrada por la  presidenta, la tesorera y la secretaria de actas.

La señora  presidenta Zulema es una mujer de 32  años de edad, casada con dos hijos, está desde hace dos ciclos en la asociación, llegó a la misma invitada por un familiar. En este corto tiempo ha logrado ganar la confianza de sus compañeras de forma que ha sido nombrada presidenta.

Desde hace cinco años trabaja en la venta de telas, polleras, centros, mantas, junto a su mamá, ambas cuentan con dos espacios de venta, un puesto en la zona 12 de Octubre y una tienda en la calle Max Paredes.
