Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como: venta de “variedades” (venta de papel higiénico, peines, pilas, agujas, sepillos de dientes, pasta dental, etc), venta de tela, polleras, mantas, venta de camisas, pensión, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa y venta de verdura.
En la foto aparece ademas el hijo mayor de una socia,viste una chompa roja, el comenta que quiso acompañarla.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Caminando Hacia el Futuro," is starting its 11th loan cycle in the central offices of Pro Mujer Bolivia in Villa Exaltacion.  We can say that this group contains some old friends; however, it also has some new members.  This group has 8 members: 7 women and one man.  The board of directors consists of the president, the treasurer, and the recording secretary. 

The president, Zulema, is a 32 year-old woman who is married and has 2 children.  She has been with this group for 2 loan cycles; she was invited to join by a relative.  Over this short period, she has managed to gain the confidence of her fellow group members, such that they named her the president.

For 5 years, she has worked selling fabric, traditional Bolivian skirts, and blankets with her mother.  They have 2 places where they sell: a post in the 12 de Octubre market and a store on the Max Paredes Street.  

With respect to the businesses that support the rest of the members of the group, they include sales of: consumer goods (toilet paper, combs, batteries, sewing needles, tooth brushes, toothpaste, etc.), fabric, skirts, blankets, shirts, meals, shoes, clothing and vegetables.

In the photograph, the oldest son of one of the members also appears in a red sweater.  He states that he wanted to come with her.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Maura, de 28 años, vive en casa de su suegra al lado de ella, de su esposo Juan de 29 años, que es chofer y de su pequeña hija; cada día es de lucha constante para esta emprendedora familia. Y por eso que se esfuerza por trabajar y salir adelante junto con su esposo. Cada día desde muy temprano empieza con la venta de diversos comestibles en su tienda ubicada en su casa, y dice que le gusta mucho su negocio ya que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ostentar una vida cómoda. Atiende sola desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, y se entretiene con sus clientes que le compran con frecuencia, pues saben que ella en la tienda puede encontrar los más variados productos comestibles. Dice que la única preocupación que tiene en la actualidad es que su pequeña se encuentra algo delicada de salud, pero sabe que con esfuerzo y dedicación logrará sacar a su familia adelante. Para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar más su negocio para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Maura tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en comestibles ya que quiere surtir mejor su negocio para ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Maura is 28 years old and lives in her mother-in-law's house with her mother-in-law, her husband Juan, 29, who is a driver and their small daughter.  Every day is a constant struggle for this enterprising family.  For this reason, Maura works very hard, together with her husband, to get ahead.  Every day from very early in the morning she starts selling groceries in her store which is located in her home.  She says that she likes her business very much because she makes a regular profit which enables her to live a comfortable life.  She works alone in the store from 9 in the morning to 8 at night.  She enjoys the company of her customers who buy from her very frequently because they know that they can find a wide range of food products in her store.  She says that the only worry she currently has is that her little one's condition is delicate but she knows that with effort and dedication she will succeed in getting her family ahead.   In the future she is planning to expand her business further in order to improve her profits.  This is the first loan which she has had with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner since she doesn't want to let down the people who made the loan possible.  The loan will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Maura is planning to use the loan she is requesting to buy a larger quantity of groceries so that she can better stock her business and be able to offer the best to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a range of products to stock her store

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
Mayra de 27 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Hace tres años comenzó a vender productos Yambal para poder ayudar con los gastos a su esposo ya que tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 años. Ella hace los pedidos de productos cada 15 días y comienza a promocionarlos con una revista. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, maquillaje etc. Trabaja recorriendo las calles de Paraíso y vendiendo los productos a sus conocidos y amigas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, maquillaje para tener mas variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender los productos y comenzar a construir su casa de cemento ya que ahora es de caña.
texts.en:
Mayra is 27 years old and sells Yambal products.  Yambal is a company which provides female entrepreneurs with the opportunity to make their own independent sales.  She lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads, whose houses are located in the mountains).

Three years ago she started selling Yambal products in order to help her husband with household expenses since they have two children – a 3 year old and a 1 year old.  She makes her product orders every two weeks and begins to market them with a catalog.  She sells perfume, creams, deodorants, make up etc.  She goes door to door in the streets of Paraíso, selling her products to acquaintances and friends.

With her loan she would like to buy perfume, creams and make up in order to have more variety in her products.  In the future she would like to have a store where she can sell her products and start to build a cement house as her house is currently made from cane.

loans.use: Perfume, creams, make up

loans.name: Clémentine

texts.fr: H. Clémentine est née vers 1983 à Ekpè, dans le commune de Sèmè-Podji. Clémentine, analphabète, est mariée à AKISSOE Eric, un soudeur. Clémentine est mère de trois (03) enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille vit depuis environs dix (10) ans à Agbalilamè un quartier de la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Les charges familiales sont supportées ensemble par le couple. Clémentine vend principalement de façon ambulante des chaussures qu’elle achète à Dantokpa le marché internationale du Bénin mais également des sacs depuis sept (07) ans. Clémentine sollicite auprès de ALIDé ce nouveau crédit pour augmenter son stock de produits (chaussures et sacs) et développer son activité. Clémentine n’a pas enregistré de difficultés au cours de l’exercice de son activité et a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurement obtenus auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Clémentine was born around 1983 in Ekpè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji.  She is illiterate and is married to AKISSOE Eric, a welder.  Clémentine is the mother of three children, some of whom are in school.  The family has been living for about ten years in Agbalilamè, a district in Sèmè-Podji. Family expenses are covered jointly by the couple. 

For seven years, Clémentine had gone door-to-door selling mainly shoes.  She gets her supplies of shoes, and also handbags, at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is requesting this new loan from ALIDé for increasing her inventory (shoes and bags) and for developing her business.  Clémentine hasn't noted any problems in operating her business, and she has indeed repaid the previous loans she obtained from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buying shoes and bags

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma L. is in her early thirties, married and has four children. Mwajuma has been running a small food stall for one year now, from which she sells fruits and vegetables, as well as casava chips. The business is open between 7 am and 8 pm and earns Mwajuma a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwajuma's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She aims to use this loan to stock up on fruits and vegetables as well as improving the condition of her stall. 

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group Munduli, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Mwajuma is wearing blue and orange, standing in the middle of the back row.

loans.use: Increase stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mbande Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma V. is in her mid thirties. She is married and has one son. For the past two years she has been running her own pharmacy. The pharmacy is open between 7:30 am and 9:30 pm and earns Mwajuma a good monthly profit. 

This will be Mwajuma's 2nd motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Mwajuma used her first loan to increase her stock of medicine, a loan which she has successfully repaid. With her second loan, Mwajuma aims to once again increase her stock of medicine.

Mwajuma will share this loan will her loan group, Mbande, which totals 8 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Mwajuma is seen as the woman holding a baby.

loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es: Pelagia, de 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 47 años y de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales el primero es mayor y los dos menores aún estudian en el colegio; y juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante. El día empieza desde muy temprano para esta empeñosa mujer, pues luego de atender a sus hijos, emprende su negocio de venta de gaseosas y cervezas afuera de su casa. Esta muy satisfecha pues su labor le genera regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar; además considera que es un trabajo tranquilo ya que  lo realiza desde la comodidad de su casa y no descuida la crianza de sus hijos. Manifiesta que empezó con algunas gaseosas y en la actualidad vende bastante, sobretodo durante los fines de semana, ya tiene algunos clientes fijos y les brinda su mercadería a crédito; y como ya se acerca la época veraniega desea aumentar su mercadería. También tiene planeado para el futuro empezar a vender algunos productos comestibles y helados. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Pelagia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de cajas de gaseosas y cervezas que necesita para abastecer mejor su negocio.
texts.en: Pelagia is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her husband José who is 47 and her three children.  One of her children is grown up and the two younger ones are still attending school.  Together they work hard to get ahead.  The day begins very early in the morning for this determined woman since, after seeing to her children, she starts work in her business selling soda and beer outside her house.  She is very happy because her work makes her regular profits which allow her to help her husband with the constant household expenses.  She also considers it to be a calm job because she can work from the comfort of her own home and not neglect her children.  She says that she started out with some soda and now sells quite a lot, especially on a weekend.  She has some regular customers and she offers them goods on credit.  As the summer season is approaching she would like to increase her merchandise.  She also plans, in the future, to begin selling some food products and ice cream.  This is her fourth loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner because she doesn't want to let down the people who made the loan possible.  The loan will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Pelagia is planning to invest the loan in the purchase of a large number of boxes of soda and beer which she needs to better stock her business.

loans.use: To buy boxes of beer and soda in order to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Babati Group

texts.en:
Salma K. is in her late thirties and is married. She has 4 children. Salma has been selling food from her food stall since 2000. The stall is open between 6 am and 10 pm and earns Salma a good monthly profit. 

This will be Salma's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Salma used her first loan to increase her stock of chapati and doughnuts. This loan has been successfully repaid. Salma will use her second loan to increase her stock in other products for her food stall, which she is currently missing. Salma's dream is to one day earn enough profit to build herself a new house.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group Babati, which totals 22 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Salma is wearing yellow and orange, standing in the middle in the back row.

loans.use: To increase stock of goods.

loans.name: Y. Clémence

texts.fr: A. Z. Y. Clémence est née le 21 Mars 1982 à Adjarra, dans le département de l’Ouéme. Mariée à ALI-KPARAH Ibrahim Clément un commerçant, Clémence est mère d’un enfant qui est scolarisé. Clémence est allée à l'école et s'est arrêté à l'université. La famille vit depuis quatre (04) ans à Habitat, l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Clémence vend depuis cinq (05) ans environs des mèches et des produits de beauté dans l'un des quartiers de Cotonou. Clémence s’approvisionne à Dantokpa le marché internationale du Bénin et au marché de Lomé, capitale politique du Togo. C’est pour augmenter le niveau de stock de mèches, des produits de beauté et pour renforcer son activité que Clémence sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Z. Y. Clémence was born on March 21, 1982 in Adjarra, in Ouéme county.  Married to Mr. ALI-KPARAH Ibrahim Clément, a merchant, she is married and the mother of one child, who is in school. Clémence went to school and stopped going at the university level.  The family has been living for four years in Habitat, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  The couple jointly ensure that their family expenses are covered.

Clémence has been selling hair extensions and beauty products for about five years in one of the district of Cotonou.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and at the market in Lomé, the capital of Togo.  To increase her inventory of hair extensions and beauty products and to bolster her business, Clémence is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Aurelia Monserrate

texts.es:
Aurelia de 44 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc. vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Ella tiene la tienda hace varios años para ayudar con los gastos a su esposo y poder conseguir sus propios ingresos, comenzó comprando bebidas, arroz, enlatados. Desde ese tiempo ella construyo la tienda en la parte delantera de su casa para que sea visible para sus clientes vendiendo toda clase de víveres ha podido surtir su tienda. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, lácteos, arroz. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir mas su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aurelia is 44 years old.  She has a convenience store where she sells rice, groceries, drinks etc.  She lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads and whose houses are located in the mountains).

She has had the store for several years to help her husband with household expenses and to generate her own income.  She started off buying drinks, rice and groceries.  Since that time she built the store in the front part of her home so that it would be visible to her customers.  Selling all kinds of provisions, she has been able to stock her store.  She works from 7.00am to 10.00pm every day.

In order to increase her merchandise she would like to use the loan to buy drinks, dairy products and rice.  In the future, she would like to expand and better stock her store in order to give her children a better future.

loans.use: Drinks, dairy products

loans.name: Las Monarcas Recuperadas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “Monarcas Recuperadas”, este nombre se escogió  por ser un grupo de mujeres que les gusta demostrar que se pueden lograr objetivos y crecimiento  personal. El grupo se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo,  Está conformado por 11 integrantes.María Elena P. es la presidenta del grupo, es casada y tiene tres dependientes económicos de 16,15 y 11 años, estudio la primaria y se dedica a la venta de ropa, adornos y carpetas tejidas con gancho y agujas, ella comenzó el negocio desde hace 5 años, comenta requiere su crédito para la compra de estambre pues como se acerca la época de frio para ella es muy conveniente tener lista su ropa para entonces. A ella le gustaría tener algún día máquinas de tejido para poder surtir a las tiendas de la comunidad.Esta foto fue tomada, en la casa de la señora María Elena P., como se puede ver en la foto es un grupo muy unido y la casa de la presidenta siempre está disponible para las reuniones semanales, en la foto falta la Sra. Gabriela P. H., ya que fue día de plaza y puso su puesto.
texts.en: This group is called “Monarcas Recuperadas”.  This name was chosen because this is a group of women who like to show that they can achieve their goals and develop as people.  The group is located in the state of Hidalgo and has 11 members.  María Elena P. is the group's president.  She is married and has three financial dependents aged 16, 15 and 11.  She has an elementary school education and works selling clothes, decorations and hand-knitted runners.  She started her business 5 years ago and tells us that she needs her loan to buy yarn because the cold season is approaching and it is very useful for her to have her clothes ready.  Some day she would like to own knitting machines so that she could stock the stores of her community.  This photo was taken in Mrs María Elena P.'s house.  As can be seen from the photo, they are a very close group and the president's house is always available for weekly meetings.  Mrs Gabriela P. H. is missing from the photo because it was market day and she  had to set up her stall.

loans.use: To buy wool and knit winter clothes

loans.name: San José Mi Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes que conforman el  comité “San José Mi” actualmente se encuentran iniciando con gran entusiasmo el 1° ciclo dentro del programa comité de mujeres y son señoras vecinas del barrio, todas las Señoras invertirán el dinero recibido en la compra de insumos y más mercaderías para la posterior venta.
Este grupo que inicia el primer ciclo son de la Zona de Ayolas, todas las Señoras son del mismo barrio, cada una de las Señoras tienen actividades diferentes y han unido sus esfuerzos para trabajar conjuntamente y así lograr progresar, no solo monetariamente, sino en forma personal, gracias a las capacitaciones que irán desarrollando en el transcurso de los ciclos.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la atención de su salón de belleza donde realiza trabajos de peluquería como cortes, tintas, peinados, y otros, además realiza trabajo de manicura y pedicura. 
Comenta que le va muy bien con su salón y tiene una cliente formado que solicitan sus servicios semanalmente, y está muy contenta con el grupo y espera aprender mucho.
texts.en:
The members who make up the “San José Mi” committee are currently starting their first loan cycle within the women's committee program with great enthusiasm.  The women are all neighbors and they all use the money they receive to buy supplies and merchandise which they then sell.

The members of this group, which is starting its first loan cycle, are from the Ayolas area.  All the women are from the same neighborhood and each one carries out different business activities.  They have united their efforts to work together and thereby make progress not only financially but also on a personal level thanks to the training sessions that are developed over the course of the loan cycles.

One of the members is María who runs a beauty salon where she performs hairdressing services such as haircuts, colors and hairdos as well as manicures and pedicures.

María comments that her salon is doing very well and she has a regular client base who request her services weekly.  She is very happy with this group and she is hoping to learn a lot.

loans.use: Purchase of hairdressing products such as shampoo, conditioners, oils, etc.

loans.name: Alpacoma Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. ALPACOMA  inicia su ciclo Nº 16 en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, de esta asociación podríamos decir que cuenta con socias antiguas.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva está integrada por la  presidenta, la tesorera y la secretaria de actas.

La señora  presidenta  Catalina, es una mujer de 45  años de edad, que ha sabido llevar adelante un hogar sola, madre de seis hijos. Está desde hace trece ciclos en la asociación, por lo que se constituye en una de las más antiguas.   
Desde hace siete años trabaja en la venta de ladrillos, ella comenta que una amistad le enseño el negocio. Compra ladrillo por mil y los vende desde su domicilio, en algunos casos, cuando las cantidades son grandes, llevan los ladrillos al domicilio de los clientes.

 Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellas tienen negocios como: venta de fruta, venta de ladrillo, venta de mantillas, venta de canaletas, venta de cosméticos, venta  de alimentos, y servicio de lavandería.
texts.en:
The ALPACOMA village bank is beginning its 16th loan cycle with the Villa Exaltación regional office.  We can certainly say that this village bank has long-standing members.  It has eight members, seven women and one man.  The executive committee is made up of the president, treasurer and secretary.

The president is Catalina.  She is a 45 year-old woman who has, on her own, successfully managed to move her family forward in life.  She has six children.  She has been with the association for thirteen loan cycles which makes her one of the longest-standing members.

For the past sixteen years she has been selling bricks.  She comments that a friend taught her the business.  She buys bricks by the thousand and sells them from her home.  In some cases, when the quantities are large, she transports the bricks to her customers' homes.

With respect to the businesses which the other members have, their business include the following:: fruit sales, brick sales, shawl sales, pipe and gutter sales, cosmetics sales, food sales and laundry services.

loans.use: To buy bricks

loans.name: Fifamè Georgette

texts.fr: V. Fifamè Georgette est née le 25 Avril 1979 à Akpakpa - Dodomey l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin où elle vit depuis sa naissance. Georgette est mariée à AHOUANYA Modeste, un architecte.  Le couple a trois (03) enfants, tous scolarisés. Georgette assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges familiales. Georgette a très peu fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture, activité qu’elle exerce depuis huit ans environs. En plus de la couture, Georgette vend des produits de merceries (boutons,  popelines, élastiques, fermeture, etc.) qu’elle achète à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. C’est pour le renforcement de son activité et la satisfaction de la demande de sa clientèle en produits de mercerie, que Georgette sollicite auprès de ALIDé un premier crédit.
texts.en:
V. Fifamè Georgette was born on April 25, 1979 in Akpakpa - Dodome, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she has lived since birth.  She is married to AHOUANYA Modeste, an architect.  The couple have three children, who are all in school. Together with her husband, Georgette ensures that the different family expenses are covered. 

Georgette had very little schooling but learned how to sew.  This is work she has been doing for about eight years. In addition to sewing, she sells sewing supplies (buttons, poplins, elastic items, zippers, etc.) that she purchases at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  To bolster her business and to satisfy the demands of her customers for sewing supplies, Georgette is requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buying sewing supplies to sell

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank "The Pink Women," which is located in the district of Ilave, in the province of Collao, and the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. She studied until the fifth year of her primary education.

María has worked with Manuela R. for four years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and she used the money to increase her business of fattening small animals, such as sheep. 

She is now asking for a loan of 1,500 PEN, money that she will use to increase the capital in her business fattening cattle. 

Her dream is to grow her business.

Her favorite aspects about working with the Communal Bank are the education sessions and the workshops that the loan officer conducts at each monthly bank meeting.

loans.use: Capital for her business of fattening livestock (sheep and cows)

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: V. Jeanne est née le 21 Décembre 1977 à Porto-Novo, la capitale politique du Bénin. Jeanne est mariée à KOUAKANOU Pierre, un mécanicien moto. Le couple a trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés et vit depuis dix (10) ans à Akpakpa-Dodomey  l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne assure ensemble avec son mari les charges familiales. Jeanne vend depuis sept (07) ans de façon ambulante des produits de beauté, des pâtes dentifrice, et des brosses à dents qu’elle approvisionne à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. Jeanne sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé pour rehausser le niveau de son activité ainsi que le stock de ses produits de beauté.
texts.en:
V. Jeanne was born on December 21, 1977 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to KOUAKANOU Pierre, a motorbike mechanic. The couple have three children, all in school, and have been living for ten years in Akpakpa-Dodomey, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Along with her husband Jeanne ensures that family expenses are covered. 

For seven years, Jeanne has gone door-to-door selling beauty product, toothpaste, and toothbrushes.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She is requesting a loan from ALIDé for boosting her level of business, as well as her inventory of beauty products.

loans.use: Buying personal care products

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso, de 24 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Todas las mañanas Alfonso se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de sus frutos, como: la naranja y mandarina, que después de cada cosecha los llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, ya que él mismo administrar su negocio y disponer de su tiempo. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es hacer la limpieza de sus cafetales. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado.
Con los dos mil trecientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 24 years old.  He is a simple and hard-working man.  He lives in his parents' house and what he wants more than anything is to get ahead in life.  Every morning Alfonso takes a lot of care in working his soil and leaving it very fertile since he knows that the quality of his fruit, such as oranges and mandarins, depends upon it.  After every harvest he takes his fruit to sell in the market in the city of La Merced.

What Alfonso most likes about his work is that he has a lot of freedom to work on his land since he runs his own business and makes use of his own time.  He has been in this business for 4 years and he considers that the most difficult job is cleaning his coffee plantations.  Over time, he would like to be able to buy more land in order to increase his production.  This is his fourth loan with MFP and he feels able to make all his repayments.  He is one of the most active members of his community bank and, for this reason, he is very well liked and respected.

With the 2,300 nuevos soles that he is requesting, he will buy more fertilizer to make his soil more fertile.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make his soil more fertile

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama MUJERES EMPRESARIAS, se localiza en el Altiplano, dentro de la región geocultural del Valle del Mezquital. El paisaje se forma de grandes barrancas, pertenece al Estado de H. en México. Es reconocido sin duda por  la actividad culinaria, las  chalupas y sopes, rebosados de ensalada y salsa picante. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes. Mireya R. ha vivido en esta comunidad desde hace 11 años, ella se dedica a vender comida en tiendas escolares, actividad que inicio hace 5 años, a los niños les agrada la comida que les vende y el trato que les da. Tiene 32 años de edad, estudió el bachillerato, tiene 3 hijos varones. Quiere este crédito para poderles ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga comprarle juguetes.
texts.en:
This group is called MUJERES EMPRESARIAS ('Businesswomen').  It is located in Altiplano in the geocultural region of the Mezquital Valley.  The landscape is made up of large ravines and belongs to the state of H. in Mexico.  It is well known for its culinary activity, its 'chalupas' (tostadas filled with shredded meat, onion, chipotle peppers, salsa) and 'sopes' (thick tortillas with vegetable and meat toppings), fried salads and hot sauce.

The group has 12 members.  Mireya R. has lived in this community for 11 years.  She sells food in school stores, a business which she started 5 years ago.  The children like the food which she sells them and the way she treats them.  Mireya is 32 years old.  She completed her high school studies and has 3 sons.  She would like to use this loan to offer more products to her customers and buy toys with the profits which she makes.

loans.use: To invest in her business and buy toys with the profits

loans.name: Veronica Pilar

texts.es:
Verónica de 33 años, tiene una pequeña tienda, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). En la foto aparece con el papa. 

Tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa desde hace 10 años atrás. Ha venido durante todo este tiempo adecuando la casa ya que es de caña para convertirla en cemento. Con ayuda de su esposo que es operador de un maquina ha surtido la pequeña tienda. Normalmente en la mañana trabaja en su tienda ya que es cuando mas clientes hay. Vende arroz, pollos, aceite, granos etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, aceite y vitrinas para su negocio ya que los productos que tiene no tiene lugar donde ubicarlos. En el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa y surtir mas su tienda.
texts.en:
Veronica is 33 years old and has a small store.  She lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads, whose houses are in the mountains).  She appears in the photo with her father.

She has had a small store in the front part of her house for 10 years.  All this time she has been improving her house since it is made of cane.  She has been converting it to cement.  With the help of her husband, who is a machine operator, she has stocked her small store.  She normally works in her store in the morning since that is when she has most customers.  She sells rice, chicken, oil, grain etc.

With her loan, she would like to buy supplies such as rice and oil and also display cases for her business since she doesn't have anywhere to put the products which she has.  In the future, she would like to finish building her house and better stock her store.

loans.use: Rice, oil, display cases

loans.name: Chuma Group

texts.en:
Abdalah J. is in his mid-twenties, single, and is the father of a one year old boy. He has been selling several types of bananas from his fruit store since 2002. The shop is open between 8:00 and 8:00 pm and earns Abdalah a small monthly profit.

This will be Abdalah's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. He aims to use this loan to increase his stock of bananas so that he will always be sure to have enough to meet demand. Abdalah's dream is that one day he will make enough money to be able to open a clothes store. 

Abdalah will share this loan with his loan group, Chuma, which totals 21 members. The members of this group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Abdalah can be seen third from left,back row, wearing green and yellow.

loans.use: Increasing Stock.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago the Patron Saint", located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, in the province of Azángaro, and the department of Puno. She is 58 years old, married and has eight children (four of whom are dependent). She has no formal education.
Margarita has worked with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for three years. The first loan she took was for 300 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital in her business selling pottery. She is now asking for a loan of 400 PEN, which she will use to buy materials for her business.
Margarita's dream is to have a house in the nearby city of Juliaca. Her favorite things about working with the Communal Bank are the meetings and the punctuality.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business selling pottery

loans.name: Alcanzando Metas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes que conforman el  comité “Alcanzando Metas” actualmente se encuentran iniciando el 1° ciclo dentro del programa comité de mujeres y son señoras vecinas del barrio, las Señoras poseen actividades diversas e invertirán en compra de mercaderías varias para su posterior venta e insumos para la producción.
Algunas de las integrantes aun no cuentan con actividades que les genere ganancias y actualmente se encuentran en proceso de búsqueda de la actividad y con proyectos para aumentar sus ingresos.
Una de ella es la señora  Mariza quien actualmente es limpiadora, y no cuenta aún con otra actividad, pero quiere realizar algunos curso de bordados en zapatillas y bijouterie para tener como actividad extra y al mismo tiempo una le genere ingreso adicional hasta llegar a independizarse por completo.
Parra ello debe pagar el curso y comprar las zapatilla y accesoR. que utilizará, y solicita el préstamo para invertir en esta idea y se encuentra con muchas ganas y espera que todo le salgan de la mejor manera. Agradece a las personas que hacen posibles este programa.
texts.en:
The members of “Alcanzando Metas” ('Achieving Goals') committee are currently beginning their first loan cycle within the women's committee program.  They are all neighbors.  The women own different businesses and they will use their loan to purchase various goods to sell and supplies for production.

Some of the members do not yet have business activities which make them profits and are currently searching for activities and projects to increase their income.  One of them is Mariza who is currently a cleaner.  She does not yet have another activity but would like to attend a course on embroidering slippers and making jewelry so that she can do this as an extra activity and at the same time make additional income until she manages to become completely independent.

For achieve this, she must pay for her course and buy the slippers and accessories which she will use.  She is requesting the loan to invest in this idea.  She is very excited and enthusiastic and hopes that everything will turn out well.  She thanks the people who make this program possible.

loans.use: To pay for a course and to buy slippers and accessories to embroider

loans.name: Marbelita

texts.en:
Marbelita is a member of the communal bank "Active Women II," located in the district of Juliaca in the provinces of San Román and Puno. She is 28 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one child. She completed her primary education. 

Marbelita has worked with Manuela Ramos for six months. Her first loan was for the amount of 500 Peru Nuevos Soles (PEN) and she used it to increase the capital in her business of selling domestic animals.

She is now asking for a loan of 800 PEN, money that will be used towards her business of selling domestic animals. 

Her dream is to have a grocery store. 

The things she enjoys most about working with the communal bank are the training sessions and the participation.

loans.use: Invest in her business selling domestic animals

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es: Anderson, de 23 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Conni de 22 años y su querida hija Juliet de 1 año, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los esfuerzos en cuidado y fertilización que Anderson realiza en sus cultivos, se ven reflejados en la calidad de sus productos, ya que los plátanos, café y cacao que cultiva son muy cotizados en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, que es donde vende sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha alegría, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el transporte es muy escaso por la zona donde tiene sus cultivos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP; en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, es de los pocos hombres de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Anderson, 23, is an unassuming and hardworking young man. He lives at his parents' house with his wife Conni, 22, and their dear baby daughter Juliet, who is 1. He wants to provide them with a better quality of life. 

Anderson's efforts in the care and fertilisation of his crops are reflected in the quality of his products. His bananas, coffee and cocoa are in great demand in the market town of La Merced, where he sells them. What he likes the most about his job is harvesting his lands, which he does with great joy. He has been in the business for 8 years and believes that the hardest part is transporting the goods, because transport means are scarce in the area where his fields are located. Over time he would like to buy more land so as to increase production. 

This is his fourth loan with MFP. He has been very punctual with prior repayments and expects to do the same now. He is one of the few men in his loan group, which makes him very dear to the other members. With the 1,200 soles requested he plans to buy more fertiliser for his crops.

loans.use: Buy fertiliser for his crops.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana de 44 años, tiene un pequeño comedor donde vende almuerzos, hace comidas típicas como seco de chivo, pollo y carne. 

Empezó hace 12 años atrás ya que toda su la mayoría de su juventud se dedico trabajando como comerciante. Puso su propio negocio de comidas para mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera comenzó haciendo platos típicos poco a poco invirtió dinero para comprar una cocina industrial, por esa buena decisión ella ahora tiene un pequeño comedor donde hace almuerzos en la cocina de su casa, trabaja desde las 11h00 hasta la hora que se le acaben los almuerzos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas y arroz para sus comidas, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
44 year old Mariana has a small cafeteria where she serves lunch. She makes typical dishes of the area such as goat stew, chicken, and meat.
She began this business 12 years ago and for the majority of her youth she worked as a store keeper. She started her own cooking business so that she could support her children as she is a single mother. She began making typical dishes and little by little was able to save money and buy a commercial stove. Thanks to this good decision, she now has a little cafeteria and she makes the lunches in the kitchen in her house. She works from 11 in the morning until whatever time the lunches are finished.
She wants this loan so that she can buy drinks and rice for her meals. In the future she wants to finish building her house and she wants her children to finish their studies successfully.

loans.use: Commercial kitchen

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, tiene 26 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortillas y antojitos, vive junto a su esposo quien es un albañil y tienen una hija llamada Odalis de 5 años de edad ella estudia primer grado.
Maritza tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y que lo aprendió de su madre, nos comenta que con mucho esfuerzo desde muy temprano da comienzo a trabajar, ella quiere realizar una inversión para mejorar el negocio por eso solicita un préstamo para contar con los fondos y poder fortalecerlo, su intención es mejorar cada día los ingresos de la familia para ir solventando las necesidades diarias.
Los sueños de ella son grandes pues quiere mejorar la condición de vida de su familia y que su hija pueda prepararse con los estudios para tener mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
26 year old Maritza lives in Corinto in the Morazán department. She works making and selling tortillas and snacks. She lives with her husband who is a mason and they have a 5 year old daughter called Odalis who is in the first grade.
Maritza has been running this business for some years and she learned the trade from her mother. She told us that she starts work very early and works very hard. She wants to invest and improve her business, and for this reason she is requesting a loan so that she will have the funds and be able to strengthen the business. Her intention is to improve the family income every day so that she can provide for their daily needs.
Her dreams are big - she wants to improve her family's standard of living and she wants her daughter to get a good education so that she can have better opportunities.

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Lucia
loans.use: Increase her business selling shoes

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 59 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de su hermano junto a su esposa Martha de 22 años y su querida hija Jazmín de 1 año, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Los largos días de trabajo que Arturo tiene en sus chacras, le han hecho ver que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograr una buena calidad en sus cultivos. Todas las mañanas, junto a los primeros rayos de sol, camina hasta sus chacras de café, plátano y palta, las  cuales están a una hora aproximadamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 19 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos que usa son muy peligrosos. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Arturo, 59 years old, is a quite simple and hardworking man. He lives in his brother’s home along with his 22-year-old wife Martha and his beloved one-year-old daughter Jasmine. They are the main reason for all his efforts.

The long workdays that Arthur puts in on his farms have made him realize that one must work very hard to achieve good crop quality. Every morning with the first sun-rays, he walks to his coffee, banana and avocado farms, which are about an hour away.

What he likes about his job is cultivating his land and he does so with great care. He has been doing this for the past 19 years and believes that the hardest part is spraying his farmland, because the chemicals he uses are very dangerous.

In the future, he expects to buy additional land to expand his crops. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he knows he has to pay his dues on time if he wants to be granted another loan later. He is a very active partner of his community bank. With the thousand additional soles requested, he will buy more fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: Buy more fertilizer to increase his production

loans.name: Gigi Del Rocio

texts.es:
Gigi de 46 años, vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes),  vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Hace varios años comenzó a vender productos Yambal para poder ayudar con los gastos a su esposo ya que tiene dos hijos de 12 y 5 años. Comienza a promocionarlos con el catalogo Yambal. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, maquillaje etc. Trabaja recorriendo las calles de Paraíso y vendiendo los productos a sus conocidos y amigas no tiene horario fijo de trabajo.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, maquillaje para tener mas variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere tener terminar de carreglar su casa e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gigi is 46 years old and she sells Yambal products (Yambal is a company offering enterprising women the opportunity to sell products independently). She lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil, which is a semi-urban district with unpaved roads where the houses are located in the mountains. 

She started selling Yambal products several years ago to help her husband with the household expenses now that they have two children of 12 and 5 years of age.  She has started promoting the products using the Yambal catalog. Gigi sells perfumes, creams, deodorants, make-up etc. She travels around Paraíso selling the products to her acquaintances and friends. She does not have a fixed work schedule.  

With this loan, she would like to buy perfumes, creams and make-up so that she has a greater variety of products. In the future she would like to fix up her house and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams and make-up.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Marcial de 54 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Carmen es una de las más visitadas en la comunidad de Alianza el Progreso, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 1 año en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Carmen is a quite simple and hardworking 34-year-old woman. She lives in a rented house with her 54-year-old husband Marcial and her four small children, to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Carmen's shop is one of the most visited in the Progressive Alliance community. From very early in the morning she opens her store hoping that neighbors will come to buy the things they need.

She is a very cheerful and attentive vendor, always welcoming guests with a smile and willing to help them with their purchases. What she likes about her job is talking with her neighbors. She has been running this business for one year now and believes that the hardest part is having to spend all day in the shop without the possibility of leaving.

Over time, she hopes to expand her store and fill it with more merchandise to offer customers a better variety of products. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is willing to pay all her dues on time, as she does not want to cause problems for the community bank, which is beloved by the other members. 

With the additional 1200 soles requested she will buy more products to improve her store.

loans.use: Buy more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis de 37 años de edad, es comerciante ofreciendo a los clientes productos necesarios para el hogar, refrescos y cosméticos en variedad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután;  vive con su esposo, su suegra, e hijos que el mayor tiene 15 años y el menor 10 años de edad, el negocio lo inicio ofreciendo únicamente refrescos y poco a poco quiso variarlo, es como nació la idea de surtirlo de cosméticos y productos como jabón, pasta dental entre otros, su trayectoria es de 9 años.
En esta ocasión solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos y materiales para la preparación de refrescos, pues quiere tener más ventas para ofrecer a los clientes, su propósito es ampliar el negocio, fortalecer su inventario y tener mejores ingresos que hagan más fácil el acceso al desarrollo económico familiar.
texts.en:
Luis, 37 years old, is a merchant offering customers the necessary products for home, soft drinks and assorted cosmetics.  He lives in the town of Jiquilisco, which is part of the Usulutan district.  Luis lives with his wife, his mother in law and his children (ages 15 and 10).  He started his business by only selling soft drinks, but he wanted to makes some changes, and gradually he incorporated the selling of cosmetics and other toiletries such as soap, toothpaste, etc.  He has been in business for 9 years.

Now, Luis is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and other products for the preparation of soft drinks, because he feels he'll have more to offer his customers, and in turn he'll be able to expand his business.  Luis plans to strengthen his inventory and bring in more income to make it easier for his family to realize economic growth.

loans.use: Compra de Cosmeticos y preparativos para refrescos (to purchase cosmetics and necessary products for making soft drinks)

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, de 51 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Paulina de 54 años y su hijo menor Julinho de 14 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Francisco, es el cultivo de plátano y café, las extensas tierras que posee, lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona. Sus productos los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de La Merced, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, ya que sus cultivos son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre esta muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Francisco is a very simple and hardworking 51-year-old man. He lives in his own home with his 54-year-old wife Paulina and his youngest 14-year-old son Julinho, who are the reason for all his efforts.

Francisco dedicates himself to the cultivation of bananas and coffee. He converted the extensive lands he owns to become one of the leading producers in the area. He sells his crops in the town of La Merced, which already has buyers waiting as his crops are of very good quality.

What he likes most about his job is to harvest his land which he has been doing with lots of determination for the past 27 years. He believes that the hardest thing is to protect his crops from pests that may affect them.

In the future, he wants to buy additional land to expand his production. This is his fourth loan with MFP; he is willing to pay his dues on time and to this end is already starting to save.

He is a very cheerful partner of his community bank and is always well aware of the agreements reached in their meetings. With the money requested he will buy more fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: Buy more fertilizer to improve fruit production

loans.name: Evelyn Cecilia

texts.es:
Evelyn de 38 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután con su familia, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, el negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal de este mismo lugar, lo atiende de lunes a domingo, este fue iniciado cuando ella ya se había casado.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería, con este préstamo ella pretende disponer de variedad de prendas de vestir para los clientes, mejorando así su condición como microempresaria y recibiendo ingresos mayores para sostener su hogar.
El objetivo de ella es fortalecer la venta, tener un negocio prospero y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 38 years old and lives in Juquilisco, in Usultán department, with her family.  She has an 8 year-old daughter.  She has a business selling clothes which she has had for 10 years.  Her business is in the town market and she serves there from Monday to Sunday.  The business was started when she had already married.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.  With this loan she plans to have a variety of garments for her customers, thereby improving her conditions as a small businesswoman and making more income to support her household.

Her goals are to strengthen her sales, to have a successful business and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Nelson Morcelino

texts.es:
Nelson, es vendedor informal de encebollados (plato típico como desayuno contiene pescado, cebolla). vive en una casa de caña ubicada en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Comenzó a  vender afuera de su casa encebollados (contiene cebollas y pescado) para poder mantener a su esposa y tres hijos que aun estudian. Poco a poco comenzó a tener clientela fija. En la actualidad ya tiene 5 años con este negocio y vende 20 platos diarios, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta que se acabe el encebollado.  

Para poder agrandar mas su negocio el quiere comprar ollas, pescados y otra parte invertirla en ropa ya que espera de ahora en adelante tener otro ingreso adicional. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento y que su negocio sea mas grande.
texts.en:
Nelson, is in business of informally selling the "encebollados" dish (it's a typical food served at breakfast containing fish and onions).  He lives in a house made out of cane in el Paraiso de Guayaquil (a semi-rural area with dirt roads and houses made partly in the mountains).  He began to sell this area's typical dish outside of their home and slowly began having regular customers.  He has been in business for 5 years and sells about 20 meals per day, and works from 06h00am until he sells all the "encebollados" that he's made.

In order to enlarge his business, Nelson would like to buy cooking pots, fish and invest some money in clothing - this will help him bring in additional income.  In the future wants to have a house made out of concrete, and expand his business.

loans.use: Ollas, pescado, ropa  (cooking pots, fish and clothing)

loans.name: Los Arcoiris De Atoto Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Los Arcoíris de Atoto, tiene este nombre porque a la presidenta le gustan mucho los arcoíris, ella dice que los arcoíris son señal de calma y tranquilidad, además este grupo se encuentra en Atotonilco de Tula Hidalgo. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes. María De La Paz Monterubio, es la presidenta del grupo tiene 36 años de edad estudio hasta preparatoria, es madre soltera y tiene un 1 hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, inicio hace 9 años, María de la Paz solicita el préstamo para invertir en  la compra de zapatos y ropa, la señora María de La Paz espera con ansias este préstamo para poder invertir el dinero en su negocio, ofrecer mayor diversidad de mercancía a sus clientes y así obtener mejores ingresos para ella y su familia, especialmente a su hijo. Roció C., es otra integrante del grupo, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estudió hasta la preparatoria, su estado civil es casada y tiene 2 hijos: un varón y una mujer, ella tiene una lavandería. Tiene 6 años de antigüedad con su negocio, el préstamo solicitado es para poder seguir haciendo crecer su negocio, su meta es llegar a poner su propio local  y hacerlo crecer cada día más para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y familia en general.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Los Arcoíris de Atoto' (Rainbows of Atoto).  They chose this name because the president really likes rainbows.  She says that rainbows are a sign of calm and tranquility.  This group is located in Atotonilco de Tula Hidalgo and has 11 members.  María De La Paz Monterubio is the president of the group.  She is 36 years old and studied to senior high school level.  She is a single mother and has one son.  She sells shoes and clothes.  She started the business 9 years ago.  María de la Paz is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of shoes and clothes.  María de la Paz is waiting anxiously for her loan so that she can invest the money in her business, offer a wider range of merchandise to her customers and thereby make a better income for herself and her family, especially her son.

Roció C is another member of the group.  She is 43 years old and studied to senior high school level.  She is married and has 2 children, one boy and one girl.  She has a laundromat.  She has had the business for 6 years.  She is requesting her loan so that she can continue to grow her business.  Her goal is to be able to establish her own premises and make her business grown more every day in order to provide her children and family in general with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and grow her business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the communal bank "Santiago the Patron Saint," located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, the province of Azángaro and the department of Puno. She is 58 years old and a single mother with three children. She studied until the third year of primary school. 

Lucia has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 Peru Nuevos Soles (PEN), and she used the money to increase the capital of her business selling sweets, bread and other foods.  

She is now asking for a loan for 2,500 PEN, money that she will use to buy merchandise for her business. 

Her dream is to increase the capital for her business. 

Her favorite things about working with the communal bank are the terms of the loan, the meetings and the information sessions.

loans.use: Merchandise for her business selling sweets, bread and other foods

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina pertenece al Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui,tiene 60 años, es casada y tiene 11 hijos.
Cristina tiene actualmente un restaurante,antes se dedicaba a la venta carne, pero no le fue bien, fió a sus caseros y no le pagaron. Despues alquilo un local del gremio de Carniceros en San Juan Bautista, ahí ha instalado su restaurante y le va bien.
Cristina solicita uncrédito de S/.2,500.00 que lo va a invertir en mercaderías para abastecer su restaurante.
A Cristina le gusta Finca, porque puede acceder a los créditos y a la vez puede ahorrar, estando en Finca educó a sus hijos aprendió a ser puntual, cumplida y responsable. 
Su sueño es tener su propio negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the Yana Ñahui community bank.  She is 60 years old, married and has 11 children.  Cristina currently has a restaurant.  Before this she used to sell meat but it didn't go so well.  She trusted her customers and they didn't pay her.  She then rented premises from the Butchers' Guild in San Juan Bautista.  She set up her restaurant there and it is successful.

Cristina is requesting a loan for 2,500 soles which she will use to purchase merchandise to supply her restaurant.

Cristina likes Finca because she has access to loans and at the same time she can save.  Through being in Finca she has educated her children and learned to be punctual and responsible.

Her dream is to have her own business and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gilber

texts.es: Gilber, de 38 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En la provincia de Chanchamayo, se encuentran las chacras de Gilber, sus tierras son amplias y con los cuidados que les brinda las ha convertido en uno de los cultivos mejores trabajados del poblado, es por eso que cuando lleva a vender sus plátanos y café al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, obtiene muy buenos precios debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Gilber con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en: Gilber, 38, is a hardworking and unassuming man who lives in his parent's house.  What he wants most is to improve his quality of life.  Gilber's farm is located in the Chanchamayo province; his lands are extensive and with the care he provides he has made them into some of the most productive land in the area.  For this reason, when he brings his bananas and coffee to sell in the market in the city of La Merced he gets very good prices owing to the good quality of his products.  What he enjoys most about his work is planting his fields and making them fertile.  He has been farming for 15 years, and what he considers most difficult is to protect his crops from the pests that can affect them.  Over time, he wants to buy more land in other villages so that he can increase his production and grow a greater variety of crops.  This is Gilber's 4th loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make his payments on time if he wants to access credit in the future.  In his communal bank he is a very responsible member and is always aware of the decisions that are made by his group.  With the 2,500 Peruvian soles he requests, he will buy more organic and chemical fertilizers to improve his lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to care for his crops

loans.name: Josefa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Josefa, administra una tienda y un comedor, tiene 35 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo en Santa Elena, departamento D. Usulután, ellos velan por el bienestar D. su único hijo y por la satisfacción D. las necesidades más importantes del hogar.
Este negocio lo inician juntos apoyándose mutuamente,  su horario es D. 8 D. la mañana a 9 D. la noche,  la demanda es buena por lo que se ven en la necesidad D. invertir en el negocio, para darle mayor estabilidad para la atención adecuada con los clientes, Ella solicita un préstamo que espera le ayuD. a superarse y a realizar la compra D. mercadería para fortalecer el inventario y tener a la mano los alimentos que necesita para preparar los diferentes menús a los clientes.
Su proyección es ampliar el negocio, atender más clientes, y mejorar los ingresos D. la familia para tener una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Josefa manages a shop and café. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband and son in Santa Elena in the department of Usulután. They work for the well-being of their only son and in order to meet the most important needs of the household.

They began this business together, mutually supporting one another. Their schedule is from 8:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night so that they can give the business greater stability and give adequate care to customers.

She is applying for a loan which she hopes will help the business to excel by carrying out the purchase of merchandise that will build up its inventory so that they have on hand the foods needed to prepare different dishes for customers. Her plan is to enlarge the business, serve more customers, and improve the family’s income in order to have better economic solvency.

loans.use: Purchase of material for preparing meals and basic goods.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola pertenece al Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui, tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Lola se dedica a la venta de verduras en el Mercado de Carmen Alto, Lola empezó vendiendo papas, pero lo cambio por la venta de verduras surtidas y la va bien.
Lola solicita un crédito de  S/.900.00 para abastecerse mas mercaderías para su puesto. A Lola le gusta las reubniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar, antes no lo podía hacer, en sus reuniones aprendió a rezar, dibujar, escribir y que las mujeres tienen derechos y que la Leyes le protegen. 
El sueño de Lola es tener su negocio en su propia casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales ya que ella no pudo estudiar.
texts.en:
Lola belongs to the Yana Ñahui community bank.  She is 45 years old, married and has 3 children.  Lola sells vegetables in Carmen Alto market.  She started off selling potatoes but changed over to selling a range of vegetables and her business is going well.

Lola is requesting a loan for 900 soles to stock her stall with more merchandise.  Lola likes her community bank meetings because she can save which she couldn't do before.  In the meetings she has learned to read, draw and write.  She has also learned that women have rights and that laws protect them.

Lola's dream is to have her business in her own home and for her children to become professionals because she wasn't able to study herself.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Segundo Silvio

texts.es:
Segundo es maestro constructor, vive son su esposa y tres hijos en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Desde pequeño el aprendió ha construir casas y a hacer diferentes actividades de arreglo de casa pero cuando se caso tubo que hacer la enseñanza en practica para poder mantener a su familia. En la actualidad el es maestro constructor tiene contratos en diferentes partes trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm, el le paga a un ayudante $ 10.00 diarios. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar herramientas y materiales de construcción para trabaja con sus propios materiales. En el futuro quiere mejorar su casa para que su familia este mas cómoda.
texts.en:
Segundo is a master builder.  He lives with his wife and three children in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads whose houses are located in the mountains).

Since he was a young boy he has been learning to build houses and carry out different household repairs.  When he got married he had to put his education into practice in order to be able to support his family. He is currently a master builder and has contracts in a number of places.  He works from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  He pays an assistant $10.00 a day.

With his loan he would like to buy tools and building equipment so that he can work with his own equipment.  In the future, he would like to improve his house so that his family can be more comfortable.

loans.use: Tools and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui, tiene 31 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 12-7- 2 años.
Sonia se dedica a la venta de quesos en Soqiaccato, El crédito de s/.900.00 que solicita es para comprar más queso y vender, asi tener más ingresos
A Sonia le gustan las reuniones de su bancomunal porque aprendió a trabajar y ahorrar en las charlas de negocios, tambien ha aprendido los derechos de las mujeres.
El sueño de Sonia es que su negocio crezca y comprarse un terrenito para que viva con su familia.
texts.en: Sonia belongs to the Yana Nahui community bank.  She is 31-years old and partnered with 3 children, 12-, 7- and 2-years old, respectively.  Sonia operates a business selling cheeses in Soquiaccato.  She is applying for a S/.900 loan to buy more cheese to stock her business and increase her income.  Sonia very much likes her meetings with the community bank because she has learned from others there how better to work and save.  She has also learned about the rights of women.  Sonia's dream is for her business to grow and to buy a small bit of land where she can live with her family.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Elsy Noemy

texts.es:
Elsy, de 29 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y su hija, este negocio lo realizo con la ayuda de su esposo y tiene ya 5 años de administrarlo con la ayuda de su hija; ella tiene la dificultad de no tener energía en su vivienda y a la vez no posee un inventario de los materiales que utiliza para la preparación de tortillas, por esta razón solicita un préstamo que le ayude a salir de esta problemática, dándole un mejor servicio a los clientes y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Su objetivo es cancelar este préstamo puntualmente y seguir trabajando con esta ayuda para progresar en el negocio.
texts.en: Elsy, 29, lives in Jiquilisco, a town in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Usulutan.  She operates a business making and selling tortillas.  She lives with her husband and daughter.  She built the business with help from her husband and she has run it these past 5 years with her daughter's help.  She faces two problems: her house is not wired for electricity and she doesn't have enough money to buy supplies for her food business.  She is applying for a loan to address both problems.  She will be able to better serve her customers and also improve her family's living conditions.  Her goal is to repay the loan on time and, with this help, grow and improve her business.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business and install electricity.

loans.name: Klever Alberto

texts.es:
Klever tiene una pequeña tienda, vive son su esposa y tres hijos en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Empezó adecuando su casa para ubicar una tienda, readecuo la parte delantera y comenzó a vender víveres de primera necesidad, vende arroz, enlatados, granos, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm con la ayuda de su esposa. Una de las dificultades para tener un volumen de ventas mayor son las calles que no están pavimentadas y a los clientes se les dificulta la comprar. 

Con el préstamo quieren comprar quintales de arroz, azúcar y aceite para surtir mas su tienda y cubrir con todos los gastos. En el futuro quiere tener su tienda en otro sector debido a la delincuencia y poder comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Klever owns a small store.  He lives near Guayaquil (a semi-urban area with dirt roads and houses perched on hillsides) with his wife and three children.  

Klever rearranged his house to set up the store, carving out room in the front so that he could start selling basic commodities such as rice, dairy products, grains, drinks, etc.  He works, with his wife's help, from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night.  One of the problems that he faces is that the local streets aren't paved and customers have a difficult time reaching his shop to buy what they need.

Klever will use this loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar and cooking oil to stock his store and cover all of the expenses.  In the future, he wants to own a store in another area to escape local crime.  He also wants to buy a car.

loans.use: Inventory for general store.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Don Carlos, es un comerciante de mariscos y pescado, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, tiene 50 años de edad, y su familia está conformada por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos que sus edades están entre 9 y 25 años de edad; El negocio lo administra con su esposa y llevan ya 8 años dedicándose a este comercio, ellos viajan a otros pueblos a vender el pescado viendo la forma de atender nuevos mercados y que sean buenos para consumir este producto.
Don Carlos quiere invertir en las compras por mayor por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para realizar dicha inversión, que para él significa mucho puesto que de esta manera podrá tener mejores ventas y progresar con el negocio.
El propósito de él es luchar por que sus ventas aumenten pues él quiere tener un negocio estable y prospero para de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Don Carlos operates a seafood business.  He lives in Jiquilisco, a town in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Usulutan.  He is 50 years old and married with four children who range in age from 9- to 25-years old.  He operates the business with his wife and they have run it for 8 years now.  They travel to other towns to sell, looking for new markets and calculating which are best for sales.  
Don Carlos is applying for a loan because he wants to buy wholesale supplies of seafood.  For him, the loan offers a way to increase his sales and grow the business.  His goal is not just to increase sales, but to establish a stable and prosperous business so that he can improve the lives of his children and the rest of the family.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of seafood for resale.

loans.name: Resplandor Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Resplandor esta ubicado en el departamento D. Ayacucho, inicia su sexto ciclo con 15 socias las cuales tienen diversos negocios. Vilma es L. Presidenta del Bancomunal, es conviviente y tiene 28 años.
Vilma es cosmetóloga, trabaja en un local, su pareja que es mecánico le apoya en L. labor que elL. realiza.
Vilma solicita un crédito D. S/.600.00 para comprar productos D. belleza como tintes líquidos y demás accesorios. Le gusta Finca porque pueD. acceder al crédito y las capacitaciones que recibe le ha permitido aprender mucho, sobre todo por los temas que se desarrollan. El sueño D. Vilma es tener su propio salón D. belleza.
texts.en: The Resplandor community bank is located in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ayacucho.  The bank is starting its sixth round with 15 members, each of whom operates a business of various kinds.  Vilma is the president of the community bank.  She is 28-years old and partnered.  Vilma is a beautician and works in a shop.  Her partner is a mechanic and he supports her efforts to create her own business.  Vilma is applying for a S/.600 loan to buy supplies--dyes and other beauty products--for her business.  She likes Finca because she can borrow there, but also because they proviD. training services that have allowed her to improve her business skills.  Above all, they help borrowers reach their full potential.  Vilma's dream is to own her own salon.

loans.use: Buy supplies for salon business.

loans.name: Juan Crisostómo

texts.es:
Juan Ruiz es un buen hombre de 60 años, que tiene un negocio llamado “La esquina de la Frontera”; él trabaja la marroquinería al lado de su esposa, y en su miscelánea  vende variedades y exhibe los bolsos, carteras y billeteras que ellos mismos fabrican. En el barrio Simón Bolívar todos conocen su negocio, que nació hace 30 años cuando solo se dedicaba a la marroquinería  y hace 8 años creo un punto de ventas, al que gradualmente agregó otros artículos como papelería, refrescos, adornos para el cabello, medias interiores etc.
Juan y su cónyuge tienen 6 hijos en las edades de 17 a 30 años, dos de ellos   profesionales y 2 estudiaron carreras técnicas, y todo esto a partir del esfuerzo familiar que hacen todos para lograr la misma meta. El y su cónyuge, se distribuyen el trabajo, frecuentemente ella se dedica a la confección de bolsos en su maquina y él a la miscelánea, pero usualmente intercambian la actividad. Esta iniciativa surgió cuando descubrieron que con el esfuerzo de los dos, eran capaces de sacar adelante a su familia como efectivamente lo han hecho.
Su máximo sueño es tener su casa propia y ampliar en ella su  negocio de marroquinería y de variedades, su credikiva es su primera financiación con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el planea surtirse de materiales de marroquinería, como cuero, cuerina, telas y adornos e hilos,refrescos, así como mercancías variada para la temporada de Diciembre que ya se avecina y sus clientes están atentos a comprar en su miscelánea regalos y detalles para mostrar su cariño en  familia  durante este fin de año.
