texts.en:
Juan Ruiz is a good man.  He’s 60 years old and has a business called “The Corner of the Border.”  He and his wife work with leather goods and show and sell a variety of goods, bags, portfolios, and wallets that they make in their shop.  Everyone in the Simón Bolívar neighborhood knows their business that was born 30 years ago as a simple leather workshop.  They created a point of sale eight years ago, and they gradually began selling other things, such as paper goods, soft drinks, hair accessories, undergarments, etc.

Juan and his wife have six children between the ages of 17 and 30.  Two of them have professional careers and two others have studied technical trades, all due to the effort that the family makes to reach their goals.  He and his wife split up the work; she often makes bags on her sewing machine and he works in the shop, but they usually trade off.  The started doing this when the realized that they could move the family ahead, which they have done, by working together.

His greatest dream is to have his own house and expand his leather goods workshop and sundry business into it.  This Kiva loan will be their first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and they plan to use the money to buy leather good supplies, such as leather, synthetic leather, fabric and decorations, thread, soft drinks, and various seasonal items for December, which is approaching and their customers are ready to buy miscellaneous presents and things to show their affection to their families at year’s end.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El Comité Nuevo Amanecer es un excelente  comité conformado el 06 de Julio de 2.010, integrado por 18 mujeres de la Ciudad de Ita.
 Es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo. 
La mayoría de las integrantes del grupo siguen activas desde el primer préstamo y con eso demuestran solidaridad y compañerismo. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Pablina y se dedica a la venta de pan y miel. 
Esta actividad los realiza dos o tres veces a la semana dependiendo de los pedidos que reciben de sus clientes. 
La miel que ella vende los compra de varias zonas del país, y el pan es totalmente casero, ella misma los prepara en un horno que tiene en su casa. 
Sus clientes están muy satisfechos con sus productos y solicitan el préstamo para la compra de harina, queso, grasa para pan y otros ingredientes.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) Communal Bank is an excellent group that was formed on July 6th, 2010.  The group is comprised of 18 women from the city of Ita.

It is a very active group, and all of the members demonstrate companionship and solidarity.  They attend the weekly meetings, and they carry out activities to raise money for the common good of the group.  The majority of the group members are continuing in the same businesses they have had since the first loan.  That way they are demonstrating solidarity and companionship.

Pablina is one of the members.  She sells bread and honey.  She does this two or three times a week, depending on the orders she gets from her customers.  She buys the honey that she sells in various areas of the country.  The bread is completely home-made.  She makes it herself in an oven that she has in her house.  Her customers are very satisfied with her products.  She is requesting the loan to buy flour, cheese, fat for bread, and other ingredients.

loans.use: To buy flour, fat, and honey

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba P. D. M. vive en el barrio La Ceiba D. la ciudad D. Barranquilla, allí tiene una microempresa D. fabricación D. almuerzos y comidas corrientes especialmente D. sancochos,  una deliciosa sopa típica que incluye yuca, ñame, plátano, ahuyama y  papa, al cual se agrega alguna carne D. res o D. cerdo, o gallina o pescado o trifásico que es la mezcla D. tres carnes, o pentafásico si así usted lo quiere. 
El negocio D. Alba P. surgió cuando su esposo, un empleado D. restaurantes, dejó D. trabajar y ellos aprovecharon ese potencial D. conocimientos para aplicarlo a un negocio que  generará ingresos familiares  por cuenta propia. DesD. ese momento le venD. a la comunidad donD. habita y a negocios D. la Cordialidad, una vía principal cercana conformada por muchas microempresas y empresas, cuyos trabajadores se han convertido en sus clientes a los que  también ofrece  su servicio a domicilio.  Este es su segundo financiamiento recibido por parte D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con su credikiva comprará materiales e insumos al por mayor, como arroz, aceites, harinas,zaucar y sal,  para disminuir los costos y dejar D. comprar al menudeo.  Su sueño principal es tener un local ya que en este momento trabaja en la terraza D. su casa   para ser vista por los peatones. Su principal problema es la alta competencia que tiene en  el sector pero que Alba enfrenta con calidad, buenos precios y prácticas apropiadas D. higiene.
texts.en:
Alba P. D. M. lives in La Ceiba neighborhood in the town of Barranquilla.  There she has a small business preparing lunches and set meals, especially 'sancochos', a delicious, traditional soup which includes cassava, yam, plantain, pumpkin and potato to which she adds some beef, pork, chicken, fish or 'trifásico' which is a mixture of three meats, or 'pentafásico' (with five meats) if that is what you like.

Alba P.'s business started when her husband, a restaurant employee, stopped working.  They took advantage of his knowledge and applied it to a business which would create family income and let them be self employed.  From that moment she has been selling to their local community and to the businesses in la Cordialidad, a nearby main road where there are a lot of businesses whose workers have become their customers.  They also offer a home delivery service.

This is Alba P.'s second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy material and supplies wholesale such as rice, oil, flour, sugar and salt.  This will help her to lower costs as she can stop buying at retail prices.  Her main dream is to have her own premises since at the moment she is working outsiD. her own home so that pedestrians can see her.  Her main problem is the stiff competition that exists in the sector but Alba faces this with quality, good prices and appropriate hygiene practices.

loans.use: To buy material and supplies wholesale such as rice, oil, flour, sugar and salt

loans.name: Triunfo Comun Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Triunfo Común las Señoras le pusieron así porque son unas Triunfadoras y común porque buscan que sea crecimiento mutuo. Está ubicado en el Estado de  México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. Yolanda Valdés es la presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 49 años, estudió hasta la Universidad la carrera de Turismo, es comerciante de manualidades y tiene en total 3 hijos (2 mujeres y 1 varón).  Ella se dedica a la venta de manualidades que inició hace 15 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en mercancía y poder realizar sus figuras y manualidades. Sus clientes son personas de la misma comunidad que le encargan novedades para fiestas.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito para invertir y sacar más modelos. También espera poder llevarse a sus hijos de vacaciones a la playa. Esta foto fue tomada en la  casa de la Sra. Yolanda, se pueden ver las manualidades que vende en la foto.
texts.en: This group is called 'Triunfo Común' (Mutual Triumph).  The women gave the group the name 'Triunfo' ('triumph') because they are winners and 'Común' ('mutual') because they are seeking mutual growth.  The group is in the State of Mexico and has 10 members.  Yolanda Valdés is the group's president.  She is 49 years old and studied tourism at University.  She is a merchant who sells manual crafts.  Her customers are people from the same community who order novelties for parties.  As she requests her loan Yolanda feels happy.  She would like to use this loan to invest and obtain more designs.  She also hopes to be able to take her children on holiday to the beach.  This photo was taken in Yolanda's home.  The novelties which she sells can be seen in the photo.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise and make her novelties

loans.name: Diana Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Diana López es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas, vive en el centro del cantón Gualaceo, cantón conocido como El Jardín del Azuay ubicado 35 Km al este de Cuenca, es un pueblo próspero, asentado en uno de los más bellos valles de la provincia y del país. Es tierra de gran fertilidad, espléndido paisaje y agradable clima por lo que constituye uno de los centros turísticos de gran orden. 

Nuestra socia se tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 4 hijos  de 13, 10, 5 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus tres últimos hijos en una escuela del cantón. Su esposo es de profesión albañil. No tienen casa propia por lo viven en casa de un familiar.

Doña Diana se dedica a trabajar en el bar de una escuela, actividad que la viene desarrollando hace un año y su horario es de 9 de la mañana hasta las 11 y media de la mañana de lunes a viernes. También tiene una licorería en la que lleva 4 años laborando, la atiende de Jueves a Sábado desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 2 de la madrugada.
 
Es socia del Banco comunal hace un año y tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más producto para su licorería.
 
Su meta esconstruir su casa en un terreno que es de propiedad.
texts.en:
Diana López is a member of the Gualaceñitas Communal Bank.  She lives in the center of Gualaceo canton, known as "The Garden of Azuay", about 35 kilometers to the east of Cuenca. It's a prosperous town nestled in one of the most beautiful valleys in the province and in the country. It is a very fertile land, and it offers beautiful scenery and a pleasant climate, which make it an important tourist destination.

Diana is 28 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She has four children; 13, 10, 5, and 4 years old.  Her oldest daughter goes to high school, and the three other children go to elementary school in the canton.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  They do not have their own house; they live in a relative’s house.

Diana works in the snack bar in a school.  She has been developing this business for one year.  Her schedule is from 9:00 a.m. until 11:30 a.m. Monday through Friday.

She also has a liquor store, which she has been working in for four years.  She works in that business from Thursday through Saturday.  She works from two in the afternoon until two in the morning.

She has been a member of the communal bank for one year.  She has a very good friendship with all of the members.  She will use the loan to buy more products for her liquor business.

Her goal is to build a house on a piece of land that she owns.

loans.use: To buy liquor for her business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, de 40 años, es un hombre muy humilde y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El arduo trabajo que Guillermo realiza en sus chacras, le ha traído como resultado una buena producción, ya que sus plantaciones de plátanos y café, han sido cosechadas abundantemente y con muy buena calidad.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los dos mil trescientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 40, is a very humble and hard-working man.  He lives in his own house with his three beloved children.  What he wishes for most is to improve their quality of life.

As a result of his arduous work in his fields, he has gotten good production.  He grows bananas and coffee, and his harvests have been abundant and of a very good quality.  What he likes most about his work is harvesting his fields.  When he does that he feels like his efforts are fruitful.  He has been doing this activity for 20 years.  He considers the most difficult part to be taking care of the plants so that they are not affected by pests.  In time, he hopes to buy more land to increase his production.

This is his fourth loan with MFP.  He knows that he has to give it his all and work very hard in order to make his payments on time, and he is prepared to do so.  He is a very responsible member of his communal bank.  That is why he is very respected.  He will use the 2,300 soles he has requested to buy fertilizer in order to improve his production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to improve his production

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the communal bank "Santiago the Patron Saint," located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, the province of Azángaro and the department of Puno. She is 46 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are independent. She studied until the fourth year of her secondary education.

Lorenza has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. The first loan she got was for 300 Peru Nuevos Soles (PEN), and she used the money to increase the capital of her business selling meat and yogurt. 

She is now asking for a loan of 2,000 PEN, money that will be used to buy merchandise for her business selling meat, yogurt and cheese. 

Her dream is to have better machinery to be able to make dairy products and to have more capital to be able to bring meat to the mines. 

Her favorite things about working with the communal bank are the loan terms, the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: Merchandise for her business selling meat, yogurt and cheese

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr: A. Viviane est née vers 1980 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Viviane est mariée à TOVIHO Jean, un ferrailleur. Viviane est mère de trois (03) ans, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Agbodjèdo , un des quartiers de la ville de Cotonou. Viviane est analphabète et assure ensemble avec son mari toutes les charges familiales. Viviane mène comme activité la vente de sacs de sortie à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. Viviane fait l’approvisionnement de ses produits au marché Dantokpa de Cotonou et au marché du Lomé, la capitale politique du Togo. C’est pour l’évolution de son activité et l’augmentation de stock de sacs que Viviane sollicite pour la cinquième fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les anciens crédits reçus par Viviane auprès de ALIDé ont été bien remboursés. Viviane a pour ambitions personnelles d’avoir sa propre boutique mais rencontre parfois dans l’exercice de son activité quelques difficultés.
texts.en:
A. Viviane was born around 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to TOVIHO Jean, a scrap metal merchant. Viviane is a mother of three children, who are all in school.  She is illiterate, but along with her husband, she ensures that all family expenses are covered. The family lives in Agbodjèdo, a district of Cotonou. 

Viviane has a business selling handbags at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She gets her supplies of merchandise at Dantokpa and at the market in Lomé, the capital of Togo.  To improve her business and  increase her inventory of handbags, Viviane is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the fifth time.  The former loans she received from ALIDé have indeed been repaid. Her personal ambition is to have her own store but sometimes runs into difficulties in operating her business.

loans.use: Buying handbags

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 25 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en una a casa alquilada junto a su esposa Cecilia de 20 años y su querida hija Yesely de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Cuando era niño, los padres de Juan le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café, palta y plátano, para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva menos de 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plagas. Desea con muchas ganas, comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil setecientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan, age 25, is a very happy and hard-working man.  He lives in a rented house with his his 20 year old wife, Cecilia, and his beloved four year old daughter, Yesely.  He wants to give them a better future.  

When he was a boy Juan’s parents taught him everything he needed to know about farming.  Little by little, and as time passed, he was entrusted with his parents’ land.  He now has extensive land for farming.  He grows coffee, avocados, and bananas.  He later sells them in the market in the city of La Merced.

What he likes most about his work is cultivating his land.  This is what gives his family food.  He has been doing this work less than 20 years.  He considers the most difficult part to be taking care of his crops so they do not become infested with insects.  He really wants to buy a car so that he is able to transport his products.  

This is his fourth loan with MFP.  He has always been very punctual with his payments, and he plans to do so again this time.  He is a very supportive of his colleagues in his communal bank.  He will use the 1,700 soles he has requested to buy more fertilizer to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to improve his crops

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: H. Louise est née en 1976 à Gbénonkpo, un des quartiers de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin où elle vit depuis sa naissance. Louise est mariée à HOUKPATIN Gildas. Louise est mère de trois (03) enfants, tous scolarisés. Louise est allée à l’école et s’est arrêtée au cours primaire. Louise vit avec ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari toutes les charges familiales. Louise exerce comme activité la vente des pains sucrés à son domicile. Mais Louise vend également des produits divers (lait, sucre, nescafé, piles, conserves, savons, etc.) qu’elle approvisionne à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. C’est pour améliorer le niveau de son activité et augmenter le stock des produits divers que Louise sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurement reçus par Louise ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
H. Louise was born in 1976 in Gbénonkpo, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she has lived since birth.  She is married to HOUKPATIN Gildas, and is the mother of three children, who are all in school. Louise has attended school and stopped going in primary school. She lives with her children and ensures, along with her husband, that all family expenses are covered. 

Louise has a business selling sweetened breads out of her home.  She also sells a variety of goods (milk, sugar, Nescafé, batteries, canned foods, soaps, etc.) that she purchases at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  To improve her level of business and to increase her diverse stock of goods, she is requesting a new loan from ALIDé.  The previous loans she received have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: Buying a variety of goods (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, sugar, batteries, insecticides, soaps, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a beauty kit

loans.name: Las Alondras Del Creston Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Las Alondras del Crestón, tiene este nombre porque en el lugar donde se reúnen pasa un río y ahí bajan a bañarse las aves  llamadas alondras, a las señoras les gustan mucho por este motivo decidieron ponerle ese nombre a su grupo, dicen que las alondras tienen un brillo que refleja una gran esperanza.  Está ubicado en la comunidad del Crestón en Hidalgo, México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Rosario Catalina es integrante  del grupo. Tiene  43 años, estudio el bachillerato, y tiene en total 2 hijos varones.  Ella tiene una cocina económica la inicio hace 5 años.  Solicita el préstamo para hacerle mejoras a su negocio. Los clientes dicen que les agrada comer en ese negocio porque la señora es muy alegre y acogedora.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y con muchas ganas de trabajar, ya que solicito el crédito para mejorar su negocio y seguir brindando un buen servicio, y a su vez lograr su sueño de comprar un automóvil.
texts.en: This group, called "Las Alondras del Crestón" (The Larks of Creston), has this name because a river passes by the place that they meet, and at this river birds called alondras (larks) go down to bathe themselves.  The women like these birds very much, and so for this reason they decided upon this name for their group.  They say that the larks have a brightness that reflects their great hope.  This place is located in the community of Crestón, in Hidalgo, Mexico.  This group has 10 members.  Rosario Catalina is a member of the group.  She is 43 years old, has a high school education, and has 2 male children.  She has had a small eatery for 5 years.  She requests a loan to make improvements to her business.  Her customers say that they enjoy eating in her establishment because she is very cheerful and welcoming.  Now, requesting this loan, she feels very content and is eager to work, because she requests the loan to improve her business so that she can continue to provide good service and, on her part, achieve her dream of buying an automobile.

loans.use: to make improvements to her eatery

loans.name: Elfrida

texts.fr: H. Elfrida est née le 14 Décembre 1980 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Elfrida est mariée à GOUDJAÏ Eric, un militaire vétérinaire. Le couple a trois (03) enfants, tous scolarisés. Elfrida vit avec ses enfants à Ayélawaddjè, un quartier de Cotonou, il y a environs deux (02) ans. Toutes les charges familiales sont assurées par le couple. Elfrida a fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêtée en cours primaire. Elfrida mène comme activité principale la vente des habits tout cousus de façon ambulante depuis environ dix(10) ans. En dehors de cela, Elfrida vend des chaussures et des produits divers (savons, pâtes dentifrices, brosses à dents etc.). Elfrida s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. C’est pour faire évoluer son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits que Elfrida sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurement reçus par Elfrida auprès de ALIDé ont été bien remboursés. Elfrida a pour ambitions personnelles d’avoir sa propre boutique mais Elfrida rencontre rarement quelques difficultés aucours de l’exercice de son activité.
texts.en: Elfrida H. was born on December 14, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Elfrida is married to Eric Goudjai, who is a veterinarian in the military. The couple has three children, all of whom go to school. Elfrida has been living with her children in Ayélawaddjè, a district in Cotonou, for about two years. The spouses jointly take care of all family expenses. Elfrida stopped her studies at the primary level. Her main business activity is to sell  ready-to-wear clothing as a street vendor, which she has been doing for about 10 years. In addition, she also sells shoes and miscellaneous products (soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc). Elfrida stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. In  order to expand her activity and increase her merchandise stock, she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. The loans obtained by Elfrida from ALIDé in the past have been duly repaid. Elfrida’s goal is to open her own store, but even now she is managing her business without major difficulties.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es: El Señor Perfecto B. H., es un adulto mayor de 65 años, es casado y su esposa labora como comerciante, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, ellos tienen 6 hijos mayores de edad, el señor Perfecto es agricultor y cuenta con una experiencia de más de 20 años, tiempo al que se han enfrentado a problemas de  infecciones de plagas, así mismo los gases que emanan el volcán que se encuentra en las cercanías, afectan de sobremanera sus cosechas, a futuro desea realizar un estudio de conservación de suelo y establecer una cerca viva que le permita mejores condiciones económicas para su negocio, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, que brinden un mantenimiento Fitosanitario a sus cultivos, para un aumento en el volumen de ganancias que le favorezca a futuros proyectos que mejore la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Perfecto B. H. is an older man, 65 years old, and married.  His wife works as a merchant, supporting their household income.  They have 6 grown children.  Mr. Perfecto is a farmer with more than 20 years of experience.  He has faced problems of pest infestations and gases emanating from a nearby volcano that greatly affect his crops.  In the future he wants to study soil conservation and put iup a hedge that will allow him to improve economic conditions for his business.  Now he requests a loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for plant health maintenance of his crops.  This will result in an increase in profits to be used for future projects to inprove his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To maintain plant health of his crops.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: A. Antoinette est née le 13 Juin 1972. Antoinette est mariée à DOSSA Denis. Antoinette, alphabétisé, est mère de trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Agbodjêdo depuis dix (10) ans, l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, le capitale économique du Bénin. Toutes les charges familiales sont assurées par le couple. Antoinette vend de nourritures (pâte riz) et aussi des condiments, de l'huile de plame à Cotonou. Antoinette exerce cette activité, il y a dix sept (17) ans environs. Antoinette fait l’achat de ses produits à Zongo, un marché de Cotonou. C’est pour l’évolution et le renforcement de son activité que Antoinette sollicite un nouveau crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les anciens crédits reçus par Antoinette auprès de ALIDé ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
A. Antoinette was born on June 13, 1972.  She is married to DOSSA Denis.  Antoinette, who is illiterate, is the mother of three children, all in school.  The family has been living for ten years in Agbodjêdo, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  All family expenses are covered by the couple

Antoinette sells food (cornmeal mash, rice) and also condiments and palm oil in Cotonou.  She has been in this business for about seventeen years.  She makes her purchases at Zongo, a market in Cotonou.  To improve and strengthen her business, she is requesting a new loan from ALIDé.  The former loans she received from ALIDé have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: Buying sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, etc.), palm oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rice, blenders, pans

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr: B. Rachelle est née le 29 Septembre 1987 à Akpakpakanmè , l’un des quartiers de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin où elle vit depuis sa naissance. Rachelle est mariée à HOUSSOU Martin de profession architecte. Rachelle, analphabète est mère d’un enfant qui n’est pas encore scolarisé. Le couple vit et supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Rachelle vend depuis quatre (04) ans à domicile des mèches et des produits de beauté. Rachelle s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, le marché international du Bénin. C’est pour une bonne évolution de son activité et pour augmenter le niveau de stock de mèches, des produits de beauté que Rachelle sollicite un deuxième  crédit auprès d’ALIDé. Le premier crédit que Rachelle avait obtenu auprès de ALIDé a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
B. Rachelle was born on September 29, 1987 in Akpakpakanmè, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she has lived since birth.  She is married to HOUSSOU Martin, an architect by profession. Rachelle, who is illiterate, is the mother of one child not yet in school. The couple live together and jointly cover family expenses. 

For four years, Rachelle has been selling hair extensions and beauty products out of her home.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  To make the right changes in her business and to increase her stock of hair extensions and beauty products, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.  The first loan she had obtained from ALIDé was indeed repaid.

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and beauty products

loans.name: Hatou

texts.fr: Monsieur Hatou D. est un jeune homme de 32 ans. Il habite dans la localité de Yoff. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il exerce la profession de receveur dans le transport urbain des minibus. Il évolue dans ce secteur d’activité depuis 2009, suite à la recommandation de son frère. Son but est de gagner sa vie pour pouvoir faire face à ses besoins sociaux. Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2008. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un réfrigérateur. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Hatou D. is a young man, aged 32, who lives in the town of Yoff.  He is unmarried and without children.  By profession, he works as a conductor in the mini-bus transport sector, in which he has worked since 2009 following his brother's recommendation.   He goal is to earn a living in order to meet the societal needs he faces.  

Hatou has been a member of the Yoff branch since July 2008.  He is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for buying a refrigerator.  It is for improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Buying a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Perfume and underwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying damask cloth

loans.name: Maria Del Rocio

texts.es:
María de 36 años, vende plásticos y zapatillas (en la foto aparece con el esposo), vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Desde pequeña a ella le gusto ser independiente y tener su propio dinero, al momento de tener sus hijos comenzó a vender zapatillas y artículos plásticos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm de lunes a sábado, promocionando las zapatillas y artículos de plástico ayudo a su esposo para que tenga su propio loca de plásticos. cada zapatilla la vende a $ 6.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar zapatillas y plásticos para tener mas variedad en su negocio. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
36-year old María sells plastic items and footwear. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She lives in Primavera de Duran, a suburban area with a deteriorating ecosystem on the outskirts of Guayaquil.

Ever since she was a child, María has enjoyed being independent and having money of her own. As soon as she had children, she started selling footwear and plastic merchandise. She works from 8am to 4pm Mondays to Saturdays selling her wares. She also helped her husband get his own stall selling plastic items. Each pair of shoes costs $6.00.

With the loan María wants to buy more footwear and plastic merchandise so she can offer a greater variety of products. Her goal is to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy plastic items and footwear

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: kodjo est un homme marié, il est marié et père de 4 enfants. il a ouvert son propre garage auto en 2000. Pour accroître ses revenus il s'est lancé dans le commerce de pièces détachées de  véhicules. il s'approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de Lomé. le stock de pièces détachées est épuisé, il veut s'approvisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers pièces détachées
texts.en: Kodjo is a married man and the father of four children.  He opened his own automobile garage in 2000. To increase his revenues, he got started in the commerce of spare parts for vehicles.  He gets his supplies at the local market at the Autonomous Port of Lomé.  Kodjo's stock of parts is exhausted.  He wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying a variety of spare parts.

loans.use: Buying spare parts

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre  Kuña Guapa, se conformo en fecha 24 de agosto del 2009 en  de J. A. Saldivar, gracias a  la actual Directora de Finanzas la Sra. Francisca F. quien ya formó parte de otro grupo, que se desintegró por mal de pago de algunas compañeras, luego invitó a otras vecinas para conformar un nuevo grupo y  logró conformar un grupo,  actualmente se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto,  ya  en el 5º ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de tortas. 

Ella es una mujer muy activa y trabaja mucho por el bienestar de su familia y la de sus hijos y de esa forma se encuentra trabajando con pedidos de bocaditos pero especialmente de tortas para acontecimientos especiales. 

Por la calidad de sus productos ella cuenta con pedidos constante, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingrediente que ella utiliza para la elaboración de tortas.
texts.en:
This group of women called Kuña Guapa was formed on August 24, 2009 in the region of J. A. Saldivar with help from the Director of Finance Sra. Francisca F.. She had started another group which broke up as several members failed to make their loan repayments. Then she invited other neighbours to form a new group which has been working successfully. It is now in its fifth loan cycle, and everyone is getting on well and supporting each other.

One of the members is Sra. Maria who makes and sells cakes. She is an active woman who works hard to support her family. She takes orders for snacks, but more especially for cakes for special occasions. As the items she bakes are of high quality, she has a constant stream of orders. Maria is seeking a loan so she can buy more ingredients for the cakes.

loans.use: to buy cake ingredients

loans.name: Mujeres Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama MUJERES SIEMPRE ADELANTE, está ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo en el Valle de Mezquital. Ese lugar es conocido porque se cultiva  el Maíz, el Fríjol, el Trigo, la Cebada y la Alfalfa. Su clima es considerado extremoso por los cambios de temperatura que hay en el día. Es reconocido por su gastronomía;  la barbacoa de pollo, de borrego, las dobladitas y por sus tradicionales tostadas de ajonjolí con frijoles. 
El grupo está integrado por 9 personas. La Sra. Austrabertha M. ha vivido es esa localidad durante 40 años, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ya sea en las plazas o en un lugar establecido que tiene en la esquina de su casa, donde inicio hace 5 años. Ella estudió hasta la primaria, pero siempre ha tenido deseos de superación y trabajará para lograr tener un local establecido, en un futuro próximo.
texts.en:
This group is called MUJERES SIEMPRE ADELANTE ('women always moving forwards').  It is located in the state of Hidalgo in the Mezquital Valley.  This place is know for its cultivation of corn, beans, wheat, barley and alfalfa.  Its climate is considered to be extreme owing to the changes of temperature which it experiences during the day.  It is well known for its gastronomy; chicken and lamb barbeque, 'dobleditas' (a type of Chilean bread) and for its traditional tostadas with sesame seeds and beans.

This group has 9 members.  Mrs Austrabertha M. has lived in this town for 40 years.  She sells fruits and vegetables in markets and in the premises which she has set up in the corner of her house, where she began 5 years ago.  She completed her primary education but has always wanted to improve herself and she will work until she has an established premises, in the near future.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Lidia Oswalda

texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago the Patron Saint", located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, the province of Azángaro, and the department of Puno. She is 46 years old, and married with four children. She studied until the fifth year of her secondary school. 

Lidia has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. The first loan she got was for the amount of 300 PEN, and she used it to increase the capital in her business selling bread and photocopies. 

She is now asking for 2,000 PEN, money that she will use to buy merchandise for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital for her business. 

Lidia's favorite things about the Communal Bank are the punctuality,  the responsibility, and the earnings on her savings.

loans.use: Merchandise for her business selling bread and photocopies

loans.name: Luz Y Vida (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Luz y Vida esta formado por 8 mujeres y un hombre, quienes tienen diferentes ocupaciones y  día a día luchan en buscan de  un mejor futuro para sus familias. La  mayoría de  nuestras socias viven en el barrio del Aguacate que  pertenece  al sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica, su gastronomía, su gente y su cultura.

La Señora María S. vive en la comunidad de San Pedro que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle.  Esta reingresando a la banca comunal  y esta feliz de estar de nuevo con sus amigas.
Se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, pasa mucho tiempo en su hogar ya que esta al cuidado de tres nietos pero aprovecha el tiempo en casa para criar animales como chanchos, cuyes y gallinas.
Doña María tiene 44 años, es separada de su esposo, tiene 8 hijos de 28, 27, 25, 21, 17, 15, 14 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija es madre soltera pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos y de los animales, su segundo y tercera hija son casadas y viven independientes, sus hijos de 21, 17 y 14 años estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuela del sector, su hijo de 15 años se dedica a trabajar ya que no le gusta estudiar peeo ayuda  en la economía del hogar. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia en donde vive feliz y tranquila.
 
El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos. Su meta es  tener un negocio de venta de comida por el sector en donde vive.

La Señora Narcisa M. vive en el barrio el Aguacate que  pertenece a Monay. Nuestra socia tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 16 y 13 años de edad, sus tres hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo para brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro. 
La Señora Narcisa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos Yanbal. También vende ropa por catálogo,  esta actividad la viene realizando hace 4 años, vende recorriendo su barrio o a sus conocidas, trabaja mas en las tarde ya que en la mañana se dedica al cuidado de su casa. Se da tiempo para criar animales como cuyes y gallinas que son para su consumo o las vende cuando necesita algo de dinero.
Es el  sexto ciclo que realiza los créditos en la banca comunal y se encuentra feliz ya que forma parte de este grupo de mujeres muy trabajadoras.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como ropa para su clientela.
 
Su sueño es tener un vehiculo para poder trasladarse con mas facilidad.
texts.en:
The “Luz y Vida” (Light & Life) communal bank has nine members, 8 women and one man, who have different occupations and fight daily to attain better futures for their families.  Most of the members live in the Aguacate neighborhood which is part of Cuenca’s Monay sector.  Cuenca is noted for its architectural beauty, its gastronomy, its people and its culture.

Mrs. María S. lives in San Pedro which is part of Valle parish.  She is reentering communal banking and is happy to be with her friends once again.  She is a housewife and spends much time at home because she cares for three grandchildren.  She uses her time at home, though, to raise pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.

María is 44 years old, separated from her husband and has 8 children who are 28, 27, 25, 21, 17, 14, and 9 years of age.  Her oldest daughter is a single mother and stays home caring for her children and for the animals.  Her second son and third daughter are married and live independently.  Her 21-, 17-, and 14-year-old sons are in secondary school and her last son goes to a local elementary school.  Her 15 year old son works because he doesn’t like to go to school but he helps with household expenses.  With her work she has managed to build her own house where she lives happily and at peace.

She will use the money from the new loan to buy pigs.  Her goal is to open a new business selling food in her neighborhood.

Mrs. Narcisa M. lives in the Aguacate neighborhood in Monay.  She is 36 years old, married and has three children who are 19, 16 and 13 years old.  Her three children are in school.  Her husband has emigrated seeking better employment in order to provide his family with a better future.

Narcisa sells Yanbal brand cosmetics.  She has also sold catalogue clothing for the last 4 years.  She sells door-to-door in her neighborhood and to her acquaintances.  She works more in the afternoon than in the morning because during the mornings she cares for her home.  She takes time to raise animals like guinea pigs and chickens for her own consumption or to sell when she needs a bit of cash.

This is the sixth loan cycle she’s participated in the communal bank and she’s happy to be part of this group of very hard working woman.  The money from the loan will be used to buy more merchandise, like clothes, for her customers.

Her dream is to have a vehicle in order to get around more easily.

loans.use: To buy pigs, clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Leandrina Martha

texts.en:
Leandrina is a member of the Communal Bank "Active Women II", located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, and department of Puno. She is 40 years old and married with three children (one of whom is independent). Leandrina has a primary school education. 

Leandrina has worked with Manuela Ramos for six months. Her prior request for a loan was for the amount of 500 PEN, used to increase the capital of her business selling handicrafts. 

She is now asking for a loan for 800 PEN, money that will be used to buy materials to create handicrafts to sell. Her dream is to expand her business and to have a sewing machine to do some of the work on. 

Her favorite part about working with the Communal Bank is chatting with the other members.

loans.use: Materials to manufacture handicrafts

loans.name: Mercy Maria

texts.es:
Mercy de 42 años, tiene una pequeña farmacia en un local lejano a su casa. Vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Desde pequeña Mercy estuvo relacionada con las medicinas ya que el papa es doctor, cuando creció y tubo a sus hijos decido tener su propio negocio. En la actualidad tiene una farmacia vende productos farmacéuticos, pañales, bebidas. Trabaja sola desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm. Tiene en la farmacia aspirinas desde $ 0.25 c/u, pañales a $ 0.40 c/u, jarabes a $ 4.50 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas para su farmacia y así tener mas variedad. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa propia y tener su farmacia en otro sector para obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Mercy is 42 years old, and she has a small pharmacy near her house. She lives in Primavera de Duran (an area located in the outskirts of Guayaquil).

From a young age, Mercy was familiar with medication since her father is a doctor. When she became an adult and had her children, she decided to start her own business. At present, she has a pharmacy, which sells medicines, diapers, and drinks. She works alone from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon. In the pharmacy, she sells aspirin for $0.25 per unit, diapers for $0.40 per unit, and syrup for $4.50.

With this loan, she wants to buy medicine for her pharmacy so that she has more variety in her store. In the future, she wants to finish building her house and move her pharmacy to another area to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Medicine

loans.name: Mayra Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este Lugar encontramos a la señora Mayra ella tiene 29 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de cuatro y tres años. Su marido es comerciante.

Tiene junto con su esposo un negocio de compra y venta de arroz, su forma de venta es por quintal o por saquillos de 25, 15 y  10 libras lo cual lo hacen en el local que tienen en su casa. Trabajan todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 19h00. El arroz lo compran en una piladora en la provincia del Guayas, nos cuenta que ya llevan 6 años con este negocio y que le ha ido muy bien ya que tienen clientes que todos los meses le compran ya que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas o cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz y aumentar su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos los dan sin muchos requisitos. Sus sueños son tener una tienda con todo y una distribuidora de arroz al por mayor.
texts.en:
The Damas de Progreso community bank meets in the San Cristóbal neighborhood of Portoviejo every two weeks.

Here we find Mayra who is 29 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband with whom she has two children aged 4 and 3.  Her husband is a merchant.

She and her husband have a business where they buy and sell rice.  They sell their rice by the 100 lb or in 25, 15 and 10 pound sacks.  They carry out their business from the premises which they have in their own home.  They work every day from 7.00am to 7.00pm.  They buy the rice from a rice husking mill in the province of El Guayas.  Mayra tells us that they have been in this business for 6 years and that they have done very well in it since they have customers who buy from them every month because they leave their goods on credit and collect payments every week or every two weeks.

This loan will be used to buy rice and increase their business.  Mayra has been a member of the community bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are given without too many conditions.  Her dreams are to own a store which stocks everything and a rice wholesalers.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Vital Rafael

texts.es:
Vital de 63 años, tiene un restaurante que su especialidad son los cangrejos. Vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Después que se jubilo decidió tener su propio restaurante para mantenerse económicamente estable. En la actualidad el trabaja con su esposa en el restaurante que le pusieron por nombre “Cangrejal” ya que sus mayores ventas son cangrejos y mariscos el trabaja con ayuda de su esposa desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h00pm. Los platos con cangrejos los adiciona con arroz, ensaladas y especies. 

Para seguir con el negocio y tener mas volumen de ventas el quiere comprar con el préstamo cangrejos. En el futuro quiere mejorar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vital is 63 years old and has a restaurant that specializes in crab. He lives in Primavera de Druan (an area in the outskirts of Guayaquil).

After he retired, he decided to start his own restaurant to maintain his financial well-being. At present, he works with his wife in the restaurant, which they called “Cangrejal” (a place where crabs gather), since most of their sales are crabs and seafood. He and his wife work from 8 in the morning until 11 at night. They add rice, vegetables, and spices to their crab dishes.

To continue with the business and have more sales, Vital wants to buy crabs with this loan. In the future, he wants to improve his house and grow his business.

loans.use: Crabs

loans.name: Katia Elena

texts.en:
Katia is a member of the Communal Bank "The Little Stars of Gold II", located in the district of Puno, province and department of the same name. She is 18 years old, single, and has no children. She completed her secondary school education. 

She has dedicated her attention to telephone booths. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. The first loan she got was for 500 PEN, money that was invested in her call center business. 

She is now asking for a loan of 700 PEN, money that will allow her to expand her call center business. Her dream is to continue with the same business but to expand it. 

Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the money she earns on her savings.

loans.use: Expand her phone call center

loans.name: Elizabeth Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

La señora Elizabeth esta en el Banco Comunal desde hace ya dos años y le agrada por la seriedad de sus compañeras del grupo además por los créditos que le ayudan  mucho. Tiene 20 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo de un año y ocho meses, vive en la casa de sus padres. Estudia  el quinto semestre de medicina en la Universidad Técnica de Manabí.

Se dedica al comercio vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas),  todos los días sale a recorrer con sus productos y también en su Universidad aprovecha para venderle  a sus compañeras de clases. Deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, nos cuenta que se inicio en este negocio hace dos años cuando estaba embarazada y por la necesidad de contar con sus propios recursos tanto para sus estudios como para los gastos de su pequeño hijo.

Este crédito es para pagar el pedido que tiene y además para ciertas cosas que necesita en su universidad. Sus metas son terminar su carrera y llegar a ser una gran médico cirujano.
texts.en:
The “Damas De Progreso” (Ladies of Progress) meets every two weeks in the San Cristóbal enclave of the city of Portoviejo.

Elizabeth has been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because of the seriousness of her fellow group members as well as for the loans that are of great help to her.  She is 20 years old and a single mother of a son who is a year and eight months old.  She lives in her parents’ house and is in the fifth semester of Medicine at Manabí Technical University.

She sells Yanbal brand products (beauty supplies, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She goes out daily to sell and also sells to her classmates at the university.  She sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She tells us that she started the business two years ago when she was pregnant and needed to have her own source of income to rely on both for her education and for her small son’s expenses.

This loan is to pay fror the order she has as well as for some things she needs for the university.  Her goals are to finish her studies and become a great Surgeon.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and pay educational expenses.

loans.name: Bella Clorinda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Bella, tiene 54 años de edad y desde hace varios años quedo sola porque el compañero de su vida falleció y la dejo para siempre nos dice con mucha tristeza. De ésta relación tuvo 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad pero su hija menor vive con ella y es quien le acompaña en su casa.
 
Se dedica al comercio vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja de lunes a viernes en las tardes, sale a recorrer con sus productos por la ciudad ya que tiene clientes cerca y lejos de donde ella vive, nos cuenta que realiza muchos pedidos todos los meses y que además aprovecha para comprar productos de oferta ya que estos después los vende a buen precio y le dan mejores ganancias.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos sobre todo los de oferta que son los que le dejan mejores ingresos. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya 10 ciclos y le gusta por las facilidades tanto para pagar como para conseguir los créditos. Sus sueños son poner un bazar en su casa y así vender en su local sin tener que salir de su casa.
texts.en:
The “Damas De Progreso” (Ladies of Progress) meets every two weeks in the San Cristóbal enclave of the city of Portoviejo.

Here we find Bella, 54.  She was left alone several years ago when her life companion died and left her forever, she tells us sadly.  The relationship produced four children, all adults now, but her youngest daughter lives with her and keeps her company at home.

She sells Yanbal brand products (beauty products, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works from Monday through Friday during the afternoon.  She goes out into the city to offer her products because she has customers that live both near and far.  She tells us that she takes several monthly orders and also takes advantage of the items that are on sale which she then resells at good prices producing better profits.

This loan is to buy her products, especially the ones on sale that produce better profits.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 cycles and she likes it because of the easy payment plans as well as the ease in obtaining loans.

Her dreams are to install a store in her home so that she can sell from home and not have to leave home to sell.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, perfumes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es:
En su sala de belleza donde ofrece los servicios de telecomunicaciones, internet, transcripciones y alquiler de luces y vende mercancía variada también, Sandra trabaja diariamente para apoyar el sostenimiento de su hogar, ubicado en el barrio los Robles de Soledad  y conformado por su cónyuge y su único hijo de 10 años.  Ella inició su negocio por la necesidad de aumentar sus ingresos y ayudando a su cuñada en la venta de minutos a celulares,  quien posteriormente  le facilitó un plan de minutos. Gradualmente y como Sandra conocía el oficio como manicurista y pedicurista empezó prestando estos  servicios  a domicilio, entre vecinos, familiares y amigos, y  con esta pequeña experiencia de negocio se dio a la búsqueda de una alternativa de trabajo en su propia casa, para no tener que salir y descuidar su hogar. Por eso agregó gradualmente a la venta de minutos, servicios de telecomunicaciones, impresión e internet   y transcripciones. Así se ha ido desenvolviendo este negocio  y la rotación del dinero ha sido notoria, aspecto que    entusiasmó a su cónyuge,  que la ha apoyado en este emprendimiento, que  en la actualidad muestra su crecimiento   en un numero de 7 planes de celulares, disminución del trabajado a domicilio y aumento de trabajo en su ahora sala de belleza. Los  servicios de belleza   le ofrecen un margen el de contribución del 95%  porque los insumos son de bajo costo, mientras que los planes de celulares  le representan un 75%. Como Sandra es una mujer que se proyecta, en la actualidad está estudiando corte de cabello para damas y caballeros y va a complementar su trabajo con este nuevo servicio, por lo cual requiere  nuevos accesorios   para ello, así que con su credikiva comprará un lava cabezas, una silla giratoria para peluquería, un espejo  y una pequeña vitrina.
Su sueño es tener en su peluquería muchos servicios que realcen la imagen de hombres, mujeres, niños y niñas y para esto se prepara día a día,  y en cada oportunidad que tiene de aprender, es capaz de ofrecer su conocimiento como un nuevo servicio al cliente,   con el cuidado de establecer unos precios   de introducción que llamen la atención de su  mercado.
texts.en:
Sandra has a beauty salon where she also offers telecommunications, Internet and transcription services, rents lights and sells a variety of goods.  Sandra works here every day to support her household.  She lives in the Robles de Soledad neighborhood together with her husband and her 10 year-old son.  She started her business because she needed to increase her income.  She started by helping her sister-in-law to sell cell phone minutes.  Her sister-in-law then gave her a cell phone plan.

Gradually, because Sandra knew the manicure and pedicure business, she began to offer these services in the homes of neighbors, family members and friends.  With this small business experience, she began to look for a job in her own home so that she didn't have to go out and neglect her household.  For this reason, she gradually began adding to her sale of cell phone minutes, offering telecommunications, printing, Internet and transcription services.  This business  developed and her financial turnover is notable which has excited her husband who has supported her in this undertaking.  The business currently shows growth.  She now has 7 cell phone plans.  She now works less in other people's homes and more in her beauty salon.  The beauty services offer her a contribution margin of 95% because the supplies are low cost.  The cell phone plans give her 75%.  As Sandra is a woman who plans ahead, she is currently studying men's and women's hairdressing and she will complement her work with this new service for which she needs new accessories.  With her Kiva loan she will buy a hair-washing sink, a swivel chair for her hairdressing salon, a mirror and a small display case.

Her dream is to have many services in her hairdressing salon which enhance the images of men, women, boys and girls.  She prepares herself day by day for this and with every opportunity which she has to learn, she is capable of offering her knowledge as a new service to her customers, being careful to establish introductory prices which draw the attention of her market.

loans.use: To buy a hair-washing sink, a swivel chair for her hair dressing salon, a mirror and a small display case

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre, Mujeres Emprendedoras se conformó en fecha 17 de mayo del 2.006, mediante las promociones que realizó la Asesora en la zona, y gracias a la actual Directora General se conformó el Comité, que se encuentra integrado hoy día por 20 mujeres y  siguen trabajando  con el mismo entusiasmo y esfuerzo,  ya se encuentra el 15º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo tienen un excelente comportamiento de pago, y el trato entre ellas es memorable, gracias a esto y a su trabajo solidario siguen  adelante incrementando sus ingresos y  trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Marciana quien se dedica al comercio minorista desde su casa donde ofrece mercaderías como productos de consumo familias, bebidas, artículos de mercería, librería y otros, su negocio es muy completo por lo que los clientes prefieren visitar su negocio.
Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con su negocio y con su grupo, comenta que ha desarrollado mucho su capacidad de trabajo, participación, responsabilidad ya que trabajan en grupo, y eso ayuda a la formación personal de cada señora.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa, como bebidas en general, aceites, yerba mate, enlatados, golosinas, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprdedoras” (Enterprising Women) Communal Bank was formed on the 17th of May in 2006.  The group formed through the promotions that the consultant made and thanks to the current general director.  Today the group is comprised of 20 women.  They continue working with the same enthusiasm and effort.  They are in their 15th cycle.  They work within the program as a cohesive and united group.

The group has excellent payment performance.  Thanks to the memorable way they treat each other and their supportive work they continue on increasing their income and working with the program.

Marciana is one of the members.  She is a small businesswoman.  She sells merchandise like goods for families and babies, notions, bookstore items, and other things.  Her business is replete, and that is why her customers prefer to shop in her business.

She is very satisfied with her business and with her group.  She says that she has greatly developed her capacity to work, participate, and be responsible.  This is because they work as a group, and that helps each woman with their personal development.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her store.  She will buy things like drinks, oil, tea, canned goods, sweets, and other items.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise, drinks, canned goods, oil, dairy products, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Venus Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

La señora Venus es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta el Banco por la seriedad y compromiso tanto de sus compañeras como de parte de la Fundación Espoir. Tiene 64 años de edad y está separada pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos  todos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos falleció hace ya algún tiempo.

Tiene un local donde prepara y vende hamburguesas, papas fritas, y otras comidas rápidas, además de jugos, batidos, colas y otras bebidas suaves. Trabaja todos los días desde las 18h00 hasta las 23h00, una persona trabaja con ella a la cual le paga un sueldo semanal.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos. Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante ya que eso es lo que a ella le gusta, preparar comida y dice que lo hace muy bien.
texts.en:
The “Damas De Progreso” (Ladies of Progress) meets every two weeks in the San Cristóbal enclave of the city of Portoviejo.

Venus is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes the bank because of the seriousness and commitment both of her fellow members and of Fundación Espoir.  She is 64 years old and is separated.  The relationship produced five children, all adults now; one of them died some time ago.

She has a stand where she makes hamburgers, fried potatoes and other fast food to sell as well as juices, smoothies, soft drinks and other non-alcoholic beverages.  She is open for business daily from 6-11pm.  She has an employee that helps her and she pays a monthly salary.

This loan is to buy ingredients for her meals.  Her dream is to have a great restaurant because this is what she likes: to prepare meals…and she says she prepares them quite well.

loans.use: To buy meat, bread, potatoes, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María Antonia es una señora entregada a su familia, es comerciante de mariscos, ella viaja al departamento de Cojutepeque a realizar sus ventas, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután donde vive  con sus hijos  algunos ya casados, dos de ellos aun  dependen de  los ingresos de doña María; todos forman una familia unida y trabajadora.
Otro de sus negocios  es  en la zafra de caña, para lo cual posee una rastra desde hace 3 años, que es la que le ayuda a realizar esta actividad, aunque cuando esta presenta problemas mecánicos, ella debe abandonar la venta de mariscos para buscar la mejor solución a esta situación. Actualmente  solicita un préstamo para la compra de mariscos y algunos repuestos para la  rastra, esta inversión le ayudara  a crecer con la venta y a mejorar las condiciones de la rastra.
 Ella aspira mejorar su negocio, a incrementar sus ingresos, y  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Antonia is a woman who is committed to her family.  She is a seafood vendor who travels to Cojutepeque department to sell her produce.  She lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department with her children, some of whom are already married but two of whom still depend on María's income.  They are a very united and hard-working family.

Another of María's businesses is harvesting sugar cane.  She has owned a harrow for 3 years which helps her with this work, although when the harrow has mechanical problems she must stop her seafood sales in order to sort the problem out.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy seafood and some spare parts for her harrow.  This investment will help her to increase her sales and improve the condition of her harrow.

She aspires to improve her business, increase her income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seafood

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, de 30 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 36 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. La actividad a la que Marisol se dedica es el cultivo de plátano y café. Es así que todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, comienza con el cuidado de sus chacras, ya que sabe que mientras más cuidadosa sea con sus cultivos, mejores productos obtendrá el momento de la cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de La merced, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marisol, 30, is a cheerful, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, José, 36, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better future.

Marisol is a banana and coffee farmer so very early, every day she tends to her fields because she knows that the more care she provides her crops the better her production will be at harvest time.

What she enjoys the most about her work is planting her fields, something she does with much patience.  She has been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport her products all the way to market in the city of La Merced which is where she sells them.  In time she hopes to buy more land to increase production.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and she knows that she must be punctual with her repayments if she wants to be able to obtain other loans in the future.  She is a responsible member of her communal bank which makes her highly respected by her fellow members.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for crop improvement.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: El Sr.  Nicolás es un cliente nuevo, pero su hijo ya saco varios créditos en la institución, la puntualidad y responsabilidad fue un factor común en los créditos de su hijo,  la  actividad que tiene el cliente es fotógrafo, el trabaja con un estudio fotográfico, el estudio agarra los contratos y le pasa al señor Nicolás,  los contratos que tiene el cliente son en fiestas, cumpleaños, matrimonios, y demás, el señor Nicolás es jubilado hace 26  años  de la empresa, después de su jubilación el se dedico a la fotografía por completo,  los equipos que tiene en su casa son variados desde la cámara mas antigua hasta la mas moderna, sus contratos son frecuentemente en la zona 16 de julio y ceja de el alto, el trabajo que realiza nuestro cliente es sacrificado porque el tiene amanecerse los fines de semana,  su trabajo comienza normalmente los fines de semana desde el día jueves hasta el día domingo, su esposa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa por mayor, ella los distribuye al interior,  el tiene hijos pero todos son mayores, el crédito será invertido en la compra de una cámara fotográfica digital.
texts.en: Nicolas is a new client, but his son has already taken a number of loans from Emprender and has been punctual and responsible in paying them back.  Nicolas works as a photographer; he works with a photographic studio.  The studio gets the contracts and passes them on to Nicolas.  The contracts that he gets are for parties, birthdays, weddings and other occasions.  Nicolas retired from a company 26 ago.  After he retired, he dedicated himself completely to photography.  He has a variety of equipment in his house, from his oldest to his most modern cameras.  His contracts are frequently in the "16 de Julio"  and "Ceja de El Alto" neighborhoods.  His work involves sacrifice, since he has to get up very early in the morning on the weekends.  Typically he works on the weekends, from Thursdays to Sundays.  His wife sells cosmetics and clothing at wholesale; she distributes to the interior of the country.  He has children, but they are all grown.  He will use this loan to invest in the purchase of a new digital camera.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power", located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 38 years old, and married with two children. She has a primary school education. 

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 PEN, and the money was used to buy products for her business selling bread and juice from quinoa (a local grain-like crop).

She is now asking for 2,000 PEN as a parallel loan, money that will be used to increase the capital of her business. Her dream is to grow her business and to let her children study.

Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is sharing her joy with her fellow bank members.

loans.use: Increase the capital for her business selling bread and quinoa

loans.name: Gloria Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

Es en este bello ligar donde conocimos a la señorita Gloria.  Ella vive en La Sequita con sus padres y hermano, es soltera y tiene 19 años. Es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos y está muy a gusto por la ayuda que ha recibido.
 
Se dedica al comercio vende productos de Avon (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios para damas, trabaja todos los días en las noches,  los sábados y domingos todo el día, deja sus productos  a crédito y cobra todas las semanas.  También trabaja en una empresa de pescado llamada Bilbosa, en la que realiza sus ventas a sus compañeras de trabajo.

Este nuevo crédito es para comprar los nuevos pedidos que tiene ya que una parte de su capital tuvo que utilizarlo en medicamentos para su papá que enfermo y ella tuvo que ayudarlo. Sus sueños son poder ayudar a sus padres y algún día tener algo mejor para su futuro.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish which is in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people devoted to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

In this beautiful place we got to know Gloria.  She lives in La Sequita with her parents and brother.  She is 19 years old and single.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for four cycles and is very pleased with the help she’s received.

She sells Avon products (beauty products, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every day at night and all day on weekends.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She also works for a fish processing plant, called Bilbosa, and she sells to her coworkers there.

This new loan is to buy the new orders she has because she had to use part of her capital to buy medicine for her father who got sick and she had to help him out.  Her dreams are to be able to help her parents and some day have something better for her future.

loans.use: To buy Avon brand creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a member of the Communal Bank “Heart of Jesus” located in the district of Juliaca in the province of San Román and the department of Puno. She is 30 years old and a single mother with three children. Her level of education is an incomplete higher education degree. 

Jacqueline has worked with Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for one year. Her first loan was for 500 PEN which she used to grow the capital of her business selling cellular phones. She is now asking for a loan of 800 PEN to buy more cellular phones to expand her business. 

Jacqueline’s dream for the future is to be a successful businesswoman who sells cellular phones. Her favorite thing about the Communal Bank is its punctuality.

loans.use: To buy cellular phones

loans.name: Ever Enrique E.

texts.es: Ever Mejía Z. tiene 22 años y vive en el municipio de Malambo, a 10 minutos de Barranquilla, allí tiene un taller y un pequeño almacén de venta de repuestos  para motocicletas. Su solicitud de crédito está encaminada a la compra de herramientas, una pulidora y un equipo de soldadura y repuestos; Ever emprendió su negocio  una vez murió su padre y recibió un dinero, que aprovechó, junto a  su experiencia familiar  para este fin, adicionándole gradualmente repuestos de segunda y   cuando consiguió un préstamo por parte de una amiga,  fue agregando repuestos nuevos.  Así logró aumentar su capital de trabajo, contratando dos mecánicos mas,  a los cuales les paga por porcentaje de servicio prestado. Actualmente tiene contratos para el mantenimiento y la reparación de motocicletas con microempresas del municipio donde vive,  e inició su vida crediticia  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para crecer de su mano con los procesos formativos y  de acompañamiento que esta organización brinda. Su gran sueño es consolidar su microempresa como una de las mejores en el sector y agregar actividades afines en su taller, que le permitan tener una larga cola de productos en su oferta y aumentar sus utilidades. Así mismo su gran desafío es trabajar con su poco capital por eso recurre a su credikiva.
texts.en:
Ever Mejía Z., 22, lives in Malambo, ten minutes from Barranquilla.  He has a motorcycle repair shop and small replacement parts store there.  His loan request is for the purchase of tools: a polisher, a welding set and replacement parts.

Ever started the business when his father died and he got some money that he used, together with his family experience, toward this end, gradually adding second hand replacement parts.  When he got a loan from a friend he added new replacement parts.

Thus he increased working capital and hired two additional mechanics that he pays a percentage of the service fees charged.  He currently has motorcycle repair and service contracts with micro businesses in the city where he resides.  He started his credit experience with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to grow hand in hand with the training processes and support this organization provides.

His great dream is to consolidate his micro business into one of the best in the sector and to add other related activities to his workshop that will allow him to have a wide selection of products on hand in order to increase profitability.  At the same time, his great challenge working with little capital so this is why he has called upon Kiva funds.

loans.use: To buy tools: a polisher, welding set and replacement parts to sell.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  “Azucenas”  se conforma por 16 socias y 2 socios, pertenecientes a la comuna de la Cisterna. Sus principales negocios son la venta de verdura, lencería, ropa nueva y usada; producción y venta de berlines, comida rápida y colaciones,  y  confección de  sábanas.
Rosa es la presidenta de este grupo y en la foto se encuentra sentada en 1º fila de izquierda a derecha.  Ella cocina y  vende productos de pastelería, como por ejemplo pasteles y kuchenes, 2 veces a la semana en una feria cerca de su casa. Por encargos hace tortas y otros productos, en su casa. Además vende helados artesanales con barquillos y, a lo que se suma la confección de ropa en su casa, todos los días de la semana. Finalmente, aprovechando su horno industrial, el cual compró con otros préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, hace y vende empanadas y a veces pollo asado. 
Con este préstamo comprará pollos para hacer asados, y para preparar platos de colaciones y venderlos en la feria.  Con los préstamos recibidos de FE además del horno industrial,  Rosa adquirió su hielera para sus helados y un refrigerador para la casa de su mamá donde vive con sus 2 hijos menores, de 13 y 7 años, quienes junto a su hijo mayor de 21 (quien está en un internado de rehabilitación de drogas) son su motivación para seguir adelante con su negocio. Rosa recibe solo una pequeña ayuda económica de parte del padre de uno de sus hijos.  Su sueño es tener una panadería, en donde pueda vender productos de pastelería,  pollos asados y sus helados, en una parte de su casa propia que le entregarán por subsidio a fines del próximo año. 
A Rosa le ha gustado mucho trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, por la buena atención que ha recibido de parte de su asesora y por la pronta entrega de sus préstamos. Además agradece la educación sobre la administración de su negocio. 
La Cisterna es una comuna de Santiago, ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la capital chilena, y comprendida totalmente dentro del área urbana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial.
texts.en:
The “Azucenas” communal bank is made up of 16 female and 2 male members, and they are from the town of Cisterna. Their main businesses are: the sale of vegetables, female undergarments, new and used clothing; the production and sale of pastries, fast foods, meals, and tailoring bed sheets. 
Rosa is the president of this group and in the photo she is seen sitting down in the first row from left to right. She cooks and sells bakery goods, like pastries and “kuchen” (pies), twice a week at a fair near her house. She makes made-to-order cakes and other products in her house. She also sells artisan ice cream on cones, and she tailors clothes in her house every day of the week. Finally, using her industrial oven that she bought with the other loans from Fondo Esperanza, she makes and sells empanadas (meat-filled pastries) and sometimes pollo asado (grilled chicken). 

With this loan she will buy chickens to make asados and to prepare meal plates to sell in the fair.
