With the loans she received from FE as well as from the industrial oven, Rosa acquired a freezer for her ice creams and a refrigerator for her mother’s house, where she lives with her two children ages 13 and 7. They, together with her 21 year old son (who is in a drug rehabilitation facility) are her motivations for pushing forward with her business. Rosa receives only a tiny bit of economic help from the father of one of her children. 

Her dream is to own a bakery where she can sell baked goods, grilled chicken and ice creams in a part of her own house that she will  get subsidized at the end of next year.

Rosa has very much enjoyed working with Fondo Esperanza, for the good attention she has received from the loan officer and for the quick disbursement of her loans. She also thanks the politeness of the administration of her business.

La Cisterna is a community in Santiago, located in the “centro-sur” (south central) sector of the Chilean capital, and inside of a completely urban zone. It is primarily a residential and commercial town.

loans.use: Chickens and other food goods.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Marcos trabaja desde hace dos años en la elaboración de ladrillo crudo, trabaja de manera independiente y su producto lo vende al que ofrece mayor precio  ya que el precio de ladrillo crudo varía según la época y el trata de buscar quien le pague el mejor precio. Su esposa le ayuda económicamente ya que ella también se dedica a elaborar colitas para matrimonio adornos para matrimonios. Tiene tres hijos quienes estudian en colegio fiscal. Solicita el crédito para comprar material par elaboración de ladrillos ya que estos incrementan su precio en época de lluvia razón por la que el desea almacenar dichos materiales, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Marcos has worked for two years making unburned bricks. He works independently and sells his bricks at wholesale price since the price of unburned brick varies by season and he tries to look for who will pay him the best price. His wife helps him financially making wedding dress trains and decorations. He has three children who are students at a public school.

Marcos is requesting the loan to purchase brick making material because they are more expensive during the rainy season and he wants to store the materials. He is a responsible and hardworking person and is very appreciative of the lending institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To purchase material for making unburned brick.

loans.name: Nelly Victoria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y está muy contenta por eso ya que gracias a los créditos que recibe de la Fundación ha podido mejorar su situación a través de su negocio. Tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y tiene 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, solo su hija menor vive con ella en su casa. Su marido trabaja en un taxi que es de su propiedad en Manta.

Es un ama de casa que para tener sus propios ingresos y ayudar con los gastos familiares decidió hace ya 5 años dedicarse a la venta de sabanas y edredones. Trabaja tres días a la semana  recorriendo con su mercadería, la misma que ofrece a sus conocidos o clientes nuevos que tengan referencia de los clientes que ya tiene, hace esto porque ella  deja a crédito y no quiere inconvenientes con los cobros, los mismos que realiza cada quince días. La mercadería la compra en Picoaza.

Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería ya que la que tiene es muy poca y necesita para los pedidos que tiene. Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish, part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people dedicated to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

Nelly has been a member of the communal bank since its inception and she is very happy because of that for it's thanks to the loans she gets from the Foundation that she’s been able to improve her situation through her business.  She is 53 years old, married and has 6 children who are all now adults. Only her youngest daughter still lives with her in her house.  Her husband drives a taxi that he owns in Manta.

She is a housewife who decided five years ago, in order to have her own source of income and help with family expenses, to start selling bed sheets and comforters.  She works three days a week taking her merchandise to her acquaintances or new customers that are recommended by current customers.  She does this because she sells on credit and she doesn’t want to have any problems at collection time which occur every two weeks. She buys her merchandise in Picoaza.

This loan is to buy more merchandise because she has very little left and needs it for the pending orders she has.  Her dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Maryori Del Rosio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Maryorie, tiene 39 años de edad, ella está casada y  tiene 6 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad aunque cinco de ellos viven con ella. Su marido es ebanista.

Su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería donde realizan trabajo a base de madera como muebles, sillas y camas pero en lo que se especializan es en la elaboración de muebles para maquinas de coser, este negocio lo mantiene desde hace 25 años en la misma parroquia y en su propia casa, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8 am hasta las 17h00. La madera la compra en un depósito de madera en Manta donde encuentra la madera que necesita para sus obras.

Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar madera en especial la de Laurel que es la que el utiliza en sus obras. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta ya que gracias a los créditos ha podido salir de muchas situaciones difíciles en su negocio y en su vida personal. Su sueño es tener un taller más grande e industrializado.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish, part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people dedicated to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

We find Maryorie here.  She is 39 years old, married and has 6 children.  Three of them are adults but five still live with her.  Her husband is a cabinet maker.

Her husband has a workshop where he makes all kinds of wood-based items like furniture, chairs and beds but his specialty is making furniture for sewing machines.  He has had this business for 25 years in the same parish and in his home.  He works from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 5pm. The wood is purchased from a wood deposit in Manta where he can find all the wood he needs for his jobs. This loan will be used to buy wood, specifically laurel, which is what he uses for his works.

She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because it’s been thanks to the loans that she’s been able to get out of difficult business and personal situations.  Her dream is to have a larger, industrialized workshop.

loans.use: To buy laurel wood.

loans.name: Juana De La Paz

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power" located in the district of Ilave in the province with the same name in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old and a single mother with one son. Her level of education is an incomplete higher education degree. 

Juana has worked with Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for four years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN which she used to increase the inventory of her seed buying and selling business. She purchased seeds for a variety of potatoes and beans. Juana brings her products to the region of Moquegua, in the province of Mariscal Nieto, during the planting season. During the rest of the year she is dedicated to the sale of “tuna” (fruit of the prickly pear cactus), apples, and groceries.  

Juana is currently asking for a loan of 3,000 PEN to continue investing in her seed buying and selling business. Her dream is to expand her business with her efforts. Juana’s favorite part of the Communal Bank is the ease with which she can gain access to loans.

loans.use: To buy seeds for seasonal business

loans.name: Reginaldo

texts.es: Reginaldo, de 35 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nely de 28 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Trabajando arduamente Reginaldo ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus plátanos y café, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. En adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de cítricos, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Reginaldo, 35, is an unassuming, hard working man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Nely, 28, and his three beloved children, who are the main motivating force in his life.

Working hard Reginaldo has managed to raise his crops.  Every morning he rises very early to water and care for his banana and coffee crops which he will subsequently sell in the city of La Merced which is where he gets the best prices for his products.

What he enjoys the most about his work is that he can enjoy the freedom that working in the green fields provides.  He has been in this line of work for 14 years and considers the most difficult part to be working the fields all day with little time left over for other activities.

In the future he hopes to modify his fields for citrus planting because they sell best during this season.

This is his 4th loan with MFP and he knows that the loan will help his business’ progress and development quite a bit.  He is, therefore, ready to repay his installments on time.  He is a responsible member of his communal bank which makes him highly respected.

He will use the requested 800 new soles to buy manure for his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure for crop improvement.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Valle Triunfo Group

texts.es: Emprendedoras del valle triunfo a si se llama este grupo D. mujeres luchadoras y optimistas para los negocios propios que tiene como fuente D. ingresos para ella y sus familias. Este grupo lleva ya formado 8 meses, es un grupo nuevo pero, D. muy buenas expectativas D. negocio, conformado por 8 integrantes, el cual todas con una historia en particular, tal es así el caso D. la señora Juana S. D. 40 años D. edad madre D. 3 hijos los cuales a un siguen en  el colegio. Ella se dedica todos los días a la venta D. salchipollos hace mas D. 2 años, el cual le ha generado ganancias para sustentar los gastos en el hogar a su vez también se dedica por las mañanas a la venta D. bebidas. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio. Como la señora Juana S., cada integrante del grupo tiene una historia en particular pero entre todas coinciden en el deseo y el esfuerzo D. salir siempre adelante por el bienestar D. ellas y sus familias.
texts.en: 'Emprendedores del Valle Triunfo' is the name of this group of women who are all fighters and optimistic for their own businesses which serve as a source of income for themselves and their families.  This group has been together for 8 months.  It is a new group but has very good business prospects.  The 8 members all have their own story.  This is the case of Mrs Juana S. who is 40 years old and mother to 3 children who are still in school.  She spends every day selling 'salchipollos' (a Peruvian fast food consisting of fries with shredded chicken hot dog and sauces).  She has been doing this for 2 years and it has provided her with the necessary income to cover her household expenses.  In the morning she also sells drinks.  Juana would like to spend her loan on the purchase of merchandise for her business.  Just like Mrs Juana S., every member of the group has their own story but they all share the desire and effort to get ahead for the well-being of themselves and their families.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Algela Yolanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

Aquí encontramos  a la señora Angela, ella tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos dos ya son mayores e independientes, sus tres hijos menores viven  con ella los mismos que estudian en colegio. Su marido se dedica a la albañilería.

Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que su tienda es pequeña pero que tiene de todo, ya son varios años que lleva con ella y dice que su tienda es su vida ya que en ella además de ganarse un dinero extra para el sustento de su familia también se distrae con sus amigas que llegan hasta su local. Su mercadería la compra en Manta y Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más productos para  su tienda. Nos cuenta que estuvo en el Banco pero se retiro y regreso hace dos ciclos, le gusta por las facilidades que brinda tanto para conseguir los créditos como también para  pagar las cuotas. Su sueño es tener salud que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people who are dedicated to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

We find Ángela, 42, here.  She is married and has five children.  Two are adult and independent and the three younger children, who are in school, live with her.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She has a small grocery store that’s open daily from 6am until 8pm.  She tells us that her store is small but stocks everything.  She’s been in business for several years now and she says that her store is her life because besides earning extra money for her family’s support there it’s also where she enjoys the company of her friends who come by.  She buys her merchandise in Manta and Portoviejo.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise for the store.  She tells us that she used to be in the communal bank but dropped out.  She returned to it two years ago and likes it because of the ease with which loans are obtained as well as the easy payment plans.  Her dream is to be in good health which is the most important thing.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, meat and foodstuffs in general.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arnaldo de 44 años y sus 4 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Teresa ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una de las principales productoras de plátano y café de la provincia de Chanchamayo, lugar hasta donde llegan sus compradores para obtener sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos de cultivo. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, está muy segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy puntual. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 40, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 44 year old husband, Arnaldo, and their four minor children.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

Teresa has worked with her father in cultivating the land since she was very small.  As the years passed she managed to buy her own fields.  Now she is one of the primary banana and coffee producers in the Chanchamayo province.  That is where her buyers come to get her crops.  

What she likes most about her work is taking care of her crops, which she does with much love.  She has been doing this work for 20 years.  She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the market.  It is very difficult to find trucks that want to take the heavy bags that contain her harvested crops.  In time she wishes to buy new land so that she will be able to increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very sure that she will be able to make all of her payments punctually because she has always been very punctual.  She is a very happy and supportive member of her communal bank.  She will use the 2,500 soles that she is requesting to buy natural and chemical fertilizers to improve production of her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve crop production

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Flor es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace 8 ciclos y está muy contenta por los créditos y por la ayuda que recibe por parte de la Fundación Espoir. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tuvo 4 hijos dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es agricultor.

Es un ama de casa que además hace varios años adecuo en su casa un local y puso una pequeña tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, como granos, aceite, detergentes, también vende por libras: pollo, pescado, carne y queso en cantidades más pequeñas al gusto de sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00. Sus productos los compra en Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para comprar todos sus productos para surtir más su tienda. Sus sueños son tener una tienda más grande y con más comodidades para darles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people who are dedicated to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

Flor has been a member of the communal bank for 8 cycles and she’s very happy because of the loans and the help received from Fundación Espoir.  She is 47 years old, married and has four children, two of whom still live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

She is a housewife but several years ago she set up a grocery store in a space she equipped in her home.  She sells basic need items like: grains, cooking oil, detergents.  She also sells chicken, meat and fish by the pound and cheese in smaller amounts according to her customers’ wishes.  She is open for business every day from 6am until 7pm.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo and some are delivered to her store.

This loan is to buy all her products to better stock her store.  Her dream is to have a larger store with more comforts in order to provide better customer service.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, grains, detergents, meat, chicken, fish, cheese and other basic need items.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “The Pink Women” located in the district of Ilave, the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. She has an education up to the fourth year of secondary school. 

Juana has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN which she used to increase the capital of her business fattening livestock such as bulls, sheep, and pigs. 

Juana is asking for a loan of 500 PEN to purchase of young livestock for fattening. Her dream is to continue her business and to have a tractor for agriculture. Juana’s favorite thing about working with Manuela Ramos is sharing happiness among bank members.

loans.use: To buy livestock for fattening

loans.name: Marcelina Sebastiana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Marcelina es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que da el Banco para conseguir los créditos, además por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tuvo 9 hijos, cinco de ellos viven con ella, los dos menores estudian en escuela. Su marido es ebanista.

Su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería  en su casa donde realizan muchos trabajos a base de madera como muebles, sillas y camas, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8 am hasta las 17h00. La madera la compra en un depósito de madera en Manta donde encuentra la madera que necesita para sus obras, realiza trabajos para personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento y también entrega en Portoviejo a un almacén.

Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus obras. Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos menores sean profesionales y tener un taller más grande e industrializado.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in La Sequita parish which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manta, filled with hard working people who are dedicated to and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

Marcelina, 47, is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the ease in getting loans as well as for the additional benefits the institution provides.  She is married and has 9 children, five of whom still live with her.  The two youngest are in school.  Her husband is a cabinet maker.

Her husband has a workshop at home where all kinds of wood-based items are made: furniture, chairs and beds.  He works from Monday through Saturday from 8am until 5pm.  He buys the wood at a lumber warehouse in Manta where he finds all the wood he needs for his jobs.  He does work for people who come by his establishment and also for a store Portoviejo.

This loan will be used to buy raw materials for his work.  Her dreams are to see her youngest children become professionals and to have a larger, industrialized workshop.

loans.use: To buy lumber, nails, adhesive, paint, etc.

loans.name: El Sol De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Un grupo D. mujeres  que con entusiasmo y mucha dedicación sale adelante cada día. Así son las integrantes D. la alcancía comunal El Sol D. Vitarte conformado por 9 socias, llevan la ardua tarea D. trabajar en sus negocios para poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Tal es así el caso D. la señora Sara O. D. 46 años D. edad  madre D. 5 hijos D. los cuales 3 aun están a su cuidado por ser menores D. edad y dependen D. ella para su educación, alimentos y vestimenta. La señora Sara O. cada día se dedica a la venta D. pollos brosters por las tardes y debes en cuando a la venta D. granos D. café y miel. Con los ingresos D. estos negocios a podido llevar adelante a su familia y pudo comprar un terreno en el cual más adelante comenzará a construir su casa propia. Con el presente préstamo implementara  la mercadería para sus ventas D.  pollos brosters. Como ella cada integrante tiene una historia en particular pero, si en algo coinciden es en el entusiasmo y las ganas D. salir adelante para el bien y mejoría económica D. sus negocios y familias.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank El Sol D. Vitarte are a group of women who approach each day with enthusiasm and dedication.  The group is comprised of 9 members who have the arduous task of working on their businesses to improve the quality of life for their families.  

Such is the case for Sara O., 46 years old, and mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are still under her care because they are young and depend on her for their education, food, and clothing.  Every day, Sara O. sells broasted-style chicken in the evenings and sometimes coffee beans and honey.  With revenue from these businesses she could support her family and was able to buy some land to later start building her own house. 

With the requested loan, Sara will improve the merchandise for her broasted-style chicken sales.  Every member of the group has a particular story, but they all share the enthusiasm and desire to succeed for the benefit and economic improvement of their businesses and families.

loans.use: To improve the merchandise for her broasted-style chicken business.

loans.name: Grover Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Grover es cliente antiguo que  trabaja como  jardinero en un hotel cinco estrellas de la ciudad de la paz, desde hace tiempo y en domicilios particulares donde hace mantenimiento de los jardines, vive en la casa de sus suegros con su esposa Ángela ella es enfermera, no tienen hijos ambos trabajan, el Sr.  Grover hace fumigados  para el mantenimiento de jardinería trabaja independientemente con los fumigados en domicilios particulares el esta vez solicita el crédito para implementar nuevas maquinarias  como ser la razón por la cual  solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en: Grover is a former client who has worked for some time as a gardener in a five-star hotel in the city of La Paz and also at private residences where he maintains people's yards.  He lives in his in-laws' house with his wife Ángela who is a nurse.  They do not have any children and both of them work.  Grover sprays yards to maintain them.  He works independently spraying the private residences.  He is requesting this Kiva loan to set up new machinery.

loans.use: Purchase of a pruning machine and other equipment

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: Zenón, de 35 años, es un hombre muy tranquilo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Zenón en su chacra, le han ayudado a mejorar su economía, es por eso que trabaja todo lo que puede, sembrando naranja y mandarina, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus plantaciones, ya que sabe que unos productos sanos se venden a mejor precio, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros de su poblado, ya que es ahí donde tiene sus sembríos. Para el futuro, espera mejorar sus chacras y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea entrar en mora y perjudicar a su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los mil setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará sustancias e insumos para cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos.
texts.en: Zenón, age 35 years, is a very tranquil and hard-working man.  He lives in his parent's house and what he wants most is to succeed in life.  The arduous days of work that Zeno has put in on his small farm have helped to improve his economy.  That is why he works all that he is able, sowing orange and tangerine plants, products that he will subsequently take to the market of the city of La Merced to sell.  What he most likes about his work is to take care of his plantations, since he knows that healthy products are sold at a better price.  He has carried out this activity for 17 years.  He thinks that the most difficult part of his work is to have to climb the steep hills of his land, since that is where his sown fields are located.  For the future, he hopes to improve his small farm and to sow all his lands completely.  This is his fourth loan with MFP and he is willing to make all his payments promptly, since he does not desire to default and to damage his communal bank, where he is very well liked for the order that he brings to the meetings.  With the thousand seven hundred new soles that he requests, he will buy substances and supplies to protect his sown fields from the plague of insects.

loans.use: To buy substances to protect his plants from the plague of insects

loans.name: Nancy Vicenta

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nancy ella tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, uno ya es mayor de edad y sus hijos menores estudian en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.

Su esposo tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, recorre con sus productos en un triciclo por las calles de Manta, dice que el realiza esta actividad desde que tenía 12 años y que se ha mantenido hasta la actualidad a pesar de que ha  habido temporadas bajas pero  igual  conseguía lo necesario para los gastos del hogar, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 3am hasta las 16h00, los productos los compra en el mercado de Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas y legumbres para su negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda el Banco. Su sueño es tener un local en su casa.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the prosperous Montecristi canton, full of dedicated, hard-working people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are honest people who only know to work and to care for their families.  

In this place we find Señora Nancy.  She is 41 years of age, married with 5 children.  One of her children is already grown.  The others study at the secondary school.  Her husband is a businessman.   

Her husband has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  He travels with his products on a tricycle through the streets of Manta.  He says that he has carried out this activity since he was 12 years of age and has maintained the business until now, despite bad times, to earn what he needs for the household expenses.  He works from Monday to Friday from 3AM to 4PM.  He buys his products in the market of Portoviejo. 

This loan is to buy more fruits and vegetables for their business.  She is a founding associate of the communal bank and likes the benefits that the bank offers.  Her dream is to have a place to sell from at her house.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.en:
Jacoba is a member of the Communal Bank "Heart of Jesus", located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 55 years old and a widow with nine children (all of whom are independent). She studied through the third year of primary school. 

Jacoba has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for the amount of 500 PEN, and the money was used to increase the capital in her business selling livestock. She is now asking for a loan for 1,300 PEN, money that will be used to buy more animals. 

Her dream is to have her own house. Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the ease of the loan.

loans.use: The purchase of more animals for her business selling livestock

loans.name: Nila Genny

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Nila es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que da el Banco para realizar los pagos  y por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene  tres hijos ya todos son mayares de edad, dos de ellos viven aun con ella y uno de sus hijos sufre de ataques de epilepsia. Su marido trabaja en Guayaquil.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, recorre con sus productos los mismos que entrega casi todos bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación, trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días o los fines de semana de acuerdo a como lo deseen sus clientes, su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil, aprovecha los viajes de su esposo para ir a comprar por lo general los fines de mes.

Este crédito es para ir a comprar su mercadería a Guayaquil ya que tiene algunos pedidos. Sus sueños son ver que su hijo se recupere de su enfermedad y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the prosperous Montecristi canton, full of dedicated, hard-working people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people that only know to work and to be dedicated their families.  

Señora Nila is a founding associate of the Communal Bank and she likes the facilities that the Bank offers to make payments and the fringe benefits that the institution offers.  She is 43 years of age, married and has three children who are already grown.  Two of them still live with her and one of her children suffers from attacks of epilepsy.  Her husband works in Guayaquil.  

She is dedicated to commerce.  She sells clothes of all types.  She travels through the area with her products, which she delivers mostly to fill orders eagerly anticipated by her clients. She works four days per week, accepting credit and charging every fifteen days or weekend according to the preference of her clients.  She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil, taking advantage of the trips her husband makes to go and buy - generally at the end of the month.  

This loan will be used to buy merchandise in Guayaquil since she has some orders.  Her dreams are to see her son recover from his illness and to continue working.

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Sonia Esther

texts.es:
Sonia  P. M. Inició un negocio hace seis años en el barrio Concord de Malambo, un municipio a 10 minutos de Barranquilla,donde vive y tiwen dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 24 años. Ella empezó vendiendo pintura para telas  e insumos para la  fabricación de muñecos y   enseñaba a fabricar estos productos, de ahí se deriva su permanente clientela y  el  logró de Sonia de haberlo convertido en  un punto de venta reconocido; como ella es una mujer sabia, que todo lo aprende y todo  lo enseña, se capacitó en artesanías en foamy y en fabricación de sandalias a través del Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “SENA”  y hace 4 años empezó a vender los insumos de estos mismos productos, aprovechando que muchas personas se capacitaron y  emprendieron microempresas de fabricación de estas artesanías, lo cual le ha asegurado un mercado permanente.  
Actualmente Sonia  vive con su hijo menor,  a quien le está pagando estudios de Psicología gracias su trabajo en la microempresa, donde vende lo que fabrica y también las materias primas, los materiales e insumos de muchas artesanías que ella también practica. En la actualidad está solicitando un credikiva para comprar forros para plantilla, galones de pegante, plataformas, hilos, botones, telas, foamy  y escarcha, preparándose para en el mes de Diciembre fabricar calzado y adornos navideños, arte que también conoce perfectamente. Ella espera   incrementar sus ventas en un 30%   ya que en esta época del año se aumenta considerablemente clientes que piden estos artículos y por otro lado  la producción de calzado y de artículos navideños también se incrementa en las microempresas dedicadas a estas actividades, las cuales  finalmente compran donde Sonia los insumos para su producción.
Sonia está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 2 años y este es su segundo financiamiento y con el primero logró aumentar un poco su capital de trabajo y acceder a nuevos clientes. Su desafío mas grande ocurrió el año anterior cuando hubo disminución en sus ventas pero logró adicionar nuevas líneas de productos y así ha logrado sostener   su negocio. Entre sus logros está la compra reciente de su vivienda en este mismo barrio y sueña con adecuarla, teniendo en cuenta  definir un espacio locativo, para que su negocio funcione en su propia casa y poder trasladarse tan pronto como le sea posible.  Sonia tiene una meta, que es la que mas  estimula   su trabajo en la microempresa, y es la de   ver a su hijo siendo un profesional de la psicología muy exitoso.
texts.en: Sonia  P. M. started a business six years ago in the Concord of Malambo neighborhood, a municipality 10 minutes from Barranquilla, where she lives with her two children, ages 19 and 24 years.  She began selling fabric paints and supplies for the production of dummies and she taught people how to manufacture these products.  From there her permanent clientele grew and Sonia achieved the goal of becoming a recognized point of sale.  She is a wise woman   who learns and teaches everything she can.  She is qualified in foam crafts and in the production of sandals through the National Learning Service "SEINE".  Four years ago she began to sell the supplies for these same products, taking advantage of the fact that many people who were qualified in the skills undertook micro-businesses producing these crafts.  This has assured her a permanent market.  At present Sonia lives with her youngest son.  She is paying for his studies in Psychology thanks to her work in the micro-business, where she sells what she manufactures and also the commodities, materials and supplies of many crafts that she also practices.  Currently she is requesting a loan to buy linings for templates, gallons of glue, platforms, thread, buttons, fabrics, foam and glitter, in order to be prepared for the month of December to make footwear and Christmas decorations, an art that she also knows perfectly.  She expects to increase her sales by 30% since at this time of year the number of clients asking for these articles grows considerably.  On the other hand the production of footwear and of Christmas articles by other micro-businesses dedicated to these activities also increases, and they buy the supplies for their production from Sonia.  Sonia joined the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation 2 years ago and this is her second loan.  With the first one she managed to enlarge her working capital a little and to add new clients.  Her greatest challenge the previous year occurred when there was a decrease in her sales but she managed to add new product lines and thus has managed to maintain her business.  Among her achievements is the recent purchase of her dwelling in this same neighborhood.  She dreams of adapting it, keeping in mind to define a working space, so that her business can function in her own house and she will be able to get to work as quickly as possible.  Sonia has a goal, which is the thing that most drives her work in the micro-business, and it is that of seeing her son become a very successful psychology professional.

loans.use: to buy linings for templates, gallons of glue, platforms, thread, buttons, fabrics, foam padding and glitter.

loans.name: Mercedes María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar encontramos  a la señora Mercedes, ella tiene 62 años de edad, hace algunos años su querido esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuyo 13 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero tres de ellos viven aun en su casa, también vive con ella un nieto de diez años que es como su hijo porque lo crio desde pequeñito.

Se dedica a  la venta de ropa, vende bajo pedido o puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana en las mañanas y también entrega en su casa cualquier día que sus clientes lo deseen.  Entrega y deja a crédito, cobra cada fin de semana sea sábado o domingo. Su mercadería la compra en quito y Guayaquil ya que dos de sus hijos viven allá y le mandan la ropa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar mercadería sobre todo jeans de hombre y mujer. Está en el Banco Comunal 10 ciclos y le gusta ya que los créditos le ayudan mucho. Su deseo es ver que su nieto sea un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the prosperous Montecristi canton of the Manta region, full of dedicated, hard-working people who are proud of their roots. Sequita is a parish where the inhabitants are honest people who only know to work and to care for their families.

In this place we find Señora Mercedes.  She is 62 years of age.  Her dear husband passed on some years ago, but they had 13 children together who are now all grown.  Three of her children still live in her house, as well as a grandson ten years of age who is like her son because she raised him since he was tiny.  

She is dedicated to the sale of clothes.  She sells to order or door-to-door.  She works three days out of the week in the mornings and also delivers to their house any day that her clients desire it.  She delivers and accepts credit, charging each weekend on Saturday or Sunday.  She purchases her merchandise in Quito and Guayaquil, since two of her children live there and they send her the clothes.  This loan is to buy merchandise, above all jeans for men and women.  She has had 10 loans with the Communal Bank and she likes it since the loans help her a lot.  Her wish is to see her grandson grow to be an honest man.

loans.use: To buy clothing, especially mens and womens jeans.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 43 años, tiene un centro de llamadas en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales).

Hace 5 años empezó con el centro de cabinas telefónicas ya que sus hijas terminaron los estudios. El esposo trabaja en un expreso como chofer y con los ingresos del centro de llamadas ha podido agrandar el negocio. Ella trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Para surtir mas el negocio ella también vende papelería, cuadernos, plumas tiene una mini papelería. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería y tiempo aire para las llamadas. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio bien surtido para cubrir las expectativas de sus cliente y asi darle una buena vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María, 43, has a call center in the front part of her house. She lives in the Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area where the majority of inhabitants are small business owners). 

Five years ago she started with a hub of telephone booths since her daughters had finished their studies. Her husband works as a driver with an express taxi service and with the income from the call center has been been able to expand his business. She works from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. To additionally stock the business she also sells paper goods, notebooks and pens--she has a mini stationery shop. 

With the loan she wants to purchase stationery supplies and air time for calls. In the future she wants to have her business well stocked to meet her customers' expectations and thus give a good life to her family.

loans.use: Paper goods, air time for call booths

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene un pequeño bebe de un año y cuatro meses. Su esposo es ebanista.

Su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería  en su casa, donde realizan muchos trabajos a base de madera como muebles, sillas y camas, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8 am hasta las 17h00. Realiza trabajos para personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento y también entrega en Manta y Portoviejo en algunos  almacenes de esas ciudades. La madera la compra en un depósito de madera en Manta.

Este crédito lo van a emplear para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus obras. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya seis años y le gusta por los beneficios y créditos que realizan. Sus sueños son tener su casa bien construida y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in the Sequita parish. It belongs to Montecristi, a prosperous Manabitan canton full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish where the residents are honest people who only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.  

In this place, we find Maria. She is 24 years old, married and has a four and a half month old baby. Her husband is cabinetmaker. 

Her husband has a cabinetmaking workshop in their house where they do a lot of work in wood such as furniture, chairs and beds. She works Mondays through Saturdays from 8 am until 5 am. She does work for people from their establishment and also deliver to Manta and Portoviejo at some stores in those cities. She buys the wood at a lumberyard in Madera.  

This loan will be used to buy raw materials to do the work. She has been in the communal bank for six years and she likes the benefits and loans that they do. Her dreams are to have a well built house and to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Judith Saturnina

texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Communal Bank "Inka Wasi", located in the district of Puno, in the province and department of the same name. She is 34 years old, and in a common-law marriage with four children. Her level of education is an incomplete higher education degree. 

Judith has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 PEN, and the money allowed her to increase the capital of her business selling eye-glasses. She thanks the institution for the progress she has made in her business. 

She is now asking for a loan of 500 PEN, money which will be invested in her business selling glasses. Her dream is to open a new store that sells glasses, in addition to the business she already has. 

Her favorite thing about the Communal Bank is the responsibility.

loans.use: Invest in her business selling glasses

loans.name: Francisco Leonardo

texts.es:
Francisco de 49 años, es vendedor informal de toallas en los semáforos de Guayaquil (en la foto aparece con la esposa quien le ayuda). Vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Empezó como comerciante informal hace ya 20 años atrás por la falta de oportunidades el tubo que continuar esta actividad. En la actualidad recorre las calles, centro y semáforos de Guayaquil vendiendo toallas a las personas. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. Una de las dificultades de trabajar ha sido durante estos seis meses que lo operaron del apéndice y se le hace un poco incomodo caminar. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, hierro y arena para construir mejor su casa, en el futuro quiere construir el segundo piso de su casa y tener un local definido para las ventas de las toallas.
texts.en:
Francisco, age 49, sells towels at the traffic lights in Guayaquil. He appears in the photo above with his wife, who helps him. He lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil, in an area near the tidal estuary.

He started as a businessman in the informal sector 20 years ago, and because of a lack of other opportunities he has had to continue this way. At present he walks around the streets, centre and traffic lights selling towels to people. He works from 8am till 5pm every day.One difficulty in this line of work has been during these last six months since he had an operation on his appendix and it has been a little uncomfortable to walk. 

With the loan he wants to buy cement, corrugated metal sheeting and sand with which to improve his house. In the future he wants to build a second floor on the house and have a fixed location from which to sell the towels.

loans.use: Cement, sand, metal sheeting

loans.name: Idalia Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Idalia es socia del Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y está muy a gusto ya que nos cuenta que los créditos son muy fáciles de conseguir. Ella tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 10 hijos, 9 de ellos ya son mayores de edad, el ultimo tiene 16 años y estudia en colegio, siete de sus hijos que son solteros viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella y su esposo y con la ayuda de sus hijos siembran  todo tipo de legumbres, maíz, frutas como melón y sandias, trabajan de lunes a viernes desde  las 6h30 hasta las 12h00 y de13h00 hasta las 15h00 en el sembrío, pero tres días a la semana recorre en un triciclo con sus productos y otros que compra en el mercado de Portoviejo por las calles de Montecristi,  trabaja en esto los viernes, sábados y domingos desde las 5am hasta las 14h00.

Este crédito es para comprar la mitad en insumos agrícolas y productos para recorrer en su triciclo. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora community bank meets in La Sequita parish in Montecristi, in the prosperous Manabí province which is full of hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know how to work and take care of their families.

Idalia has been a member of the community bank from the beginning and she is very happy since she tells us that their loans are very easy to obtain.  She is 53 years old, married and, from this marriage, has 10 children.  9 of her children are grown up.  The youngest child is 16 years old and still at school.  Seven of her children are single and live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

Idalia and her husband, with the help of their children, sow all types of vegetables, corn and fruit such as melons and watermelons.  They work from Monday to Friday from 6.30am to 12.00pm and from 1.00pm to 3.00pm, sowing their fields..  Three days a week she travels around the streets of Montecristi in a three-wheeled carriage with their products and others which she buys in Portoviejo market.  She does this on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 5.00am to 2.00pm.

This loan will be used to buy half of the agricultural supplies and products which she sells from her vehicle.  Her dreams are to continue working and for herself and her family to be in good health.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.en:
María is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power", located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 66 years old, and married with six children. She studied until the second year of her secondary education.

She has a business selling wine, coca leaves, sponge cake, and other snacks. Her business is varied and dependent on the season. María has worked with Manuela Ramos for six years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and she used the money to invest in the business of selling bread, a business activity that she has previously engaged in, in addition to the ones just mentioned. 

She is now asking for a loan of 3,000 PEN, a loan that will allow her to buy merchandise for her business. Her dream is to continue with the same business, but to always improve it each time. 

Her favorite thing about the Communal Bank is sharing happiness as a group.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive sola en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener un mejor futuro. El puesto de comida de María es el más concurrido del mercado Asunción de la ciudad de Tarma, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar es por eso que lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 37 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola.  Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su restaurante y así tener más clientes. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas ollas y utensilios, ya que los que usaba se han deteriorado con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
María, 45, is a hardworking and responsible woman who lives alone in her parents’ home and what she most desires is to have a better future.  Maria’s food stand is the busiest in the Asunción market in the city of Tarma.  Every day her customers come by her stand to enjoy the delicious meals that she prepares.  She is a very skilled cook and the love of cooking was instilled in her from the time she was small, and she feels very happy to be able to work in this area. What she most likes about her work is to cook and she does this carefully.  She has been working as a cook for the last 37 years but what she finds the most difficult is seeing to the people who come into her restaurant.  This is because often she works alone.

With the passage of time she hopes to improve the facilities of the restaurant and thus have more customers.  This is her third loan with MFP. She hopes to be very punctual with the payments because she wants to have more loans.  In her communal bank Maria is a very active member.  With the three thousand new sols she is requesting, she will buy new pots and utensils, since the ones that she has been using have deteriorated with time.

loans.use: To buy pots and utensils to outfit her kitchen

loans.name: Genny Amparo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Genny tiene 44 años de edad,  está casada hace ya 20 años y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos, dos de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y están casados, cuatro de sus hijos viven con ella y los dos menores estudian en escuela. Su marido es comerciante y agricultor.

Ella junto a su esposo y su familia se dedican a las faenas del campo a sembrar frutas de ciclo corto como melón, sandias, pepinos; legumbres como habas, habichuelas, frejol, entre otras legumbres. Su esposo además se encarga de llevar los productos a Manta donde  recorre por las calles en un triciclo, además de sus productos también compra en el mercado de Manta más productos para llevar a vender, realiza esta actividad los días martes, jueves y sábados. Mientras su esposo realiza esta actividad ella y sus hijos se dedican al trabajo en los sembríos.

Este crédito es para comprar insumos agrícolas y productos para la venta. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque no piden requisitos para la entrega de créditos. Sus sueños son algún día tener una casa bien construida y tener una tiendita para atenderla ella.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in Sequita Parrish, which belongs to Montecristi, the prosperous Manabita Canton.  It is full of hardworking and dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is a Parrish whose inhabitants are honest people that primarily work and take care of their families.

Señora Genny is 44 years old.  She has been married for 20 years and has 6 children.  Two of her children are grown and married, four of her children live with her, and the youngest two are in school.  Her husband is a merchant and a farmer.

Señora Genny works alongside her husband and her family.  They make their living working in the fields planting short season fruits like melon, watermelons and cucumbers; and legumes likes broad beans, green beans and red beans, among others.  Her husband is in charge of bringing their produce to Manta, where he travels the streets on a three-wheeled cycle selling their products.  In addition to their products, they also makes purchases from the market in Manta to have more to sell.  They do this on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays.  While her husband is carrying out this aspect of their business, she and her children take care of the sown fields.

The purpose of this loan is to purchase agricultural supplies and products to sell.  Señora Genny has been a member of her communal bank since its inception, and she likes it because they don't have requirements for giving out the loans.  Her dream is to someday have a well-constructed house and to have a small store that she, herself, could run.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Marina Concepcion

texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago the Patron Saint", located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, province of Azángaro, department of Puno. She is 36 years old and in a common-law marriage with one child. She has a higher education degree. 

Marina has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital for her business selling cheese.  She is now asking for a new loan of 300 PEN, money that will be used to buy consumables for her cheese business. Her dream is to have more capital for her business. 

Marina's favorite things about the Communal Bank are the transparency, punctuality, and responsibility.

loans.use: The purchase of consumables for her business selling cheese

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank "The Pink Women", located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 72 years old and married with five children. She studied until the first year of primary school. 

Juana has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital for her business fattening small animals such as sheep, pigs, and chickens. 

She is now asking for a loan for 1,500 PEN, money that will be used to continue operating her business. Her dream is that her children can rely on a profitable and large business 

Her favorite thing about the Communal Bank meetings is the education sessions.

loans.use: Increase her business fattening small animals

loans.name: Deybis Abel

texts.es:
Deybis Zúñiga M. tiene 20 años  y es un tradicional bailarín de la danza afrocolombiana, perteneciente a un grupo importante de Barranquilla; él es un joven muy alegre  que vive en el barrio Las Flores y está dedicado  a dos actividades productivas:   por un lado compra cerdo en pie para vender su carne  y por otro lado ofrece el servicio de venta de minutos a través de diferentes operadores de celulares.  Hace cuatro años cuando su padre empezó a matar cerdos y vender su carne,   Deybis con sus ahorros se agregó a este negocio de su padre y consiguió clientes ubicadas en las empresas de la zona industrial  alrededor de su vivienda,  a los cuales  le propuso el producto y le vio de inmediato el resultado. El vende su carne y se la pagan cada 15 días y compra en un matadero muy reconocido. Algunas veces compra animales para el engorde en el mercado público, los cría durante 3 o 4 meses y luego los mata para vender su carne una vez se encuentran en las condiciones óptimas de crecimiento y engorde. Deybis es un joven muy alegre al que todos admiran por su carisma, y espíritu emprendedor   sus padres son los mayores impulsadores de su ´progreso en todas las áreas y lo ayudan mucho económicamente, para que invierta bien, toda las estrategias de ventas  las aprendió de sus padres, que son muy buenos negociantes; su madre es una buena cliente dela Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y es su mejor referencia.  Deybis  es muy activo,  terminó su bachillerato y aspira a continuar estudios superiores en la universidad, actualmente además de hacer negocios, se esta capacitando en mantenimiento y ensamble de computadores. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y espera comprar carne de cerdo al por mayor para vender a sus clientes que son amas de casa y/o microempresarias que preparan pasteles, hayacas y requieren este producto como insumo básico para la preparación de su comidas navideñas y de fin de año.
 Deybis a su edad tiene grandes sueños, como el de tener una academia de danzas organizar el negocio de cerdos con su familia y ayudarlos a fortalecer su negocio para salir adelante entre todos y poder ofrecer a su hijo de un año, un futuro prometedor.
Su mayor desafío lo encuentra algunas veces, en que  se ve afectado por los cambios de los precios de los productos, lo que hace que diariamente estudie sus proveedores e identifique quienes ofrecen el mejor precio y el mas saludable producto cárnico.
texts.en:
Deybis Zúñiga M. is 20 years old.  He is a traditional afro-columbian dancer and belongs to an important troupe from Barranquilla.  He is a very happy young man who lives in the Las Flores neighborhood and makes his living from two productive businesses.  On the one hand, he purchases live pigs to sell their meat, and on the other hand, he offers a service selling minutes from various cellular operators.  Four years ago, when his father began slaughtering pigs and selling their meat, Deybis used his savings to go into business with his father.  He found customers from the businesses in the industrial zone surrounding his home.  He offered them his services and immediately saw results.  He sells the meat and is paid every 2 weeks.  He purchases his meats in a very well known slaughter house.  Sometimes he purchases animals to fatten them for the public market.  He raises them for 3 or 4 months and then slaughters them once they have reached the optimum growth and girth for selling their meat.  Deybis is a young man whom everyone admires for his charisma and his enterprising spirit.  His parents have been the greatest driving force in his progress in all areas.  They give him a lot of financial advice so that he invests wisely.  He learned all his selling strategies from his parents, who are themselves very good business people.  His mother is a sound client of the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo communal bank and is his best reference.  Deybis is very active.  He finished high school and hopes to continue advanced studies at the university.  Currently, in addition to his businesses, he is training to fix and assemble computers.  This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it he plans to purchase wholesale pig meat to sell to his customers who are housewives and small business owners that prepare cakes and hayacas (a local dish of cornmeal, meat and vegetables wrapped in banana leaves).  They need his products as a basic supply in the preparation of Christmas and New Years foods.
Deybis has grand plans for a man his age, like opening a dance academy, organizing his family's pig business and helping his family to strengthen their business in order to rise above the competition.  He also wants to be able to offer his one-year old son a promising future. 
The greatest challenge he sometimes faces is that he is affected by the changes in product pricing.  This requires him to study the purveyors on a daily basis to identify who is offering the best price for the healthiest meat product.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale pig products to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Indaura Ismelda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Indaura ella tiene 56 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre que según ella es más que un matrimonio y del que ha tenido 8 hijos, 5 de sus hijos son mayores, con ella vive una hija de 21 años y el menor  de 16 años ambos estudian en un colegio a distancia en Manta. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella vende cosas de bazar en su casa, tiene un pequeño local donde sus clientes llegan a comprar las cosas que necesiten, trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta la noche ya que como su negocio está en su casa ella atiende a sus clientes a la hora que deseen. Además su marido vende frutas y legumbres en la ciudad de Manta, el trabaja tres días a la semana recorre con sus productos en un triciclo por las calles en Manta.los productos tanto para el bazar como las frutas y legumbres las compran en Portoviejo.

Este crédito la mitad es para el negocio de ella y la otra parte para el negocio de su esposo. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya 18 ciclos y le gusta por las facilidades y los beneficios que brinda la institución. Sus sueños son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in Sequita Parrish, which belongs to Montecristi in the prosperous Manabita Canton.  The area is full of hardworking and dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is a Parrish whose inhabitants are honest people who primarily work and take care of their families.

It is here that we find Señora Indaura.  She is 56 years old and is in a common-law marriage, which according to her is more than a marriage and from which she has had 8 children.  Five of her children are grown.  Her 21 year-old daughter and her youngest child, who is 16 years old, live with her and study at a school in Manta. Her husband is a merchant.

Señora Indaura sells a variety of items from her home.  She has a small shop where her customers come to purchase whatever they may need.  She works every day from 8am until nighttime.  Since her business is run out of her home, she can help people at whatever hour they choose to come.  In addition to this business, her husband sells fruits and vegetables in Manta.  He works three days a week traveling through the streets of Manta with his produce on a three-wheeled cycle.  They purchase the shop items as well as the fruits and vegetables in Portoviejo.

Half of this loan is for Señora Indaura's business, and the other half is for her husband's business.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 18 cycles, and she likes the payment terms and benefits that the institution offers.  Her dream is that her children complete their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase items for a small shop, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lili Elivira

texts.es: La señora Lili Elivira Q. G., tiene 55 años es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad que habitan en sus propios hogares con sus familias y trabajan todos por cuenta propia, ella se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos desde hace 40 años siendo este su principal actividad de supervivencia, pero un accidente le imposibilito el dedicarle el tiempo necesario para  hacer prosperar su negocio, fueron sus padres quienes la apoyaron hace años atrás con los recursos económicos para la compra de la mercadería, a raíz del accidente sus ventas han disminuido y por la poca demanda debido a su poco trabajo y fuerza para movilizarse es por esta razón que solicita u préstamo para la compra de mercadería que le admita instalar una tienda en su hogar y que la misma clientela llegue a su vivienda, esta inversión le favorecera estar en su hogar ofreciendo sus productos y vendiendo mas por el aumento en la oferta de los mismos.
texts.en: Mrs. Lili Elivira Q. G. is 55 years old and a single mother of three grown children, who live in their own homes with their families and have their own work.  She has been making a living selling clothes and shoes for the last 40 years.  This is the main activity that provides for her survival.  Due to an accident she has not been able to dedicate the appropriate time to make her business prosper.  Her parents have in the past provided the financial support for the purchase of merchandise.  Because of the accident her sales have diminished, a slowed demand due to her inability to to move and work.  She is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise which will allow her to open a store in her home and her customers will be able to come to her house.  This investment will allow her to be in her home selling her products and increasing her sales through the increase in her inventory.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Melania Aurora

texts.es: La señora Melania Aurora, tiene 38 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, un conocido lugar por los recursos precarios de sus habitantes y la alta delincuencia que habita y que amenaza a sus habitantes. La señora es casada y su esposo labora como conductor, ellos tienen 3 hijos, donde dos de ellos son casados y habitan en la Ciudad de Estelí, el pequeño depende económicamente de sus padres, la señora Melania se dedica a la costura y venta de Ropa, desde hace 4 años, antes ella laboraba en un zona Franca, y con su liquidación se compro su máquina de costura y comenzó a tener ordenes de trabajo y ahora tiene un pequeño taller, ella y su familia habitan en una humilde casa que con mucho esfuerzo de ella y su esposo han logrado edificar, ahora solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que termine la construcción de la parte trasera de su hogar, este préstamo le ofrecerá a ella y su hijo mejores condiciones de esparcimiento y una mayor seguridad de las pandillas, sobretodo que la edad de su hijo son vulnerables a unirse a estos grupos antisociales que perjudican sus sueños y metas personales y afectan a  las familias de estos, este crédito le dará tranquilidad a la señora M. y les servirá para un desarrollo socioeconómico más digno.
texts.en:
Melania Aurora is 38 years-old, married, and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua, a low-income area known for its high delinquency rates. Her husband works as a bus driver. They have three children, two of them married and living in Estelí City.

Melania bought a sewing machine when she worked at a free trade zone, and for the past four years has been in the business of sewing and selling clothes from home. She lives with her husband and youngest son in a simple house that they worked hard to build. She will use her loan to buy construction material to finish building the back portion of her house, to create a safer place for her son to play in, away from the influence of youth gangs. She says this will give her peace of mind and improve the level of their living and social conditions.

loans.use: To build the back portion of her house

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa Maria M., tiene la edad de 42 años habita en el barrio Sabana Grande, es casada y su esposo labora en un taller como fresador, ellos tienen 2 hijos uno de ellos adolescente y el mayor que estudia la universidad, la señora se dedica a vender Ropa, Plásticos, y Recargas telefónicas, desde hace 11 años, sus ventas bajan según las temporadas, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de Plastico que favorezca el aumento en las ventas, ella ha observado que esta inversión tiene bastante demanda en su emrcaxdo meta, puesto que la situación del país no permite que la población compren piezas de vidrio o porcelana en los Centros Comerciales, a corto plazo brindara un mejor solvento en el gasto en el que se incurre en la universidad del hijo mayor, que es una necesidad para su formación académica adecuada de su desarrollo socioeconómico en beneficio de su futura familia.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Maria M. is 42 years old and lives in the Sabana Grande district. She is married and her husband works as a miller in a workshop. They have two children, one is a teenager and the elder one is at college studying. For the last 11 years, Señora M. has been selling clothing, plastic items and rechargeable phone cards. Her sales fluctuate with the seasons. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy plastic items, which  will allow her to increase her sales. She has noticed that this investment has an adequate market demand, since the country's situation does not allow people to buy glass or porcelain items in shopping centers. In the short term this will allow her to better afford her eldest child's university expenses, which are necessary to provide him with academic training suitable for his socioeconomic development and for the benefit of his future family.

loans.use: To buy plastic items

loans.name: Cristóbal Evaristo

texts.es: EL señor Cristóbal Evaristo M. A., tiene la edad de 41 años, vive en el barrio Pablo Calero, es casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio, tienen 3 hijos adolecentes, que se dedican a sus estudios en secundaria, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 15 años, fue gracias al apoyo de su papá que aprendió las actividades de la siembra, durante estos años se ha visto con muchos problemas de afectación de plagas, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para erradicar esta dificultad que disminuye la producción de sus siembras, el crédito será utilizado para la compra de insumos vegetativos y fertilizantes, brindándoles los recursos necesarios para solventar los gastos en que se incurrirá el próximo año debido a que su hijo mayor entrara a la universidad.
texts.en: Mr. Cristobal is 41 years old and lives in the community of Pablo Calero. He is married and his wife is a businesswoman. They have three adolescent children that are in secondary school. They have been farmers for the past fifteen years. Thanks to the support of his father, he learned agriculture. During these years he has faced many problems such as diseases of his plants. It is for this reason that he is asking for a loan. He wishes to eradicate this problem that has reduced the amount of plants that he grows. This loan will be used to buy vegetable products and fertilizers. These are the resources he needs in order to meet the costs that will arise next year when his oldest child goes to university.

loans.use: Maintaining the health of his plants.

loans.name: Diana Elisa

texts.es: La señora Diana Elisa P. P.,  tiene 32 años vive en el Barrio San Pedro, es casada y su esposo labora como albañil, aportando con sus ingresos a los gastos que se incurren mensualmente, ella es comerciante de frutas y verduras, en los últimos meses el alza de los precios han afectado los pedidos y por ende las ventas han disminuido, ellos habitan en una humilde casita, tienen 3 hijos menores de edad, es para ellos una necesidad mejorar sus niveles y condiciones de vida, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de frutas y verduras que favorezcan a las ventas y a futuro los recursos económicos para la remodelación de su vivienda, que se vio deteriorada con este invierno por el pasos de las tormentas, que afectaron al país.
texts.en: Mrs. Diana Elisa is 32 years old. She lives in the community of San Pedro. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer. In order to contribute income towards their monthly household expenses, Diana Elisa works as a fruit and vegetable vendor. In the last few months, the price increases have affected sales. Her sales have decreased. They live in a simple house and have three young children. It is because of the children that they need to improve their level and conditions in life. It is for this reason that they are asking for a loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables that are popular with their customers. In the future they would like the to have resources to use to remodel their house that is deteriorating. This past winter there were many storms that affected the country.

loans.use: She will buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Ángel

texts.es: El señor Jose Ángel S., tiene la edad de 34 años es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos del hogar, ellos tienen un hijo pequeño de 6 años que estudia el preescolar, él labora como guarda de seguridad, desde hace mas de 10 años, habitan en un humilde barrio y su vivienda está en deterioro, por las inundaciones que dejo la temporada de invierno,  siendo esta la razón principal del préstamo para la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera de su hogar, el préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan llevar a  cabo estas mejoras y favorezcan en la forma de habitar y seguridad de la familia para su mejor desarrollo socioeconómico.
