texts.en: Mr. Jose Angel is 34 years old, married and his wife is a housewife. The have a small son that is six years old. He goes to preschool. Jose Angel has worked as a security guard for the past ten years. He and his family live in a modest community. His house is falling down, caused by the floods that occurred this past winter. He is asking for this loan in order to build a wall at the back of his house. The loan will be used to buy construction materials, which will allow him to finish these improvements. The social and economic security of his family will be improved.

loans.use: He will build a wall for his house.

loans.name: Claribel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Claribel de 55 años, tiene 4 hijos , dos mayores de edad que han formado su propio hogar  y 2 que aun dependen economicamente de ella de 17 y 15 años actualmente los dos estudian, ella labora como docente en la Escuela Cèsar Augusto Salinas Pinell desde hace 28 años los Sabados y los domingos y los dias de semana labora como Bibliotecaria en la Alcaldia de Nueva Guinea desde hace 6 años, de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para el sustento de su familia que a pesar que es madre soltera ha luchado para que a sus hijos no les falte lo basico en el hogar.    

Es segunda ocación que obtiene financiamiento mediante  Kiva, esta vez para terminar de construir la cocina que empezó con el financiamiento anterior.  

Su sueño es ir poco a poco mejorando la infraestructura de la vivienda y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios , para que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Claribel is 55 years old and has 4 children. Two of them are adults who have formed their own households, and two, aged 15 and 17, attend school and still depend on her economically. Claribel has worked as a teacher at the Cèsar Augusto Salinas Pinell School for the past 28 years, on Saturdays and Sundays. On weekdays, she works as a librarian for the Municipality of Nueva Guinea. This work provides her with a monthly income to support her family. Although she is a single mother, she has worked hard to make sure that her children do not lack the basic necessities at home. 

This is the second time that she has obtained financing through Kiva. This time, it will be used to finish building the kitchen which she began with the previous loan. 

Her dream is to continue improving the infrastructure of her home, little by little, and to see her children finish their studies, so that they will be successful people.

loans.use: Building a kitchen

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa Q., vive en la zona D. Mallco Chapi – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento D. Cochabamba.

La señora Q. es una persona sencilla y humilD., casada y tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando en el colegio. 
Se dedica a la agricultura y la cría D. ganado vacuno con la ayuda D. su esposo y su hijo. Esto les permite tener ingresos para mantener a su familia.

En los últimos años a notado que sus ingresos han disminuido porque no ha podido alimentar adecuadamente a su ganado por no tener alimento suficiente para sus animales.

El motivo principal para que ocurra esto ha sido el cambio climático y escases D. agua en la zona donD. vive. 
Es por esta razón que ha solicitado un crédito para poder ser socia D. un pozo D. agua que le permita regar sus plantas incrementando su producción, alimentar a sus animales y D. esta manera tenga mayores ingresos para educar y vestir a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Nicolasa Q. lives in the Mallco Chapi – Sipe Sipe area, in the province of Quillacollo in Cochabamba region. 

Señora Q. lives simply and humbly, she is married anad has one son, who is studying in high school. She dedicates her time to farming and raising cattle, with the help of her husband and their son. This enables them to bring in enough income to sustain the family. 

In recent years she has noticed her income has been declining, because she has not been able to feed her cattle adequately. This is because she has not enough food for them.

The main reason this has happened has been the climate change and water shortages in the area where she lives. It is for this reason that she has asked for a loan: to be able to be a member of a communal well that will permit her to give her plants water, increase their productivity and feed her animals. In this way she will have better income with which to educate and clothe her family.

loans.use: To pay for the use of a well for irrigation

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El señor Gonzalo V. Q., vive en la zona de Mallco Rancho, provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.

Esta casado, tiene 3 hijos pequeños que todavía no van a la escuela. El es una persona sencilla, actualmente trabaja como albañil y su esposa se dedica a la cría de vacas. A pesar de tener un terreno donde podría dedicarse a la agricultura el ha decido buscar otro empleo por que no dispone de suficiente agua para regar su terreno. 
Las labores como albañil no es constante y cuando no tiene trabajo el Sr. V. ayuda a su esposa en la cría del ganado vacuno, para el cual necesita alimentos como alfa alfa y maíz los cuales compra porque no dispone de suficiente agua para producir sus propios alimentos.  

Es por esta razón que ha solicitado un crédito para poder ser socio de un pozo de agua que le permita regar sus plantas y como consecuencia producir lo suficiente para alimentar sus animales y pensar en un futuro hacer crecer su ganado. 
Esto le ayudara a mejorar su forma de vida, que su familia tenga alimentos suficientes para poder desarrollarse adecuadamente y también educar a sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Gonzalo V. Q., lives in the Mallco Rancho area, in the province of Quillacollo in Cochabamba region.

He is married and has 3 small children who are not yet at school. He lives simply, at the moment working as a bricklayer while his wife dedicates her time to raising cattle. Although they have a plot of land where he could dedicate his time to farming, Señor V. decided to seek other employment because he hasn't enough water to irrigate his land. 

The bricklaying work is not constant, and when he doesn't have work, Señor V. helps his wife in raising cattle. For this he needs feed such as alfalfa and maize - which have to be bought because there is insufficient water to produce their own feed.

It is for this reason that he has asked for a loan: to be able to be a member of a communal well that will permit him to irrigate his plants, and in consequence to produce enough to feed their animals - and in future to increase the size of the herd. 

This will help him to improve his quality of life. He wants his family to have plenty of food and for his children to be educated.

loans.use: To pay for the use of a well, for irrigation

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama SANTISIMA TRINIDAD se encuentra ubicado en Puebla México. El grupo está conformado  por 11 personas. La foto fue tomada en la casa de la Sra. María M. D. integrante del grupo. En la foto podemos observar un triciclo, medio de desplazamiento que utiliza para la venta de su nieve o helado. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, no estudió y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nieve. En total tiene 3 hijos varones. Lleva 18 años dedicándose a la venta de nieve. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en las materias primas que ocupa, así como en la fruta de temporada, sus clientes la prefieren porque su elaboración de nieve o helado es  100% natural. Al momento de solicitar este crédito se siente muy contenta al igual que sus clientes que son los niños. También espera vender en otras comunidades cercanas.
texts.en: This group is named Santisima Trinidad (Holy Trinity) and is located in Puebla, Mexico.  This group is made up of 11 persons.  The picture was taken in the home of Mrs. María M. D., a member of the group.  We can see in the photograph the three wheeled vehicle that she uses in the sale of shaved ice and ice cream.  She is 36 years old, has not gone to school and makes a living producing and selling shaved ice.  She has 3 sons.  She has been in the sale of shaved ice for 18 years.  She is requesting a loan to invest in raw materials, such as seasonal fruit.  Her customers favor her because her ices and ice creams are 100% natural.  At the time of the loan request she is feeling very happy as do her customers who are children.  She also plans to sell in other nearby communities.

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Rosa Onelia

texts.en:
Rosa lives with her parents in the village of San Sebastian in the district of Morrope.  She is twenty-three years old and has no children.  She is a new client with Edpyme Alternativa although she has worked with other financial institutions in the area in the past.

Rosa sells beauty products from the lines Esika and Unique.  She sells her products both via requests and on credit, a method which allows her to offer her products to a greater range of customers.  Rosa manages a small stock of products and has a good following among her clientele.  Rosa also works in a restaurant in the area, in order to maintain a more stable income.

With her first loan from Edpyme, Rosa plans to purchase additional beauty products in order to expand her stock and provide greater selection to her clientele.  She hopes to be able to earn additional income for her future education and to further provide for her family.

loans.use: Purchase additional beauty products

location.town: Anexo San Sebastián - Centro Poblado Romero - Morr

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie G. is a married woman who lives in Purok Punao, Brgy. Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Food Vending and tricycle (motorcycle with trailer) transport businesses. Her husband Alberto, who is 48 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 8 and 20 years old. 

Rosalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use for maintenance of her tricycle  so that she can continue to save up for future education of their children and improvement of her business. Rosalie G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her food vending

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine R. is from Malabor, Tibiao Antique, Philippines. She is 21 years old, married to Rico R. and they are blessed with one child, Gerica.

The couple did not finish their studies because they lacked financial and moral support from their parents. Instead they are already used to working at a very young age and their education has been set aside. Since they are elementary graduates, job opportunities are very few for them; they find difficulty in seeking a job. 

Geraldine now realizes the importance of education and that is why they are really striving in order to earn an income and savings for the future of their children.

In 2009, she joined ASHI because she believes that this institution could help them realize their dreams. She maintains her good performance in ASHI because she wants to access more capital so that she will also have a bigger income.

She is requesting Php 9,000 for her second loan. This amount will be utilized as additional capital for her business buying and selling fruit and dried fish. The income that they will get from this business is a great help to the family to cover their basic needs.

Finally, Geraldine is very thankful to ASHI and to those people who give her opportunities despite her educational problems and living conditions. According to her, she will do her best in order to improve her business so that the funders and the institution will not regret putting their trust in her.

loans.use: Fruit, Vegetable and Dried Fish Vending

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil casada con tres hijos, tiene grado de instrucción de primaria completa.
Rosalía, viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro  años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de s/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  con el cual pudo invertir en la compra de insumos para preparar el delicioso jugo de Quinua que vende.
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar insumos para preparar su juguito.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes además de su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son los ahorros y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of the “Gran Poder” ("Great Power") communal bank, located in the Ilave district in the province of El Collao, in Puno region. She is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She completed primary school. 

Rosalía has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement [the field partner] for four years. Her first loan was of 500 Soles, which she was able to invest buying ingredients for the delicious Quinua juice [a local soft drink], that she prepares and sells.

She is now seeking a loan of 800 Soles, money which will enable her to buy ingredients to prepare more juice. Her dream is to have a grocery store as well as her current business. What she likes about the communal bank is the ability to save up, and the earnings she can bring in.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making quinua juice

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”, ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 03 hijos, la señora estudio hasta 4to de educación secundaria.

Marleny viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años,  con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le sirvió para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio venta de carne, chuño y quinua.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar carne, chuño, quinua y queso para su negocio.

Su sueño es poder ayudar a sus hijos a ser profesionales, tener más capital para su negocio y poder tener una casa en Arequipa.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión, el seguro de vida y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Marleny is a member of the "Santiago Patrón" communal bank, located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, in the province of Azángaro, in Puno region. She is 30 years old, and married with 3 children. She studied until the 4th year of secondary school.

Marleny has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement (the field partner) for 2 years. She has previously had a loan of 500 Soles - money which served to increase her capital in her business selling meat, dried potatoes and quinoa.

She is seeking a new loan of 1000 Soles, which will enable her to buy meat, dried potatoes, quinoa and cheese for her business. Her dream is to help her children grow up to be professionals, to have more capital for her business, and to be able to have a house in Arequipa.

What she likes most about the communal bank is the solidarity, the security, and the fact that what the members earn they can save.

loans.use: To buy meat, dried potatoes, quinoa and cheese for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas II”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca, provincia San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y no tiene  hijos, tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa.

Martha es una socia nueva que solicitará un primer préstamo de S/. 500 nuevos solos al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, dinero que le servirá para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de verduras.
	
Su sueño es vender ropas en Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Activas II" [Active Women II] located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. She is 25 years and is in a committed relationship with no children. She has successfully finished middle school. 

Martha is a new member who will seek her first loan of 500 nuevos soles from the Manuela Ramos movement, money which she will use to increase the capital in her business of fruits and vegetables sales. 

Her dream is to sell clothes in Juliaca. The thing she likes the most about her communal bank is the ability to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To increase capital in her produce business

loans.name: Maxima Elvira

texts.es:
Máxima es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Patrón”, ubicado en el distrito Santiago de Pupuja, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con 02 hijos, la señora tiene estudios hasta 5to de educación secundaria.

Máxima viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, el primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le sirvió para incrementar el capital de su negocio venta de comida.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar carne, papa, arroz y otros insumos para su negocio venta de comida.

Su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos a ser profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maxima is a member of the communal bank "Santiago Patrón,” located in the Santiago de Pupuja district of Azángaro province in the department of Puno.  She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children.  She completed her secondary education through the 5th grade.

Maxima has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 2 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles.  She used that money to increase her capital in her business selling food.

Maxima will use the new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy meat, potatoes, rice and other supplies for her food sales business. 

Her dream is to help her children become professionals.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility of the members.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as: meat, potatoes, rice and other supplies for her business selling food

loans.name: Melessa Regis

texts.es:
Melessa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Clavelinas”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene18 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y sin hijos, tiene  grado de instrucción de secundaria completa.
Melessa  va empezar a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, La señorita solicitará un primer préstamo de de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que le servirá para empezar y tener su propio negocio de compra y venta de animales menores (cerdo).
 Su sueño es lograr que crezca su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es que tiene funcionamiento en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Melessa is a member of the “Mujeres Clavelinas” community bank which is in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 18 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She has completed her secondary education.

Melessa began working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She is requesting her first loan of 500 nuevos soles to set up and have her own business buying and selling young animals (pigs).

Her dream is to succeed in growing her business.

What she likes about her community bank is that it works in her community.

loans.use: To invest in her business of buying and selling young animals (pigs)

loans.name: 02.04.1.1 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Thao N. T. (1) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Thao is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02.04.1.1 Nam Ngan (02.04.1.1 Nam Ngan).


Thao is widowed and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Thao owns & operates a clothing business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing services to local community members.  Thao has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,200,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Thao joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thao has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thao plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Vien (3) is a 48-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  L. T. Xinh (4) is a 57-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  T. T. Manh (5) is a 66-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  L. T. Loan (6) is a 54-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thao N. T. (1) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Thao là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.04.1.1 Nam Ngan (02.04.1.1 Nam Ngan).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thao thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thao kiếm được khoảng 2.200.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Thao đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thao đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Vien (3) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  L. T. Xinh (4) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  T. T. Manh (5) là 66 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  L. T. Loan (6) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios O. is a married woman who lives in Prk 3, Brgy. Bunga, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: Sari-Sari (general) Store and motorcycle rental businesses. Her husband Fausto, who is 61 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are between 28 and 36 years old. 

Remedios joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Remedios has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 60,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to pay for more items for her sari-sari store inventory so that she can continue to save up for the future and to extend her store.

 Remedios O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira E. is a 42-year-old married woman and supports her family by operating one business venture: a Fish Vending business.  She lives in Purok 1, Brgy.Malabuhan, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Fish Vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000. Elvira is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can fund her fish selling.   This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elvira aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operation of Fish Selling

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie V. is 29 years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store and a food vending businesses. She lives in Railings, Brgy. Poog, Toledo City, Cebu.

Emelie has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and Food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.

Emelie is now borrowing PHP 14,000, so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Emelie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Being a loyal member of Kiva's first field partner in the Philippines (ASHI), Gloria D. has been receiving loans since 2000. Loans she received then have enabled her to start up and manage several businesses. First, she started a frozen foods business and with her next loans, she opened rice retail and slaughtering ventures. She sells her products directly to people in their village and in a public market. 

Now, Gloria is requesting another loan from ASHI to support her businesses and to grow them further until such time as they become profitable and stable. For her frozen foods business, she wants to increase the inventory for the convenience of her customers who live around their village. 

Gloria happily handles her career being a wife, mother and businesswoman. Her desire to give her only son, Roberto, a second year college student, a better life in the future inspired her to have her own businesses and augment her husband’s irregular income as construction worker (laborer). 

Gloria is one of the very good members of ASHI who is requesting a new loan of 42,000 Php to realize her dream of buying more inventory for her frozen foods business and more rice to sell. Profit from these kinds of businesses is quite good compared to other businesses that Gloria has tried. Because of profits she gained from these businesses, Gloria has been able to see her son graduate with a degree and with hopes of having a better career in the future. With her passion for giving her family a better future, Gloria will be willing to work hard and help her husband earn money through her businesses. 

Gloria D. is motivated by her desire for personal development so that one day she can be self-reliant in her businesses. Gloria enjoys the system of work groups that is implemented by ASHI. She has benefited from hearing about the experiences of her fellow group members and also appreciates that the process for securing a loan has been convenient for her. 

Her long-term goals are to have an expanded business and to have her own stall in Baras Market where she can execute orders for her customers, and to invest in her home. She hopes to buy a new tricycle in the future for added income for her family. A tricycle is a motorcycle with sidecar attached used as a public utility vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods and rice to sell.

loans.name: Estebana

texts.en:
Estebana G. has been enjoying spending the profits from her fishing business. Because of this she has been able to cover the needs of her three children and has able to make their lives quite a little improved. With that, Estebana is encouraged to work harder and aim further for her business and family because she has her own business to support their financial needs and loans she can access to support her business. Therefore, she wants to take this opportunity to grow her business by requesting another loan of 25,000 PHP from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. She wants to buy another fish cage (fish trap) and other raw materials needed for her fishing ventures.

Her long-term goals are to have a successful full-fledged fishing business, fund the education of her three children and support her family financially.  With the support of Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor. Estebana’s aspiration to give her family a better hope fuels her commitment to her venture.

loans.use: To buy another fish cage and raw materials needed for her fishing business

loans.name: Wilfredo's Group

texts.en: Wilfredo C. owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in his community. He is 43 years old, married and has two adult children. He is from the village of Buyon, Cauayan City, Isabela. Wilfredo has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Wilfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. Wilfredo is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Life is full of challenges and that is what makes people stronger and fonder. Like other woman, 38-year-old Jocelyn C. encounters many challenges in life brought about by poverty. Jocelyn is from Malabor, Tibiao, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Rene C., a fish vendor, and they have five children. Their eldest child is already 17 years old while the youngest is 7 years old. All of the children are still studying.

This family earns a living by buying and selling fish. They earn a small amount from the business, but sometimes their income is not enough to meet their basic needs because they do not have enough capital. Therefore, Jocelyn decided to join ASHI and borrow capital. She continued their business with capital of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Jocelyn is always inspired to improve the business because the children are studying. The support of her husband is always there. For her second loan from ASHI, she applied for 10,000 PHP and this will be used as additional capital for fish vending. Her greatest dream in life is to brighten the future of her children by sending them to school until they get a professional degree. She also wants to build a concrete house someday.

loans.use: For a fish vending business

loans.name: Asomidin

texts.ru: Чураев Асомидин проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование средне - специальное, шафер. Занимается перевозкой людей по маршруту Турсунзаде-Душанбе, Душанбе-Турсунзаде. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 2 года. Кредит берет для ремонта машины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Asomidin C. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda.  He is 49 years old.  He is married and has four children.  He has secondary education - his specialty is a driver.  He transports people across the route from Tursun-zoda to Dushanbe and back.  He has been in this business for two years.  He is taking out the loan to repair his car so he can provide a safe service.

loans.use: To repair the car

loans.name: Kikoni Ii Twetungure Group-Ibanda

texts.en:
Self-motivated and hardworking Frank M., aged 34, is a married father of two children aged 6 and 12 years. Frank has been operating a retail shop mainly selling consumer goods for home use in Kikoni trading centre, Ibanda, a business he started six years ago upon realizing the ready market in the area. At the end of every month he is able to pocket profits to the tune of 130,000 Ugandan shillings.

Frank's main limitation has been insufficient stock to meet customer demand, so he is now seeking a loan that will help him stock more goods to address this problem and also transform his enterprise into a big enterprise. Being very committed to conducting a business providing good customer care, he hopes to increase his sales revenue as he works toward achieving a self-sustaining life and catering to his children’s education expenses.

loans.use: The purchase of more goods to resell at his retail shop

loans.name: Katanda I Tukwatanise Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: G. Danson of Katanda I Tukwatanise group-Bushenyi is 32 years old and operates a general merchandise shop from his home area of Kanyashande, Bushenyi. He has operated the shop and also made agricultural produce sales to the local population for over 3 years. Alongside the retail shop he grows bananas, beans and more all that help him earn revenue. Danson makes 120,000 UGX per month; a figure he says will not substantially sustain his business for the near future. Therefore he is seeking a loan to help him purchase more goods to restock his shop and thus be able to make more sales.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for a general store

loans.name: Stone Quarry Development Group 1-Mukono

texts.en:
30-year-old T. Amos has been a member of the Stone Quarry-Mukono group for the past 5 years. Amos comes across as a gentleman with profound business acumen. His sense of diligence has been an indispensable attribute in these few years building a stone quarrying business. Amos credits his mother with encouraging him to start his business. His wife has been solid support in the business as well. 

Amos’ business has a broad base of clientele. He makes 200,000 UGX per month in profits. Amos is requesting a loan to buy more stones to supply to his increasing clientele.

loans.use: The purchase of more stones to resell to clients

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 27 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Richard owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income from his business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Richard wishes to keep his family happy and healthy and he works hard to achieve this.

Richard joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Richard is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to supplement his family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Stone Quarry Development Group 2-Mukono

texts.en: 46-year-old N. Alice belongs to the Stone Quarry Group-Mukono. This industrious woman has been building a stone quarrying enterprise for 10 years. Alice is married with 4 children. It’s with the persuasion of friends that she was able to embark on this business. Prior to this, she was selling charcoal. Her business generates 150,000 UGX weekly. With this loan, Alice says she is going to purchase more heavy-duty hammers to be used in the quarry.

loans.use: To purchase more heavy-duty hammers for work at the quarry

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema N. lives in the Kawempe Bubajwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Rehema has a retail business selling yellow bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years and works six days a week selling her products at the market. Rehema lives in a rented home that has electricity but no running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and rent. 

Rehema has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches and clusters of bananas. Her main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Rehema’s goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to farmers for yellow bananas.

loans.use: To buy bunches and clusters of bananas
